title: Frontend Developer
job_description:
Insomniac Design is a global digital agency headquartered in Washington D.C., with offices in London, Bucharest, and Chisinau. We’re an agile, determined, and innovative team organized by functional areas of expertise — Creative, Technology, Strategy, and Management. We specialize in human-centered design with deep focus on design thinking and digital transformation.

A Frontend Developer at Insomniac Design is responsible for developing responsive websites and applications to interpret our clients’ needs and to design solutions with high visual impact. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with the UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.
General Responsibilities:
Expected to collaborate and contribute effectively within a team environment.
Able to work towards achieving business goals without a predefined solution, showcasing adaptability and critical thinking skills.
Able to solve complex problems and understand interrelated processes within the job role scope.
Demonstrates the ability to create team-level processes and optimize existing processes.
Actively mentors junior team members, contributes to the hiring and performance management process, and provides valuable insights.
Technical Responsibilities:
Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Develop new user-facing features and maintain custom websites and applications.
Write high-quality reusable code to develop the dynamic user interface for various platforms.
Collaborate with front-end and backend developers to design and implement RESTful APIs and data exchange mechanisms.
Innovation in deliverables – show a strong desire and passion to implement new technologies to make the next project better than the last.
Skills & Experience:
3+ years experience performing responsive web development, including Object Oriented Design, developing clean, semantic, and valid code.
Proven track record of delivering software on time with a deep understanding of the software development life cycle.
Proficient in web markup, including HTML5 and CSS3, with a keen eye for UI and UX.
In-depth experience with at least one of the following technologies: ReactJS, CSS preprocessors, MaterialUI/Tailwind/Bootstrap.
Knowledge of object-oriented principles, design patterns, and best practices in software architecture.
Familiarity with Drupal theming system, including Twig templates, theme hooks, and preprocess functions.
Ability to work within Drupal’s layout builder and component-based design systems (e.g. Pattern Lab).
Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc.
Experience working on federal or public-sector web platforms or familiarity with U.S. Web Design System (USWDS) is a plus.
Experienced in implementing products, processes, automation, and improvements using industry best practices.
Strong experience with Git for version control, including feature branching, pull requests, and release taggingComfortable working in Agile environments and contributing to CI/CD pipelines.
Familiarity with front-end performance tools (e.g., Lighthouse, PageSpeed Insights), and techniques to optimize rendering, asset loading, and bundle sizeAbility to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced work environment.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Security & Clearance Requirements: This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust clearance. U.S. citizenship is required due to federal security screening guidelines.

title: Frontend Software Engineer, Cash App Core Experience
job_location: Remote in San Francisco Bay Area, CA
job_state: remote in san francisco bay area, ca
job_description:
It all started with an idea at Block in 2013. Initially built to take the pain out of peer-to-peer payments, Cash App has gone from a simple product with a single purpose to a dynamic ecosystem, developing unique financial products, including Afterpay/Clearpay, to provide a better way to send, spend, invest, borrow and save to our 50+ million monthly active customers. We want to redefine the world’s relationship with money to make it more relatable, instantly available, and universally accessible.

Today, Cash App has thousands of employees working globally across office and remote locations, with a culture geared toward innovation, collaboration and impact. We’ve been a distributed team since day one, and many of our roles can be done remotely from the countries where Cash App operates. No matter the location, we tailor our experience to ensure our employees are creative, productive, and happy.
The Role
The Web Marketing Platform team is focused on building tools to unlock creativity, and amplifying the expression and style that make Cash App unique. As a team, we span a broad spectrum of web development – from foundational frontend architecture and analytics pipelines, to the building blocks that power our services and content management systems. We are responsible for the homepage, product pages, and various online experiences.
As a software engineer, you will work with internal teams and external partners to regularly ship new marketing experiences while exploring business and growth opportunities.
Work from anywhere: This role can be performed from any location in the US.
You Will
Design, build and support the web development of our marketing experiences
Build highly accessible and beautiful web experiences that delight our users
Work cross-functionally and communicate with our product, design, and other engineering teams to support new services and experiences
Focus on all aspects of product quality, including in-depth metrics and monitoring
You Have
3+ years of software development or equivalent experience with expertise in web development
Proficiency creating readable, well-crafted, and maintainable code
Depth and breadth of experience crafting JavaScript applications
Experience working with other engineering teams and cross functional partners; product managers, business analysts, designers, and marketing teams.
A commitment to continuous improvement and learning from others along the way
A vested interest in advancing Cash App's vision of building for economic empowerment
Technologies We Use and Teach
Frontend: React, CSS, Preact, Javascript, Typescript, NextJS
Communication: HTTP, JSON, and Protocol Buffers
Server: Node, Java
We're working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is an equal opportunity employer evaluating all employees and job applicants without regard to identity or any legally protected class. We will consider qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records for employment in accordance with state and local laws and "fair chance" ordinances.
We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible.
While there is no specific deadline to apply for this role, U.S. roles are typically open for an average of 55 days before being filled by a successful candidate. Please refer to the date listed at the top of this job page for when this role was first posted.

Block takes a market-based approach to pay, and pay may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of four zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.

Zone A:
$180,000—$270,000 USD
Zone B:
$171,000—$256,600 USD
Zone C:
$162,000—$243,000 USD
Zone D:
$153,000—$229,600 USD
Every benefit we offer is designed with one goal: empowering you to do the best work of your career while building the life you want. Remote work, medical insurance, flexible time off, retirement savings plans, and modern family planning are just some of our offering.
Block, Inc. (NYSE: XYZ) builds technology to increase access to the global economy. Each of our brands unlocks different aspects of the economy for more people. Square makes commerce and financial services accessible to sellers. Cash App is the easy way to spend, send, and store money. Afterpay is transforming the way customers manage their spending over time. TIDAL is a music platform that empowers artists to thrive as entrepreneurs. Bitkey is a simple self-custody wallet built for bitcoin. Proto is a suite of bitcoin mining products and services. Together, we’re helping build a financial system that is open to everyone.

title: Lead Web Engineer
job_description:
We are looking for an experienced Lead Web Engineer to oversee the design, deployment, and management of web hosting infrastructure in Springfield, Massachusetts. This long-term contract to FTE position requires an individual with expertise in web systems, security, and cloud technologies to ensure reliable and secure web services. As a key member of the team, you will play an integral role in leading projects and managing team members while driving innovation in web infrastructure design and implementation.

Responsibilities:
Design, implement, and manage scalable web hosting environments across cloud and on-premises platforms, utilizing CI/CD pipelines in virtual machine and container environments.
Lead initiatives to automate, migrate, and consolidate distributed systems, including transitioning servers to cloud-based or on-premises environments such as Azure.
Provide leadership and mentorship to the web infrastructure team, fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous growth.
Develop and implement advanced web security measures, including encryption, attack mitigation, and vulnerability management, in line with industry standards.
Act as the Tier 3 escalation point for complex web infrastructure issues, ensuring prompt resolution and delivering root cause analyses.
Collaborate with developers, system administrators, and network engineers to support and enhance web applications and services.
Manage domain name system (DNS) configurations and ensure their integration within web infrastructure.
Automate routine infrastructure tasks using scripting tools and technologies such as Python and Ansible.
Monitor system performance and availability, proactively resolving issues and promoting continuous improvement.
Document infrastructure designs, operational procedures, and troubleshooting guides to support process improvements.
Minimum of five years of experience in web infrastructure engineering, with a strong background in Linux system administration (e.g., RHEL, Ubuntu).
Proven lead or supervisory experience, with the ability to guide and mentor technical teams.
Proficiency in cloud technologies, virtualization tools (e.g., VMware, Nutanix), and networking fundamentals such as TCP/IP, VPNs, and load balancers.
Expertise in web application stacks, including Apache, MySQL, and PHP, as well as scripting languages like Bash and Python.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, container technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes), and automation tools such as Ansible.
Strong understanding of web security practices, including SSL certificates, single sign-on, and web application firewalls.
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure, including hosting and DevOps practices.
Knowledge of content management systems like Drupal and WordPress, as well as monitoring tools such as Nagios and Prometheus.
Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do. ®

title: Web Developer
job_description:
Job Title: Web Developer
Location: Remote/Hybrid (Berkeley, CA)
Employment Type: Full-Time (40 hours/week, Monday–Friday)
Duration: 3–4 Month Contract (with potential extension based on funding and business needs)
Pay Rate: $60/hour + Benefits
Client: Bay Systems Consulting, in support of Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory (Berkeley Lab)
Position Overview:
Bay Systems Consulting is seeking a Web Developer to support the Human Resources Division at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory. This role is critical in rebuilding, modernizing, and maintaining the HR website infrastructure to improve user experience, platform alignment, content accuracy, and long-term sustainability. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated expertise in WordPress, website planning, cybersecurity-aware design, and collaboration with non-technical stakeholders.
Key Responsibilities:
Website Rebuilding & Maintenance
Lead the rebuilding of the HR website to enhance functionality, usability, and accessibility
Establish and implement a sustainable website maintenance plan
Remove outdated content and prevent its visibility via search engines
Conduct thorough testing and troubleshooting across browsers and platforms
Project Planning & Collaboration
Work closely with HR Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to translate content and functional needs into user-friendly web experiences
Develop a structured plan and production schedule for connecting and consolidating content across WordPress and Google Sites
Recommend platform assignments based on audience type: Public (WordPress), Lab Community, and Internal HR use
Create prototypes and seek SME feedback before full implementation, ensuring alignment with UX/UI and accessibility best practices
Provide guidance and consultation to HR SMEs throughout development and maintenance phases
Content Management & Platform Alignment
Organize and manage HR content tailored for both public-facing and internal audiences
Modify existing pages, content access levels, and update site structures as needed
Ensure all web content is accurate, current, and accessible
Compliance, Design & Visual Identity
Align all HR web pages with Berkeley Lab’s visual standards, branding guidelines, and cybersecurity policies
Assist with building HR web templates consistent with Lab-approved graphics
Leverage visual assets for web presentations (e.g., PowerPoint, Google Slides)
Provide regular updates to HR management regarding IT requirements and web compliance changes
Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Proven experience developing and maintaining websites within cybersecurity-constrained environments
Proficiency with WordPress and Google Sites
Strong grasp of UX/UI principles, accessibility standards, and content architecture
Ability to manage full development cycles including conceptualization, design, testing, and rollout
Comfortable working with and guiding non-technical stakeholders
Familiarity with compliance requirements in a research or government-affiliated environment
Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to meet competing deadlines
General graphic design proficiency for banners, templates, and basic web visuals
Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
Education & Experience Requirements:
3-7 years of experience in professional web development
Demonstrated experience creating, managing, and maintaining websites with a focus on UX/UI
Experience working across both public and internal web platforms, particularly with WordPress and Google Sites

job_description:

Corporate Tools is hiring a Front-End Web Developer to help build, optimize, and maintain our web applications. This role is a full-time, remote position. We are looking for someone with strong Front-End Development expertise, the ability to drive UI/UX execution, and a commitment to delivering high-quality, user-focused applications. You will contribute to our core codebase, documentation, and Front-End architecture, ensuring usability, accessibility, and performance.
You’ll need to be able to operate in a WordPress-heavy environment. This will include PHP, SCSS, JS, maybe a little Vue (but we are okay with React too), as well as some other front-end frameworks. The ideal candidate won’t be afraid to jump in and figure things out.. while being guided by a great team of developers when you get stuck. You’ll be the type that hates the standard themes that come from a site-builder tool and instead like crafting your own themes from scratch. If this sounds like your cup of Joe (or Mike) then we want to speak with you!

$90,000-$95,000/Year DOE

title: Full Stack Web Developer
job_description:
About TopDog Law (TDL)
TopDog Law is revolutionizing legal marketing with a bold, outside-the-box approach. Founded in 2018 by James Helm, our firm has achieved 200-300% year-over-year growth, making us one of the fastest-growing legal brands in the country. With high-performing digital strategies, viral organic content, and data-driven marketing, we’re setting new industry standards.

Ranked No. 187 on the Inc. 5000 list, TopDog Law is just getting started. As we expand our reach, we’re seeking a Full Stack Web Developer to join the team.

About the role

We’re looking for a hands-on Web Developer to join our fast-growing Marketing team. You’ll be responsible for maintaining, optimizing, and enhancing our website, landing pages, and webforms to support lead generation, brand visibility, and client engagement. You’re someone who thrives at the intersection of marketing and technology—equally excited by clean code and clean UX.

This role is ideal for someone who loves bringing marketing campaigns to life on the web, is obsessed with performance and usability, and enjoys collaborating across teams to deliver high-impact web experiences.

What you'll do

Ensure proper tracking, tagging, and performance monitoring using tools like Google Tag Manager, Google Search Console, and Google Analytics
Build and optimize web pages, landing pages, and campaign microsites that support lead generation and marketing campaigns.
Leverage tools such as Unbounce to build and deploy landing pages
Full-stack development experience with frontend frameworks (React, Vue) and backend technologies (e.g., Node.js, PHP, C#), enabling seamless end-to-end web solutions and third-party integrations
Manage and improve marketing-related webforms to maximize conversions and ensure seamless data flow; integrate forms into the relevant portions of the website and other channels
Maintain and update the company website to ensure it’s secure, fast & responsive, and performing at its best
Collaborate with designers, content creators, and marketers to implement digital assets and ensure brand consistency
Integrate the website with marketing and sales tools (e.g., Salesforce, etc.)
Troubleshoot bugs, address technical issues, and continuously seek opportunities to improve UX and site performance
Stay current on web development best practices, SEO, and marketing technologies
Develop and implement experiments to improve conversion on the site

Qualifications
2-5 years of experience as a Web Developer, preferably in a marketing or digital agency environment
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Experience with CMS platforms (WordPress, Webflow, Drupal, etc.)
Familiarity with Jotform and other webform tools
Knowledge of SEO best practices and web performance optimization
Familiarity with Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and marketing automation platforms
Comfortable working with APIs and integrating third-party tools
Strong eye for design and UX with attention to detail
Ability to work cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment
Experience with A/B testing tools, landing page builders, accessibility standards, or basic design skills (e.g., Figma, Adobe XD, Unbounce, Optimizely)
Excellent communication skills to present findings to non-technical stakeholders
Detail-oriented and proactive in identifying opportunities for optimization

What We Offer
Competitive compensation
Medical, dental, and vision insurance
Remote working environment in EST.
Company-paid life insurance
401(k) with company match
Opportunity to be part of an elite, fast-growing legal brand

The pay range for this role is:
80,000 - 100,000 USD per year(Remote (United States))

Software Engineer, 2
Job Description
We are looking for a developer with strong interest in Performance Engineering and a drive to excel at improving our observation telemetry, optimizing our custom framework, “Globe”, researching best practices and advocating for each of these throughout the engineering organization. This role requires a drive to build skills in infrastructure management and developer relations in addition to platform development.
We are looking for a Software Engineer, 2 with a demonstrated track record of innovative thinking, technical mastery, and peer guidance on our Vertical Brands. You will work in a collaborative Agile environment as well as realizing these ideas in code. You will also be improving high-visibility, interactive features on some of our most highly-ranked pages. These features will form an important part in some of our most prominent sites that span across more than 20 brands and reach more than 100 million users each month.

Develop responsive and elegant cross-platform functionality in our custom server-side component framework, built on Java but leveraging SCSS, Freemarker templates, and ES6 on the front-end, with VueJS increasingly used for more interactive components.

Keep up with new technologies and approaches to solve problems and improve existing systems.
Work directly with designers, QA, and our back-end developers in a dedicated scrum team to fully realize the product vision.
Participate in a well-oiled 2 week agile system to continuously add new features & functionality to the business.

2+ years building interactive web applications as a front-end or full-stack developer
You should have a demonstrated track record of technical proficiency with HTML, vanilla Javascript, and CSS/SCSS, ideally with a portfolio and/or examples of work in Github
Willingness to learn new technologies and grow as a developer

The Digital Marketing Recruiters
Digital Marketing Recruiters has been in the digital marketing and recruitment space for over 25 years. We work with highly skilled marketing, digital marketing, and sales professionals and match them with our clients from diverse industries across the United States. Our selection process incorporates comprehensive resume screening, shortlisting, conducting video-recorded interviews and providing client information, administering written assessments (if required by the client), arranging client interviews, and facilitating job offers and placements.
The Client
The client is a successful, reputable, and profitable multimedia company looking to grow and expand their digital marketing division.
The Role
This dual-role position blends front-end web design and development skills with technical SEO expertise. You will be responsible for designing user-friendly, responsive websites while implementing technical SEO best practices to drive visibility, performance, and search rankings.
Key Responsibilities
Web Development and Design
Design and develop responsive, modern websites using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and WordPress (or other CMS platforms).
Translate UI/UX designs into functional web pages.
Ensure cross-browser compatibility and mobile-first performance.
Collaborate with content, design, and marketing teams to build conversion-optimized landing pages.

Technical SEO
Conduct technical SEO audits and implement fixes (e.g., crawl issues, page speed, structured data, indexing, broken links).
Optimize site architecture, URL structures, internal linking, and schema markup.
Monitor and improve site speed using tools like Google PageSpeed Insights, GTmetrix, and Lighthouse.
Ensure proper implementation of tags, metadata, robots.txt, canonical tags, and sitemaps.
Collaborate with content and analytics teams to align on SEO strategy and performance reporting.

2–4 years of experience in front-end web development/design AND technical SEO.
Proficiency with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and WordPress (Shopify, Webflow, or other CMS experience is a plus).
Experience using SEO tools such as SEMrush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, Google Search Console, and GA4.

Understanding of UX/UI best practices.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to identify and solve problems.
Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines independently.

Experience with Git, version control, or deployment workflows.
Familiarity with server-side rendering, headless CMS, or JavaScript frameworks (React, Vue).
Graphic design experience with Adobe XD, Figma, or Photoshop.

Basic knowledge of accessibility (WCAG) standards.

title: Website Support Specialist
job_description:
As our Website Support Specialist, you'll be the hands-on expert managing the performance, functionality, and visual quality of websites we build and host for media partners. You'll focus on web maintenance and technical support, ensuring our WordPress sites remain operational and optimized for clients. As the primary contact for troubleshooting web issues and managing critical updates, you must be able to work independently and solve problems efficiently. Please note this job is 100% remote however you must live in the DFW area for occasional team meetups.
What You’ll Be Doing
Website Maintenance & Updates
Perform daily content updates, design edits, and partner-requested modifications.
Implement SEO best practices (e.g., meta descriptions, title tags, content formatting) as guided by our SEO team to enhance web performance.
Technical Web Support & Troubleshooting
Independently diagnose and resolve website issues, including bug fixes, plugin conflicts, and site errors.
Provide essential technical support to internal teams (e.g., Market Support, Content) related to website functionality and performance.
Serve as the primary point of contact for our WP Engine support team for hosting-related or deeper technical challenges.
Website Launch & Hosting Management
Manage WP Engine accounts, including domain setups and DNS configurations.
Coordinate smooth site migrations and go-lives for new or updated partner websites.
Tracking & Analytics Implementation
Accurately install and verify tracking scripts, including Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and other necessary pixels.
Qualifications
2-3 years of hands-on WordPress experience, specializing in website maintenance, updates, and troubleshooting.
Proficiency with WP Engine, Elementor, and core web hosting fundamentals.
Proven ability to independently diagnose and resolve website issues (e.g., plugin conflicts, server errors).
Familiarity with DNS, domain management, and installing tracking scripts (e.g., Google Analytics, Tag Manager).
A strong eye for web design, with experience using template-based systems and Elementor frameworks.
Understanding of UI/UX design principles and responsive web best practices.
Strong organizational skills, meticulous attention to detail, and effective time management in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


Who We Are
At Infinite Digital, we're on a mission to strengthen the relationships our media partners have with businesses by providing personalized and effective digital, creative, and public relations services. Our focus is on relationships first. As a digital marketing fulfillment house, we operate behind the scenes, ensuring seamless execution and delivery. Our partners—be they marketing consultants, local businesses, or large radio conglomerates—come to us to confidently sell digital marketing solutions to their clients.
What We Offer
Medical, dental, and vision benefits
401k with matching
Complementary health advocate services such as legal, medical billing, and work-life balance services

Career growth opportunities

Involved in end-to-end implementation of .net applications in an agile environment.
Experience developing applications using Git.
Strong architectural and design skills with the ability to formulate solutions based on client requirements.
Good understanding of Visual Studio IDE.
Ability to diagnose end-user problems and prescribe the right solutions using the appropriate combination of tools and technologies.
Comprehensive understanding of object-oriented and service-oriented application development techniques and theories.
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written.
Employment Type
Permanent
No. Of Positions
4

We have flexible hours, enough time off, and breathtaking events. A healthy work-life balance is valued here.
Deliver excellence from anywhere you want. You won’t be penalized for operating out of office.
23 days of work. 8 holidays. It’s time to take a vacation, pursue your favourite hobby or time with family & friends.
Great work requires great tools. If you need something to do the job, we will get it right away for you.
100% coverage of health insurance and quality healthcare initiatives for our employees and their families.
A gym to stay fit, contests to win bucks, events to celebrate, a football ground, a cricket stadium, and what not!
Best Work: Meaningful, Exciting
At Vofox, your colleagues will include the industry’s biggest thinkers, talented grads, and everyone in between. You’ll work with new technologies and solve original problems. You’ll find that management is approachable, flexibility is accepted, and work-life balance is promoted.
We also give employees the space to be who they are and the support to become who they want to be.
Pride: To Be A Vofoxian
There is a lot to be proud of when you have the Vofox “V” on your badge, and our ability to transform how people and companies tell their stories.
Our advantages go beyond compensation and perks to take great care of you. Our programs are designed to enrich your future while giving you more fun.
Live Well: Healthy, Happy
At Vofox, we know that health is more than doctor visits and life is much more than work. That’s why we go beyond generous medical, dental, and vision benefits for you and your family.
Into yoga or working out with a trainer? You’ll get wellness reimbursements. Feeling stressed? Our employee assistance team is here to help. Best of all, you get healthy snacks and chef-worthy food in our own cafeteria.

You love a varied
workday
You never back down from
a challenge
You take initiative
You are fundamentally
curious
A Little About Us
We pioneered Kochi, the Queen of the Arabian Sea, and have powered world-changing innovation ever since. Today, we’re advancing AI, automation, IoT, data science, and more to solve humanity’s greatest challenges and make the world healthier, safer, and smarter. Some of the most knowledgeable and hard-working people in the technology industry work here.
Meaningful Work
You’ll be complemented with competitive compensation & benefits that enable you to live your best life. Whatever makes you comfortable – we are most certainly not a suit & tie company.
Exciting Job
With a career with us, you’ll always find a new challenge that excites you. We work with clients from different countries and niches so you have all the chances to tackle interesting problems every time you work with a project.
Smart People
At Vofox, you’ll be working with the best minds in technology. Together, we can build great software. For our highest achievers across all departments – recognition and appreciation from both leadership & peers.
Work Happier
Vofox is a place where honesty is celebrated, uniqueness encouraged, and you are seen. You will be able to communicate with the client directly, helping us keep our remote-first culture alive.
Be Seen. Be Yourself. Be Valued.
Right Environment
No matter if you work in the office, remotely, or at a client’s location. We will ensure that we collaborate well and provide you with the right environment and tools to excel at your job.
Virtual
Great ideas come from anywhere. We're entering a new era of work, one that will see more of our day-to-day tasks taking place in a virtual environment, and we're adapting to embrace this change.
Beloved Workplace
We are all about infinite opportunities for everyone. Employee satisfaction is a critical success factor in our business. We have been building a place where people love to come to work.
Growth
We encourage you to identify your training goals. Then we help you exceed them. Your path will include on-the-job training, trainee programs, and individual coaching from managers.
#vofox #vofoxsolutions

Our Hiring Process
By the end of 2021, Vofox had consolidated its selection process and had received over 10,000 candidate applications, hiring only the Top 1% of IT Talent.
We need people who share our beliefs. This culture has been instrumental to our success and helped us to build a stunning team that thrives in an environment of freedom and responsibility.
Our collaborative interview process provides an opportunity for you to showcase your skills and talents and to help you understand Vofox’s culture. Throughout the hiring process, we encourage you to ask questions about the position and our culture to help determine whether Vofox is right for you.

title: Web Developer
job_description:
Summary
This is a great opportunity to join a growing team and help grow multiple brands through marketing initiatives. This position will be responsible for supporting EBQ’s clients through website/email development, optimization, and maintenance.

Position Responsibilities
Create website layouts/user interfaces by using standard HTML/CSS/JavaScript best practices
Work with designers to develop designs into website elements
Implement responsive web design across devices (desktop, mobile, tablets) and web browsers
Work with the content team to implement Search Engine Optimization (SEO) strategies and review all web-related analytics
Optimize landing pages for digital marketing purposes
Develop emails and templates that are responsive across email clients and devices
Create and maintain documentation
Troubleshoot, test, and maintain websites to ensure optimal security and functionality
Efficiently test and troubleshoot issues as problems arise
Assist the marketing team in various integrated communication and marketing activities
Consistently achieve or exceed monthly target(s) established by supervisor
Retain training and direction from management
Adhere to company policies and values
Work effectively in a collaborative work environment and professionally represent EBQ to clients
Perform other duties as assigned

Minimum Qualifications
Highly motivated and disciplined self-starter with excellent oral and written communication skills
Highly knowledgeable of web development fundamentals, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Understanding of responsive design and browser testing tools
Strong troubleshooting skills and a problem-solving mindset
Reliability and strong work ethic
A willingness to constantly learn
Process-oriented

Proficiency in the following areas is desirable but not required
Proficiency with content management systems (CMS) such as WordPress, HubSpot, Drupal, and/or Webflow. Open to learning other CMS and page builders as needed
Ability to administer and manage websites using hosting providers such as WPEngine, GoDaddy, Bluehost, or DreamHost
Experience with PHP and WordPress webhooks
Relational databases (SQL/MySQL)
Understanding of user experience/user interface principles
Understanding of email marketing platforms (i.e., HubSpot, Pardot, Mailchimp, etc.)
Experience with e-commerce (i.e., WooCommerce/Shopify)
Adobe Suite (XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.)
Project management software
CDN integrations (Cloudflare)
Version control (GitHub)
Website optimization (speed, accessibility, security, etc.)

Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms. Must be able to lift 15 pounds at times.

EBQ is an equal opportunity employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, sexual orientation, citizenship status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, compensation, benefits, training, termination, promotions, or any other condition of employment or career development. No visa sponsorship is available for this position.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact 512-637-9696 for assistance.

title: Full Stack Developer (React Native, React, Node)
job_description:
YO.Ventures (https://www.yo.ventures/) is a fast-moving product studio and the sister company of Peachy (https://www.wearepeachy.com/).
We launch and grow impactful digital products across industries — from mobile consumer apps to SaaS platforms and branded commerce experiences.
We're now looking for a full-time remote Full Stack Engineer (React, React Native, Node.js) to join our distributed team. You'll work closely with design and product to build beautiful, performant apps and web applications. This is a hands-on role where your technical decisions will directly shape the success of each product.
➖ What You'll Need to Succeed:
3+ years of experience building production-ready React Native apps.
Strong full-stack engineering background (Node.js, Firebase, PostgreSQL, REST APIs).
Experience with TypeScript, scalable architecture, and component-based design.
Familiarity with Git, automated deployment flows, and CI/CD pipelines.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
Clear written and verbal communication skills ( Upper Intermediate English proficiency required).
Bonus: Experience with Next.js, Stripe, Shopify API.
➖ What You'll Do:
Build and maintain cross-platform mobile apps using React Native (Expo + TypeScript).
Contribute to both front-end and back-end codebases using Node.js, Firebase, Supabase, and PostgreSQL.
Integrate third-party APIs, payment systems like Stripe, and auth flows.
Collaborate with the design team (Figma) to translate UI into production-ready components.
Ship MVPs, validate with users, and iterate based on real feedback.
Support deployment processes using CI/CD pipelines via GitHub Actions.
Maintain a clean, scalable architecture with testable, well-documented code.
Optimize app performance across devices (iOS & Android).
➖ What You'll Get at YO.Ventures:
The opportunity to work on multiple ambitious digital products from day one.
A collaborative, remote-first environment with a lean and talented team.
Flexible working hours and full autonomy over your schedule.
Competitive compensation + regular performance reviews.
Access to paid training, tech courses, and professional development resources.
Direct involvement in the product vision, roadmap, and tech stack decisions.
Work on meaningful projects in diverse verticals like finance, eCommerce, wellness, and productivity.
Clear growth opportunities and a long-term path with a supportive team.
A culture that values speed, ownership, experimentation — and kindness.
If you're ready to build high-quality digital — apply now and let's create something great together.

title: Software Engineer, Full-Stack
job_description:
About Owner.com
Owner is the all-in-one platform that restaurants use to succeed online.

Thousands of restaurant owners use our tools to build their website, drive online orders, create their own branded app, manage their customer relationships, and set up marketing automations.

You can think of it as Shopify meets HubSpot, but specifically for restaurants.

Learn more about the problems we are solving for our customers here.

Our vision
We’re starting by helping independent restaurants succeed online.

But it’s not just restaurants that need our help. Most local businesses are struggling with these same problems. Huge technology corporations are taking their customers, bleeding their profits, and making it hard for them to survive.

Once we nail the solution for restaurants – we’ll scale it into every other local business type.

In the future we envision, tens of millions of local business owners will use our technology to succeed in the digital age.

Our traction
In just over 3 years we've generated tens of millions in revenue, served millions of guests, and processed hundreds of millions of online orders.

More importantly, we’ve helped thousands of restaurant owners save their businesses - and not only survive, but thrive.

Our team
Our team grew from under 100 to nearly 200 talented people in 2024. We’ve got top talent from the most successful companies in SMB software, including: Shopify, HubSpot, DoorDash, ServiceTitan, Rappi, Faire and Stripe.

We’ll be scaling even faster in 2025 to keep pace with our customer growth.

Where we work
Owner is a remote-first, global company headquartered in San Francisco, with a sales hub in Toronto. For a few of our roles we prioritize in-person collaboration at one of our office locations. Most of our teammates are distributed throughout the globe. Please review the role description and discuss with your recruiter for more details on location!

Why we’re looking for you
We are looking for a mission-driven engineer who is passionate about their craft and committed to building incredible products for our customers.

This role is 100% remote and can be based anywhere in the United States or Canada. For San Francisco-based candidates: we have a new HQ in the Presidio for optional in-person collaboration opportunities!

Our Tech Stack:
Frontend: [React, Next.js, Vue]
Backend: [Node.js, Mongo]
Typescript everywhere
The impact you will have
Build new products and features 0 to 1
Take ownership of projects from conception all the way to shipping
Deliver value to our end users across our entire system
Shape our product direction by talking to users and collaborating with other teammates in feature brainstorms/roadmap planning
Help us build a great team — interview candidates, refer great engineers, etc.
✅ What we’re looking for
3+ years of experience building applications
Typescript experience
Experience scaling with frontend stack (React, Next.js, etc.) and/or our backend stack (Nodejs, Mongo, AWS)
Experience at product-focused startup/scale-up or technology company
High degree of cross-functional collaboration and leadership. Product managers, designers and business leaders from past roles would speak positively and highly of you
Strong sense of ownership, excellent communication, and a proactive mindset
Pay and benefits
The estimated starting base salary range for this role is $140K-180K depending on level, location and experience, plus a generous pre-IPO equity package
Other benefits include comprehensive health coverage, work from anywhere (remote-first workplace), unlimited PTO - plus extra fun perks!

Notice - Employment Scams
Communication from our team regarding job opportunities will only be made by an Owner team member with an @owner.com email address.
We do not conduct interviews over email or chat platforms, and we will never ask you to provide personal or financial information such as your mailing address, social security number, credit card numbers or banking information. If you believe you are being contacted by scammer, please mark the communication as "phishing" or “spam” and do not respond.

title: Senior Software Engineer – iOS (Swift)
job_description:
Created in 2002 by Marc Eckō, Complex is a leading global youth entertainment network showcasing the evolution of major pop culture categories, including streetwear and style, music, sneakers, and sports. Complex is a juggernaut in the content and culture space, delivering unprecedented global reach.

Complex is the world’s definitive cultural commerce, content, and experiential platform. We have created an all-new operating system built for the next generation, seamlessly integrating discovery, inspiration, community, and shopping. The company represents an expansion of the original vision with a deep understanding of convergence culture and its impact on contemporary society.

Whether through video, long-form editorial, or social content, Complex tells stories that engage dynamic conversation with our communities. Our internet-breaking cover stories document the heroes of culture and take them to the next level through product collaboration and shoppability.

Complex has become experts in creating immersive environments at our IRL experiences and cultural events. ComplexCon is our flagship festival bringing together the world’s most influential brands and artists for an unforgettable weekend of style, sneakers, art, design, food, music, inspiration and more.

Join us to help redefine the way people shop, while building a global marketplace that moves at the speed of culture. Complex is committed to building a high performing team that is passionate about what they do and the communities we serve.

Everyone at Complex truly believes in the company and its mission; it’s a requirement for working here. There is synergy within the teams that make Complex what it is, a well-oiled machine. Employees are at the forefront of the company's success because every one of us is given the opportunity to provide suggestions, feedback, and direction.
About the Role
We're looking for a Senior iOS Engineer to help us elevate Complex’s mobile-first strategy. You’ll lead ongoing native app development for iOS, focusing on performance, scalability, and a seamless experience that connects content and commerce.
What You'll Do
Lead feature development in our iOS app, written in Swift, supporting commerce and editorial use cases.
Architect reusable components and patterns that scale across modules and teams.
Collaborate with backend and API engineers to integrate new services into the app.
Proactively improve app performance, startup time, and overall user experience.
Implement analytics, A/B testing, and experimentation frameworks to iterate on features.
Review pull requests, help refine technical specs, and mentor junior mobile engineers.
Triage and resolve bugs, crashes, and performance regressions using real-time observability tools.
Stay current with iOS trends, Apple updates, and evolving platform best practices.
Who you are
5+ years of professional experience building iOS applications.
Deep knowledge of Swift and iOS SDKs.
Experience integrating with backend APIs and third-party services.
Strong understanding of mobile app architecture and Apple HIG.
Familiarity with app performance tooling and mobile observability.
Bonus Points if…
Experience with eCommerce or content delivery apps.
Background in integrating native apps with headless CMS or Shopify.
Familiarity with CI/CD for mobile development.
Experience leading or mentoring other mobile engineers.
What we Offer
Best in class health, dental, and vision insurance
Healthcare FSA
Dependent Care FSA
Commuter Benefits FSA
Short-term/long-term disability and life insurance
Paid Parental leave
401k with 4% match
Pet Insurance
Legal and Identity Theft Plans
Vacation time and sick days

The Pay Range, which consists of salary and commission, for this position is listed. Actual pay will vary based on factors including, but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Complex Total Rewards offerings for employees.
We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

The above statements cover what are generally believed to be principal and essential functions of the job. Specific circumstances may allow or require some incumbents assigned to the job to perform a different combination of duties.
Complex participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.

title: Sr. Full Stack Developer (Vue.js expert)
job_description:
Title: Senior Full Stack Developer (Vue.js Expert)
Schedule: Monday to Friday, Business Hours
Location: Remote
Reports to: VP of Transaction Operations
Position Summary:
LPT Realty is seeking a Senior Full Stack Developer with deep expertise in Vue.js and modern JavaScript to lead the development of highly-performant, scalable user interfaces and full-stack applications. While this is a full-stack role, the focus is heavily front-end driven, making it ideal for a developer who thrives on building polished, elegant, and accessible web experiences. You will collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and engineers to deliver innovative technology solutions that support and scale our fast-growing real estate operations.
Key Responsibilities:
Architect and build Vue.js applications with reusable, efficient, and testable components (preferably using Vue 3 + Composition API).
Design and implement modular and scalable UI components with a focus on performance, accessibility, and responsiveness.
Extend and integrate custom JavaScript libraries to enhance front-end functionality.
Collaborate with designers to translate UI/UX designs into pixel-perfect implementations.
Lead the development and deployment of full-stack applications, including front-end features and back-end API integrations.
Work with RESTful APIs and asynchronous data flows to ensure seamless user experiences.
Conduct code reviews, refactor legacy code, and promote best practices across the front-end architecture.
Provide mentorship to junior developers and assist in driving engineering excellence.
Stay up to date with the Vue ecosystem and front-end trends to continuously raise the bar for our UI stack.
Required Qualifications:
5+ years of professional experience in full-stack development, with significant focus on front-end development.
Vue.js expert, (preferably Vue 3 with Composition API)
Must be U.S. based
Advanced JavaScript (ES6+) and experience with modern frameworks and libraries.
Solid knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, responsive design, and accessibility best practices.
Experience with Pinia (or Vuex) for state management.
Proficient with modern tooling and build systems (Vite, Webpack, npm/yarn).
Strong Git skills and collaborative development workflow experience.
Proven experience integrating and managing RESTful APIs and complex asynchronous processes.
Familiarity with back-end development using SQL/MySQL and building custom APIs.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Adobe ColdFusion, Angular, and microservices architecture.
Exposure to cloud platforms and CI/CD tools such as AWS (EC2, Lambda, S3, etc.) and Azure DevOps.
Knowledge of jQuery for legacy code maintenance.

Why Join LPT Realty?
Be a key player in one of the fastest-growing real estate brokerages in the country. LPT Realty is at the forefront of real estate innovation—leveraging cutting-edge technology, scalable systems, and AI tools to transform the industry.

Job Summary:
Toly Digital Networks, a customer focused and driven company, is seeking Class 4 / 5 softswitch engineers to help develop and support our Cloud Switch Architecture. Ideal candidate must have a working knowledge of Class 4 / 5 switch management, dial plans and customer VoIP services (residential & PBX). NetSapiens experience or knowledge a plus. Your softswitch experience, overall Unified Communications knowledge, and ability to build strong Customer relationships, will help Toly continue to grow and support the needs of our Customers.
Engineer general responsibility:
· Assist in the design, implementation, and management of cloud-based Class 4 / 5 softswitch platform and related network components.
· Test, implement, maintain custom VoIP based infrastructure.
· Coordinate and facilitate Hosted Voice services for resellers and enterprise users. Pre and Post testing of systems and equipment.
· Working directly with the Engineering team and customers to debug and troubleshoot issues gathering needed information and performing investigative activities.
· Taking on customer reported issues. Helping to prioritize and set importance on changes affecting all clients.
· Assist in design of version rollout instructions and new feature documentation.
· Monitor, verify and notify voice/data network and alarms.
· Work independently with minimal guidance and demonstrate a sense of urgency for customer impacting issues.
· This position is interactive, and responsible for serving our customers. Regular and predictable job attendance is an essential function of this position.
· Willingness to operate in engineering as well as support roles when required.
· Willingness to travel in United States
The Ideal Engineer Should Possess Following:
· 3+ years of experience
· Class 4/5 Softswitch experience (Netsapians knowledge a plus)
· Unified Communications, VOIP, Video, and SIP technologies
· Dial Plan and Dial Translation development and management
· Cloud computing technologies and concepts
· Network routers, switches, systems, and tools
· Knowledge and understanding of Wireshark usage in troubleshooting voice issues
· Specific in-depth knowledge of Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) and related network protocols
· Ability and desire to take on challenging and previously unknown/unsolved problems
· Understanding of legacy voice infrastructure and call routing methods
· Understanding of software version control methodologies and applications
· Experience with Unix operating systems
· Database systems. (MySQL a plus)
· A strong familiarity with Linux utilities a plus
· Strong organizational and time management skills
· Excellent verbal and written communication skills
· Team player with a positive attitude
Closing
Now that you have read all the qualifications, experience, and expectations of the job, consider a closing thought:
We are a family-owned business with over 30 years of growth and success. And proud of it. If you are serious about an opportunity to be part of a company with a unique culture, outstanding benefits, and desire to really be part of its success, then consider applying. If you are someone interested in a lasting future with appreciation and growth, we may be that fit. If you are someone that is serious about solving problems and helping customers, we may be that fit.
Thank you for considering this opportunity.

title: Senior Software Engineer
job_description:
Senior Software Engineer (MTS, Core Open-Source Contributor)
About DreamLayer AI
DreamLayer is an open-source Stable Diffusion UI that feels as familiar as Automatic1111 but runs on a modern React front-end with a Python and ComfyUI back-end. Our public code release is scheduled for 1 July 2025.
We’re looking for a full-time Software Engineer who is passionate about GenAI and cares deeply about open-source. You’ll collaborate closely with the founding team to build infrastructure, backend systems, and developer tools that power the next generation of AI creativity.
You’ll take ownership of key features, help scale our infrastructure, and actively contribute to our open-source codebase.
Responsibilities
Design, build, and ship our DreamLayer Stable Diffusion plug-in and extension ecosystem
Build and optimize ComfyUI graphs for new model presets
Extend our Flask and FastAPI back-end (job queuing, model hot-reload, telemetry)
Package one-click desktop builds (Electron/Tauri) and Docker images for cloud GPUs
Define IaC and CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions → AWS / GCP / Azure)
Profile and accelerate inference (CUDA, TensorRT or vLLM where appropriate)
Develop and integrate APIs to enhance application functionality and connectivity.
Review community PRs, write RFCs, and mentor first-time OSS contributors
Requirements
3+ years of experience with Python (FastAPI, Flask, asyncio, PyTest)
3+ years working with React + TypeScript (hooks, state management, Tailwind or similar)
Deep familiarity with Stable Diffusion ecosystem (ComfyUI, A1111, or Forge UI) including custom nodes, LoRA, and ControlNet
Strong hands-on experience with Docker, GitHub Actions, and cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, or Azure (GPU instances, ECS, Cloud Run, AKS, etc.)
Production experience shipping GenAI or ML inference workloads at scale
Nice to Have
Familiarity with Kubernetes GPU autoscaling or job scheduling
Background running multi-cloud or hybrid GPU fleets
Experience with observability tools like Prometheus, Grafana, or Loki
History of OSS contribution, RFCs, or community moderation
You worked at a fast-paced, high-growth tech startup before or are extremely excited about being in one.

Apply here

title: Senior AI Engineer
job_description:
About the Role:
We are a fast-moving startup seeking a highly skilled Senior Software / AI Engineer to lead the design, development, and deployment of scalable software systems with integrated artificial intelligence components. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to architect intelligent solutions using large language models (LLMs), vector databases, speech-to-text technologies, and real-time AI applications with modern backend and frontend frameworks.
Key Responsibilities:
Design and implement production-grade AI pipelines, including LLM integration and vector-based retrieval (e.g., RAG systems).
Develop scalable APIs using Python-based frameworks such as FastAPI or Flask.
Lead development efforts in building front-end applications using React and TypeScript.

Familiarity with vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, Weaviate, FAISS) and embedding models.

Experience with speech-to-text (STT) models or audio transcription services.
Exposure to Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems or semantic search frameworks.
Experience in privacy-first environments, handling sensitive data securely.
Knowledge of data compliance frameworks (GDPR, CCPA, etc.).

Opportunity to influence the architecture of a next-generation AI product.
A culture of inclusion, innovation, and personal growth.

title: FREELANCE HTML DEVELOPER WITH VEEVA
job_description:
Location: Bridgewater, New Jersey
Job Type: Contract
Compensation Range: $60 - 70 per hour

We are seeking a skilled HTML Developer with proven experience building Interactive Visual Aids (IVAs) and DSAs in Veeva for a pharmaceutical client. This is a critical role supporting the development of multichannel content for Veeva CLM platforms. The ideal candidate has hands-on experience coding content that adheres to Veeva standards and deploying assets using Veeva's CLM media library and metadata configuration.

Mandatory Requirement: Candidates must have prior experience building IVAs/DSAs within Veeva CRM.

Hours: 10 hours per week but likely to ramp up in Q4

Responsibilities:
Build and deploy interactive HTML5-based Veeva IVAs and DSAs (Approved Email, CLM, CVA) optimized for reps using iPads and other devices.
Develop modules that follow Veeva best practices for CLM content, including proper folder structure, metadata tagging, and version control.
Collaborate with medical, legal, regulatory (MLR/PRC) teams to ensure Veeva-compliant submissions.
Ensure Veeva content is fully responsive, cross-browser compatible, and optimized for performance and fast load times.
Work with designers and copywriters to transform approved content into engaging, interactive modules that align with brand goals and Veeva CRM standards.
Troubleshoot and debug Veeva-specific content issues in Preview or Live environments.
Qualifications:
Expertise in Veeva CLM, particularly IVA/DSA development (mandatory).
Strong proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.
Familiarity with Veeva Vault, CRM Media library setup, and Approved Email templates.
Understanding of responsive and touch-optimized design for iPad-based presentations.
Experience with web performance optimization and front-end debugging tools.
Basic knowledge of graphic design tools (e.g., Photoshop or Figma).
Experience using Git or other version control systems.
Understanding of web accessibility standards (WCAG) is a plus.
Required Skills:
Javascript/React
Veeva Certification
Background in pharmaceutical marketing or medical communications.
Familiarity with regulatory review processes (PRC/MLR).

title: Full-Stack Developer
company: California Society of Certified Public Accountants
job_description:
Title: Full-Stack Developer
Location: Remote – USA only
Meet CalCPA
Company | Nonprofit | 1 - 100 Employees
We are a mission-based organization that strives to increase the value and promote the integrity of the CPA profession. We work as a team to contribute to the success of our 43,000+ members; and strengthen our client, employer, public and government trust in CalCPA member advice, work products and expert opinions.
Position Summary
We are seeking a remote Full-Stack Developer to join our collaborative software development team. As a Full-Stack Developer, you will build and enhance features for our Web Apps, including eCommerce platform, AI-powered tools, email-deliverability services, and third-party integrations using React and Next.js plus Node.js on the back end. We’re looking for someone who is curious, passionate about software development, and ready to make a big impact. We are a small, fast-moving team where your code ships to production every week and directly impacts customers. If you love diving into technical details, leveraging AI to code faster, and owning features end-to-end, we’d love to meet you!
Duties and Responsibilities:
Develop and enhance features using TypeScript, CSS, React, and Next.js.
Design and build REST/GraphQL APIs and server-side logic with Node.js / Next.js API routes.
Model and query data in SQL (PostgreSQL/MySQL) or NoSQL (MongoDB/Firebase) as appropriate.
Write high-quality, testable, and maintainable code.
Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests (Jest, Playwright/Cypress) and participate in Test-Driven Development where practical.
Collaborate with other members of the development team to plan and implement features.
Troubleshoot and debug issues.
Own features end-to-end, from the UI through deployment on Netlify/Vercel and CI/CD pipelines (AzureDevOps, GitHub Actions).
Participate in code reviews and architecture discussions.
Communicate clearly in our remote-first culture—async updates, video stand-ups, and written documentation.
Required Qualifications:
Proficiency in TypeScript and JavaScript.
Strong knowledge of HTML and CSS.
Experience with React and Next.js.
Solid Node.js experience (Express/Nest or Next.js API routes) and comfort building scalable back-end services.
Hands-on database experience (PostgreSQL, MySQL, or MongoDB/Firebase).
Proficiency with AI-assisted code editors (e.g., Cursor, Claude, GitHub Copilot, Windsurf).
Proficiency with Git (branching, PR reviews, CI hooks).
Attention to detail.
Willingness and ability to learn and use new technologies.
Excellent written and verbal communication for distributed teamwork.
Preferred Qualifications:
Familiarity with end-to-end testing frameworks like Cypress, Playwright, or WebDriver.io.
Experience with Salesforce.
Experience with OpenAI-compatible APIs.
Knowledge of real-time and media protocols: WebSockets, WebRTC.
Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) application development and prompt engineering techniques using the OpenAI API or similar LLM platforms.
Salary:
$115,000 - $130,000 base salary.
Benefits:
Competitive Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
401(k) + Employer Match + profit sharing
Life Insurance
Long-Term Disability Insurance
Pet Insurance
Paid Leave of Absence
Generous PTO
16 Paid Holidays
Gratitude Days
Gym Membership
Monthly remote-work reimbursement to power your Internet
Company Retreats
Holiday Events
Tuition Reimbursement
Free CalCPA classes and events
It is the policy of CalCPA to provide equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law. This policy relates to all phases of employment, including, but not limited to, recruiting, employment, placement, promotion, transfer, demotion, reduction of workforce and termination, rates of pay or other forms of compensation, selection for training, the use of all facilities, and participation in all company-sponsored employee activities.

title: React UI Developer-Remote
job_description:
NTT DATA is currently seeking a React UI Developer to join our team. This is 100% Remote (U.S and Canada) W2 only. No vendors or agencies.

About the Role

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated UI Developer to join our front-end engineering team. The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in React 18+, modern authentication flows using OAuth (Auth0), and a strong grasp of modern UI frameworks and testing practices. You'll play a key role in building responsive, secure, and scalable web applications that deliver exceptional user experiences.

Key Responsibilities
Develop and maintain scalable front-end applications using React 18+
Implement secure authentication and authorization flows using OAuth, preferably with Auth0
Integrate RESTful APIs using Axios or Fetch API
Build responsive and accessible UIs using TailwindCSS or Material UI (MUI)
Write clean, maintainable code in TypeScript (preferred)
Ensure code quality through unit and integration testing using Jest and React Testing Library
Deploy and manage front-end applications using Azure Static Web Apps or similar platforms
Collaborate with designers, backend developers, and product managers to deliver high-quality features

Required Skills & Experience
React 18+ - 3+ years of xperience with hooks, context, and performance optimization
OAuth (Auth0) - Hands-on experience implementing secure authentication flows
Axios or Fetch API - Proficient in API integration and error handling
TailwindCSS / MUI - Experience building responsive and accessible UIs
TypeScript - Preferred; ability to write strongly typed, scalable code
Jest + React Testing Library - Familiarity with test-driven development and writing unit/integration tests
Azure Static Web Apps or similar - Experience with cloud-based front-end deployment

Nice to Have
Experience with CI/CD pipelines
Familiarity with GitHub Actions or Azure DevOps
Knowledge of accessibility (WCAG) standards

NTT DATA is a $30+ billion trusted global innovator of business and technology services. We serve 75% of the Fortune Global 100 and are committed to helping clients innovate, optimize, and transform for long-term success. We invest over $3.6 billion each year in R&D to help organizations and society move confidently and sustainably into the digital future. As a Global Top Employer, we have diverse experts in more than 50 countries and a robust partner ecosystem of established and start-up companies. Our services include business and technology consulting, data and artificial intelligence, industry solutions, as well as the development, implementation and management of applications, infrastructure, and connectivity. We are also one of the leading providers of digital and AI infrastructure in the world. NTT DATA is part of NTT Group and headquartered in Tokyo. Visit us at us.nttdata.com.

Our multidisciplinary teams use agile methodologies to rapidly and incrementally deliver value in close collaboration with our clients. For over a decade, we have been trusted by both federal and commercial clients to solve complex, mission-critical business challenges. The quality of our work has been recognized by our partners and peers through our inclusion in the Digital Services Coalition, a group of forward- thinking firms recognized for excellence in delivering IT services.
Description
Capital Technology Group (CTG) is on a mission to modernize and innovate the way the federal government delivers software. For this role specifically, we are seeking individuals to help transform and streamline a key component of America's immigration process.
As an integral part of the program, you will work closely with other teams to help build functional systems that improve customer experience. Responsibilities include designing and building applications, implementing new technologies, identifying and resolving functional issues, and writing unit and integration tests.
Client Requirements: applicants MUST BE US Citizens and be able to obtain Public Trust clearance
Responsibilities
Design and build advanced applications for the iOS and Android platforms
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency and optimize the end user experience.
Resolve functional issues and improve application performance.
Write unit and integration tests code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability.
Requirements
Proficiency in TypeScript, with a strong understanding of its core concepts and features.
Experience with front-end frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js.
Solid understanding of software development principles, including version control, testing, and deployment.
Experience with third-party open source and COTS libraries and APIs.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
A strong passion for writing clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
Preferred Qualifications
React Native experience is a plus.
Full-stack development skills are a plus.
Experience or interest in Spring Boot (Java backend) is beneficial.
Working knowledge of the mobile landscape, architectures, trends, and emerging technologies.
Understanding of the full mobile development life cycle is a plus.
Salary Information
We are committed to offering a competitive salary for this position, with an estimated range of $90k to $130k annually. Please note that this range is intended to provide a general idea of what to expect. The final offer may vary based on experience, skills, and other factors.
Full Time Employee Benefits
Remote Work (Hybrid roles will be specified in the job post)
Competitive Compensation Package
Medical, Dental, and Vision
Life Insurance, Short/Long Term Disability
Employee Assistance Program
401(k) with 4% matching
Liberal PTO vacation policy
Generous Annual Continuing Education
Annual Wellness Budget
Bonus Incentive Programs (Employee referrals and performance-based rewards)
Thanks for your interest in Capital Technology Group!
Capital Technology Group is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Sr. Full Stack Developer (Vue.js expert)
job_description:
Title: Senior Full Stack Developer (Vue.js Expert)
Schedule: Monday to Friday, Business Hours
Location: Remote
Reports to: VP of Transaction Operations
Position Summary:
LPT Realty is seeking a Senior Full Stack Developer with deep expertise in Vue.js and modern JavaScript to lead the development of highly-performant, scalable user interfaces and full-stack applications. While this is a full-stack role, the focus is heavily front-end driven, making it ideal for a developer who thrives on building polished, elegant, and accessible web experiences. You will collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and engineers to deliver innovative technology solutions that support and scale our fast-growing real estate operations.
Key Responsibilities:
Architect and build Vue.js applications with reusable, efficient, and testable components (preferably using Vue 3 + Composition API).
Design and implement modular and scalable UI components with a focus on performance, accessibility, and responsiveness.
Extend and integrate custom JavaScript libraries to enhance front-end functionality.
Collaborate with designers to translate UI/UX designs into pixel-perfect implementations.
Lead the development and deployment of full-stack applications, including front-end features and back-end API integrations.
Work with RESTful APIs and asynchronous data flows to ensure seamless user experiences.
Conduct code reviews, refactor legacy code, and promote best practices across the front-end architecture.
Provide mentorship to junior developers and assist in driving engineering excellence.
Stay up to date with the Vue ecosystem and front-end trends to continuously raise the bar for our UI stack.
Required Qualifications:
5+ years of professional experience in full-stack development, with significant focus on front-end development.
Vue.js expert, (preferably Vue 3 with Composition API)
Must be U.S. based
Advanced JavaScript (ES6+) and experience with modern frameworks and libraries.
Solid knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, responsive design, and accessibility best practices.
Experience with Pinia (or Vuex) for state management.
Proficient with modern tooling and build systems (Vite, Webpack, npm/yarn).
Strong Git skills and collaborative development workflow experience.
Proven experience integrating and managing RESTful APIs and complex asynchronous processes.
Familiarity with back-end development using SQL/MySQL and building custom APIs.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Adobe ColdFusion, Angular, and microservices architecture.
Exposure to cloud platforms and CI/CD tools such as AWS (EC2, Lambda, S3, etc.) and Azure DevOps.
Knowledge of jQuery for legacy code maintenance.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (preferred, not required).
Why Join LPT Realty?
Be a key player in one of the fastest-growing real estate brokerages in the country. LPT Realty is at the forefront of real estate innovation—leveraging cutting-edge technology, scalable systems, and AI tools to transform the industry.
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:
401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Unlimited paid time off
Vision insurance
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Weekends as needed
Experience:
Full-stack development: 4 years (Required)
Vue.js: 4 years (Required)
Front-end development: 4 years (Required)
Work Location: Remote
