title: Staff Product Designer
job_description:
About the Role:
Opendoor is looking for a Staff Product Designer to help build the future of our consumer experience. As a designer on the team, you’ll have a clear, measurable impact on the business— revolutionizing our core selling and buying experiences.
We appreciate designers who think deeply about people and processes, not just pixels, and love getting their hands dirty with customer research. The ideal designer for this team has experience building service-oriented consumer products.

What you'll Do:
Ideate: Work with Product, Engineering, Research and Operations to design and prototype the future of our end-to-end customer experience.
Research: Partner with Research to conduct user interviews and determine common pain points, product improvements and priorities. Conduct light-weight research independently to inform design decisions.
Create: Design information architecture diagrams, wireframes, flows, high-fidelity mock-ups, and prototype for your features.
Communicate: Showcase your vision and rationale behind design decisions to stakeholders and your team.
Collaborate: Work closely with Product, Engineering, and Operations to validate the feasibility of your work and ensure high-quality implementation.

What you'll Need:
Experience: At least 8 years of relevant experience as an individual contributor on an in-house product design team.
Portfolio: A portfolio with native and/or web projects that highlights your approach to problem solving, as well as the solutions themselves. Case studies should demonstrate your skills in research, user experience, visual design, and interaction design.
Figma Mastery: You live and breathe within Figma, where you’ve mastered the essential elements of design.
Prototyping: Strong skills using rich, interactive prototyping within Figma and/or tools like Framer.
Communication: Excellent communication and storytelling skills, in writing and in speaking. Has a well-defined design process.
Teamwork: Experience partnering with Product, Engineering, and Research to craft broader product strategy.
Bonus points if:
Mentoring: Experience guiding and mentoring other members of the Product Design team.
Design systems: Experience building design systems collaboratively from the ground up.
Coding: Understanding of front-end frameworks like Angular and React. Front-end development skills are a plus.

Compensation
The base pay range for this position is $180,000-$247,500 annually, plus RSUs and bonuses. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on your qualifications, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. We also offer a comprehensive package of benefits including unlimited PTO, medical/dental/vision insurance, life insurance, and 401(k) to eligible employees.
About Opendoor
Founded in 2014, Opendoor’s mission is to power life’s progress one move at a time. We believe the traditional real estate process is broken and our goal is simple: build a digital, end-to-end customer experience that makes buying and selling a home simple and certain.
To learn how we are reinventing the Real Estate industry check out our website.
Hear about our culture directly from team members by visiting The Muse.
Discover what we are building for our customers by reading our blog.
Opendoor Values Openness
We believe that being open about who we are and what we do allows us to be better. Individuals seeking employment at Opendoor are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or other protected status under all applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances. We collect, use, and disclose applicant personal information as described in our personnel privacy policies. To learn more, you can find the policy details for California residents here and for Canada residents here.
We’re committed to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging
Opendoor is dedicated to creating an inclusive and collaborative culture. We value the diverse strengths, perspectives, and backgrounds of all our employees, and believe in empowering our teams to do their best work through teamwork and building a sense of belonging and trust. Our four employee-led Opendoor Employee Resource Groups amplify diverse voices and promote collaboration and inclusion. Our focus is on attracting and retaining exceptional talent, and we believe in empowering our employees to continuously innovate and strive for 1% improvement every day. You can find more information on our Career Page.
We are committed to assisting members of the military community in utilizing their skills at Opendoor. U.S. candidates are able to review your military job classification at MyNextMove.org and apply for positions that align with your expertise.
At Opendoor, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, religious beliefs, or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you require assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please contact us at TAops-accomodations@opendoor.com.

title: Psychiatrist - Connecticut
job_description:
Talkiatry is led clinically by Dr. Georgia Gaveras, a board-certified child, adolescent and adult psychiatrist with an additional board-certification in addiction medicine.

At Talkiatry, that means our psychiatrists are in control of their practice. Our support staff focuses on removing administrative duties, enabling you to spend more of your time on patient care. It also means providing flexibility in where and when you practice medicine. Our psychiatrists also enjoy control over their hours and schedule.

We provide in-network, outpatient treatment for children and adults with depressive, anxiety, attention, and other disorders. Talkiatry does not provide intensive outpatient or partial hospitalization programs. We believe that solving the accessibility issues in mental health care begins with taking care of our doctors. We provide solutions to the challenges that psychiatrists are facing - from a lack of front and back-office infrastructure and support in private practice settings to being overworked and underpaid by hospitals, clinics, and other institutions. Talkiatry aims to bridge the current gap in outpatient psychiatry by providing high quality, respected medical care in a modern setting with modern tools.

Through proprietary technology developed by psychiatrists for psychiatrists, we empower you to treat the conditions and population you enjoy, building a practice you find both satisfying and intellectually challenging.

Talkiatry believes that psychiatric care should be affordable for patients and accepts all major insurance. As an integrated practice, we have a large in-house billing and patient care coordinator team that handles billing and administrative issues for our clinical staff.

To learn more, please visit us at www.talkiatry.com.

Talkiatry participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. only after a job offer is accepted and Form I-9 is completed. For more information on E-Verify, please visit the following: EVerify Participation & IER Right to Work.
At Talkiatry, we are an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace and candidate experience. We strive to create an environment where everyone has a sense of belonging and purpose, and where we learn from the unique experiences of those around us.

We encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

Talkiatry was built for Psychiatrists, by Psychiatrists and offers the stability and support of a hospital group with the autonomy of a private practice. We are currently seeking 100% Remote BC/BE Psychiatrists to join our national team as we continue to expand across the US.

Our Promises
Market-leading compensation. Competitive base salary coupled with productivity-based income. You retain a high percentage of your earnings; we pay at the top of the market.
Comprehensive employee benefits package designed specifically for high earning physicians and we cover up to 100% of your healthcare premiums, even for large families.
Lighter administrative burden and schedule flexibility. You can focus on providing great care, while maintaining control over your schedule. We will handle patient scheduling, billing, and various other support functions
The efficiency of Talkiatry’s practice benefits you. Our single specialty focus, scale and technology allows for better reimbursement rates while maintaining lower practice expenses which enables us to pass the economic benefits to our psychiatrists.
Custom developed technology driven solutions for psychiatry including an integrated EMR which supports provider-to-patient messaging, telemedicine, direct lab integration and proprietary tools to track and gain insight into your patients’ outcomes.
Select a patient population according to your own criteria and preferences. Our patient intake process is robust and can be adjusted in real time to allow you to balance the acuity and diagnoses of the patient population you are treating.
You decide what allotted time is appropriate for your patients. Minimum of 60 minutes for intakes and 30 minutes on follow up visits.
Strong in-house referral network that allows you to refer patients to specialists and therapists whose practice exclusively supports patients our psychiatrists are actively treating. Best of all, clinical information is shared seamlessly through our EMR.
Our Benefits
Health, Dental, Vision Insurance: Up to 100% of insurance premiums
100% Employer paid malpractice coverage
Competitive 401K match with immediate participation
PTO, sick time and 11 paid holidays
Pre-tax commuter benefits
CME allowance
Flexible scheduling and patient criteria in a remote, telehealth environment
Few administrative burdens with full-time, on-site billing and scheduling services
Licensing support- Our in-house licensing department will be happy to assist in managing this process for you, and we cover the costs up front
Technology package is provided
In addition to a highly competitive Benefits plan, Talkiatry’s Full Time Psychiatrists compensation plan totals ~$300K- $350K+ annually, which consists of a base salary, in addition to a monthly productivity incentive; monthly productivity incentive is guaranteed throughout clinician’s onboarding ramp up period.
Your Qualifications
Board eligible or certified in Psychiatry. Subspecialties strongly encouraged to apply.
Active and unrestricted license to practice medicine. We can assist in obtaining licensure as needed.
Excellent clinical knowledge and communication skills.
A willingness to learn new or streamlined EMR tools.
A proactive approach with a strong work ethic and desire to participate in a collaborative environment.
A commitment to high-quality, cost-effective health care.

Questions? Reach out to us at clinicalcareers@talkiatry.com.

title: SharePoint Online Power User – Migration Specialist
job_description:
Are you a seasoned SharePoint Power User looking for a great opportunity to impact data transformation for a federal agency? Does navigating complex, manual migration to SharePoint Online energize you? Montage Marketing Group wants you!
Montage is looking for two SharePoint Online Power Users – Migration Specialists to support a dynamic federal contract. Qualified candidates will have the skills, experience, and attention to detail needed to effectively execute manual migration from SharePoint 2019 to SharePoint Online, develop strategies to support the manual migration process, and effectively collaborate with team leaders and stakeholders.
These are full-time, one-year federal contract positions, with possible option to extend, working from the employee’s home office.
ABOUT MONTAGE MARKETING GROUP
Montage Marketing Group is an award-winning marketing firm focused on making connections—and making a difference. Our people are innovators and co-creators, visionaries, and hard-working change makers. Our purpose is to make connections with people, to get them to stop and think, to feel and act. Proven experts in engagement, outreach, communication, event planning, and experiential design, we’re a third party-certified woman business enterprise, and a member of the US Small Business Administration’s 8(a) program.
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are seeking a highly detail-oriented SharePoint Online Power User with strong hands-on experience manually migrating content from SharePoint 2019 to SharePoint Online to support a federal contract. The ideal candidate will play a critical role in supporting the government’s modernization efforts by ensuring high-quality page migration where automated tools cannot be used. This position requires a strong understanding of SharePoint’s structure, content types, web parts, and permissions.
REQUIREMENTS
Active Personal Identity Verification (PIV) Public Trust clearance preferred; ability to obtain required.
Demonstrated experience working with SharePoint 2019 and SharePoint Online, especially around site structure, publishing features, and web parts.
Proven ability to manually recreate SharePoint pages in the modern SharePoint Online framework.
Experience with ShareGate or similar migration tools (training can be provided).
Familiarity with Microsoft Power Platform tools, including Power Apps and Power Automate.
Basic knowledge of SharePoint Online administration, such as permission structures, site settings, and content types.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Perform manual migration of SharePoint 2019 site pages to SharePoint Online, ensuring layout, functionality, and content integrity are preserved.
Identify pages or components unsuitable for automated migration and develop clear strategies for their manual recreation in the SharePoint Online environment.
Collaborate closely with team leads to validate migrated content against quality and accessibility standards.
Support content owners and stakeholders during validation and post-migration testing.
Document migration procedures and contribute to a knowledge base of SharePoint Online best practices.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES
Experience working with federal contracts, strongly preferred.
Experience with Microsoft 365 GCC or GCC High, preferred.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills to manage page inventories and migration logs.
Ability to work independently and communicate progress and blockers effectively to project leadership.
Ability to learn new tools quickly and follow structured processes.
Interest in long-term support for SharePoint Online governance, maintenance, and adoption post-migration.
Track and submit time accurately in company time keeping system (Unanet).
WHY MONTAGE?
Because we’re a caring team of collaborative creatives—people who care as deeply about each other as we do about our work. We know that true teamwork happens only when each person’s voice is valued, each one’s contribution is celebrated, and success is always shared. We encourage each team member to realize their full potential. And we invite people to make our agency their pathway to fulfillment.
HOW TO APPLY
At Montage, we're passionate about putting our talents, knowledge, interests, and experience to work every day. We produce strong work because we put connection first. We want someone who also values connection, respect, and collaboration. Someone who understands a thriving work environment is built on more than any one production. Sound like you? Apply today.
Montage Marketing Group does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, age, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), political affiliation, military service, or other non-merit based factors. Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the United States. Montage Marketing Group is unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time. Montage Marketing Group is a Drug-Free Workplace.

title: 100% Remote Online Customer Chat Specialist (Voice & Chat)
job_description:
Location:
100% Remote (U.S.-based applicants preferred)
Job Type:
Full-Time | Part-Time | Contract (flexible depending on availability)
About Green Law Group, LLP
Green Law Group, LLP is a forward-thinking legal practice dedicated to delivering exceptional legal services in areas such as environmental law, real estate, and business law. With a focus on accessibility and innovation, we pride ourselves on delivering client-centered service through modern tools and remote technologies.
Position Summary:
Green Law Group, LLP is seeking a reliable and tech-savvy Remote Online Customer Chat Specialist to join our client support team. This role requires exceptional written and verbal communication skills to manage inbound and outbound client communications via online chat, voice calls, and emails. The ideal candidate will be highly responsive, empathetic, and efficient in delivering a professional client experience in a legal environment.
Key Responsibilities:
Serve as the first point of contact for potential and existing clients via live chat, phone calls, and email.
Respond to inquiries promptly and accurately, providing information about our legal services, scheduling consultations, and directing clients to appropriate legal staff.
Maintain client confidentiality and adhere to firm-wide security protocols and data privacy requirements.
Document all interactions using our case management system (e.g., Clio or similar).
Monitor and manage multiple chat and communication channels simultaneously.
Coordinate appointment scheduling and follow-ups through integrated calendar tools.
Provide administrative support for intake, client feedback, and client satisfaction surveys.
Escalate complex legal questions to the appropriate team members while ensuring seamless handoff and follow-through.
Qualifications:
High school diploma or equivalent; associate or bachelor’s degree preferred.
1–3 years of experience in customer support, preferably in a legal or professional services setting.
Strong command of English; bilingual (Spanish or other) is a plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Proficiency in using customer support tools such as Zendesk, LiveChat, RingCentral, or similar platforms.
Familiarity with legal terminology or willingness to learn.
Comfortable working independently in a remote setting.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Ability to multitask and manage priorities effectively in a fast-paced environment.
No Legal Experience Required:
We provide full training. If you’re a great communicator who cares about people, we’ll teach you everything you need to succeed in this role—even if you’ve never worked in the legal field before.
Work Hours:
Flexible scheduling available: Days, Evenings, Weekends
Must be able to work at least 20 hours per week
Availability during Pacific Standard Time (PST) hours is preferred
Benefits:
Competitive hourly pay
Work-from-anywhere flexibility
Training and onboarding provided
Opportunity to grow within a legal team
Collaborative and inclusive virtual work culture
To Apply:
Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter explaining why you’d be a great fit for this role. Include any experience working in a legal setting or with customer support technologies.
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Pay: $26.44 - $30.78 per hour
Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Paid time off
Work from home
Work Location: Remote

title: Chart Research Escalation Specialist
job_description:
About Us:
Ventra is a leading business solutions provider for facility-based physicians practicing anesthesia, emergency medicine, hospital medicine, pathology, and radiology. Focused on Revenue Cycle Management, Ventra partners with private practices, hospitals, health systems, and ambulatory surgery centers to deliver transparent and data-driven solutions that solve the most complex revenue and reimbursement issues, enabling clinicians to focus on providing outstanding care to their patients and communities.
Come Join Our Team!
As part of our robust Rewards & Recognition program, this role is eligible for our Ventra performance-based incentive plan, because we believe great work deserves great rewards.
Help Us Grow Our Dream Team — Join Us, Refer a Friend, and Earn a Referral Bonus!
Compensation:
Base Compensation will be based on various factors unique to each candidate including geographic location, skill set, experience, qualifications, and other job-related reasons.
This position is also eligible for a discretionary incentive bonus in accordance with company policies.
Ventra Health:
Equal Employment Opportunity (Applicable only in the US)
Ventra Health is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a culturally diverse organization. We strive for inclusiveness and a workplace where mutual respect is paramount. We encourage applications from a diverse pool of candidates, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, or veteran status. We will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, as needed, to assist them in performing essential job functions.

Recruitment Agencies
Ventra Health does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Ventra Health is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Solicitation of Payment
Ventra Health does not solicit payment from our applicants and candidates for consideration or placement.

Attention Candidates
Please be aware that there have been reports of individuals falsely claiming to represent Ventra Health or one of our affiliated entities Ventra Health Private Limited and Ventra Health Global Services. These scammers may attempt to conduct fake interviews, solicit personal information, and, in some cases, have sent fraudulent offer letters.
To protect yourself, verify any communication you receive by contacting us directly through our official channels. If you have any doubts, please contact us at Careers@VentraHealth.com to confirm the legitimacy of the offer and the person who contacted you. All legitimate roles are posted on https://ventrahealth.com/careers/.

Statement of Accessibility
Ventra Health is committed to making our digital experiences accessible to all users, regardless of ability or assistive technology preferences. We continually work to enhance the user experience through ongoing improvements and adherence to accessibility standards. Please review at https://ventrahealth.com/statement-of-accessibility/.

title: Psychiatrist - New York
job_description:
Talkiatry is led clinically by Dr. Georgia Gaveras, a board-certified child, adolescent and adult psychiatrist with an additional board-certification in addiction medicine.

At Talkiatry, that means our psychiatrists are in control of their practice. Our support staff focuses on removing administrative duties, enabling you to spend more of your time on patient care. It also means providing flexibility in where and when you practice medicine. Our psychiatrists also enjoy control over their hours and schedule.

We provide in-network, outpatient treatment for children and adults with depressive, anxiety, attention, and other disorders. Talkiatry does not provide intensive outpatient or partial hospitalization programs. We believe that solving the accessibility issues in mental health care begins with taking care of our doctors. We provide solutions to the challenges that psychiatrists are facing - from a lack of front and back-office infrastructure and support in private practice settings to being overworked and underpaid by hospitals, clinics, and other institutions. Talkiatry aims to bridge the current gap in outpatient psychiatry by providing high quality, respected medical care in a modern setting with modern tools.

Through proprietary technology developed by psychiatrists for psychiatrists, we empower you to treat the conditions and population you enjoy, building a practice you find both satisfying and intellectually challenging.

Talkiatry believes that psychiatric care should be affordable for patients and accepts all major insurance. As an integrated practice, we have a large in-house billing and patient care coordinator team that handles billing and administrative issues for our clinical staff.

To learn more, please visit us at www.talkiatry.com.

Talkiatry participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. only after a job offer is accepted and Form I-9 is completed. For more information on E-Verify, please visit the following: EVerify Participation & IER Right to Work.
At Talkiatry, we are an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace and candidate experience. We strive to create an environment where everyone has a sense of belonging and purpose, and where we learn from the unique experiences of those around us.

We encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

Talkiatry was built for Psychiatrists, by Psychiatrists and offers the stability and support of a hospital group with the autonomy of a private practice. We are currently seeking 100% Remote BC/BE Psychiatrists to join our national team as we continue to expand across the US.

Our Promises
Market-leading compensation. Competitive base salary coupled with productivity-based income. You retain a high percentage of your earnings; we pay at the top of the market.
Comprehensive employee benefits package designed specifically for high earning physicians and we cover up to 100% of your healthcare premiums, even for large families.
Lighter administrative burden and schedule flexibility. You can focus on providing great care, while maintaining control over your schedule. We will handle patient scheduling, billing, and various other support functions
The efficiency of Talkiatry’s practice benefits you. Our single specialty focus, scale and technology allows for better reimbursement rates while maintaining lower practice expenses which enables us to pass the economic benefits to our psychiatrists.
Custom developed technology driven solutions for psychiatry including an integrated EMR which supports provider-to-patient messaging, telemedicine, direct lab integration and proprietary tools to track and gain insight into your patients’ outcomes.
Select a patient population according to your own criteria and preferences. Our patient intake process is robust and can be adjusted in real time to allow you to balance the acuity and diagnoses of the patient population you are treating.
You decide what allotted time is appropriate for your patients. Minimum of 60 minutes for intakes and 30 minutes on follow up visits.
Strong in-house referral network that allows you to refer patients to specialists and therapists whose practice exclusively supports patients our psychiatrists are actively treating. Best of all, clinical information is shared seamlessly through our EMR.
Our Benefits
Health, Dental, Vision Insurance: Up to 100% of insurance premiums
100% Employer paid malpractice coverage
Competitive 401K match with immediate participation
PTO, sick time and 11 paid holidays
Pre-tax commuter benefits
CME allowance
Flexible scheduling and patient criteria in a remote, telehealth environment
Few administrative burdens with full-time, on-site billing and scheduling services
Licensing support- Our in-house licensing department will be happy to assist in managing this process for you, and we cover the costs up front
Technology package is provided
In addition to a highly competitive Benefits plan, Talkiatry’s Full Time Psychiatrists compensation plan totals ~$300K- $350K+ annually, which consists of a base salary, in addition to a monthly productivity incentive; monthly productivity incentive is guaranteed throughout clinician’s onboarding ramp up period.
Your Qualifications
Board eligible or certified in Psychiatry. Subspecialties strongly encouraged to apply.
Active and unrestricted license to practice medicine. We can assist in obtaining licensure as needed.
Excellent clinical knowledge and communication skills.
A willingness to learn new or streamlined EMR tools.
A proactive approach with a strong work ethic and desire to participate in a collaborative environment.
A commitment to high-quality, cost-effective health care.

Questions? Reach out to us at clinicalcareers@talkiatry.com.

title: SharePoint Online Power User – Migration Specialist
job_description:
Are you a seasoned SharePoint Power User looking for a great opportunity to impact data transformation for a federal agency? Does navigating complex, manual migration to SharePoint Online energize you? Montage Marketing Group wants you!
Montage is looking for two SharePoint Online Power Users – Migration Specialists to support a dynamic federal contract. Qualified candidates will have the skills, experience, and attention to detail needed to effectively execute manual migration from SharePoint 2019 to SharePoint Online, develop strategies to support the manual migration process, and effectively collaborate with team leaders and stakeholders.
These are full-time, one-year federal contract positions, with possible option to extend, working from the employee's home office.
About Montage Marketing Group
Montage Marketing Group is an award-winning marketing firm focused on making connections—and making a difference. Our people are innovators and co-creators, visionaries, and hard-working change makers. Our purpose is to make connections with people, to get them to stop and think, to feel and act. Proven experts in engagement, outreach, communication, event planning, and experiential design, we're a third party-certified woman business enterprise, and a member of the US Small Business Administration's 8(a) program.
About the Role
We are seeking a highly detail-oriented SharePoint Online Power User with strong hands-on experience manually migrating content from SharePoint 2019 to SharePoint Online to support a federal contract. The ideal candidate will play a critical role in supporting the government's modernization efforts by ensuring high-quality page migration where automated tools cannot be used. This position requires a strong understanding of SharePoint's structure, content types, web parts, and permissions.
Requirements
Active Personal Identity Verification (PIV) Public Trust clearance preferred; ability to obtain required.
Demonstrated experience working with SharePoint 2019 and SharePoint Online, especially around site structure, publishing features, and web parts.
Proven ability to manually recreate SharePoint pages in the modern SharePoint Online framework.
Experience with ShareGate or similar migration tools (training can be provided).
Familiarity with Microsoft Power Platform tools, including Power Apps and Power Automate.
Basic knowledge of SharePoint Online administration, such as permission structures, site settings, and content types.
Responsibilities
Perform manual migration of SharePoint 2019 site pages to SharePoint Online, ensuring layout, functionality, and content integrity are preserved.
Identify pages or components unsuitable for automated migration and develop clear strategies for their manual recreation in the SharePoint Online environment.
Collaborate closely with team leads to validate migrated content against quality and accessibility standards.
Support content owners and stakeholders during validation and post-migration testing.
Document migration procedures and contribute to a knowledge base of SharePoint Online best practices.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Experience working with federal contracts, strongly preferred.
Experience with Microsoft 365 GCC or GCC High, preferred.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills to manage page inventories and migration logs.
Ability to work independently and communicate progress and blockers effectively to project leadership.
Ability to learn new tools quickly and follow structured processes.
Interest in long-term support for SharePoint Online governance, maintenance, and adoption post-migration.
Track and submit time accurately in company time keeping system (Unanet).
Why Montage?
Because we're a caring team of collaborative creatives—people who care as deeply about each other as we do about our work. We know that true teamwork happens only when each person's voice is valued, each one's contribution is celebrated, and success is always shared. We encourage each team member to realize their full potential. And we invite people to make our agency their pathway to fulfillment.
How to Apply
At Montage, we're passionate about putting our talents, knowledge, interests, and experience to work every day. We produce strong work because we put connection first. We want someone who also values connection, respect, and collaboration. Someone who understands a thriving work environment is built on more than any one production. Sound like you? Apply today.
Montage Marketing Group does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, age, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), political affiliation, military service, or other non-merit based factors. Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the United States. Montage Marketing Group is unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time. Montage Marketing Group is a Drug-Free Workplace.

title: Organic and Paid Growth Specialist
job_description:
Are you a full-stack growth unicorn who knows how to craft educational, organic content that scales, launch high-impact campaigns, optimize paid ads, and own every step—from first impression to final conversion?
Can you blend storytelling, psychology, and analytics to craft irresistible content and campaigns that drive measurable growth?
Then we’ve got news for you: this might be exactly the opportunity you’ve been waiting for.
IxDF is a global leader in online UX/UI design education. Industry giants like Adobe and IBM trust our courses to train their teams, and prestigious universities such as MIT and the University of Cambridge use our materials in their curricula.
We’ve assembled an exceptional team of unicorns who support, inspire, and challenge each other every day. We wake up each morning excited to build a brighter future for millions of people around the world.
But something’s missing. And we think it could be you.
This is a role for someone who can “walk the talk.” We’re not looking for a self-proclaimed “brand ninja” or “marketing rockstar.” We want a builder, someone who knows how to get things done, shows proof, not pitch, and lives for measurable outcomes.
Do You Share the Vision of IxDF?
People don’t just buy our courses; they invest in a better version of themselves. That’s why every campaign and content piece we create must do more than “market.” It must reflect what we believe in as a brand:
Show the dream outcome: Help people imagine a future of creative, meaningful work, freedom, fulfillment, flexibility, and impact through great design.
Strengthen belief in success: Build confidence through real stories, practical roadmaps, and expert-led guidance. People should feel, “If they did it, I can too.”
Speed up the time to value: Offer instant wins. Make progress feel close and tangible not someday, but now.
Lower the effort barrier: Make it feel doable. No jargon. No overwhelm. Just human, beginner-friendly, bite-sized steps that meet people where they are.
Your job would be to translate this into headlines, hooks, content pieces, social media posts, campaigns, and data-informed strategy. You’ll create clarity, motivation, and momentum with a dash of unicorn magic.
What You Will Be Doing
You’ll be at the core of our growth engine, running and optimizing the systems that bring learners into our ecosystem. You will:
Create, own and scale organic content that earns attention, builds trust, and drives long-term growth across platforms.
Plan and execute high-impact campaigns for events like Black Friday, New Year, Unicorn Day, and Global Accessibility Awareness Day. You’ll turn briefs into successful results and reports into actionable insights.
Experiment with new channels like TikTok, Reddit, YouTube Shorts—launching quick pilots and scaling what works.
Build and maintain clear, concise documentation and reporting dashboards to make campaign operations more transparent, repeatable, and effective.
Use analytics to learn and iterate, not just report. Your campaigns get smarter every time.
Champion our value proposition—be a brand ambassador for our mission, bringing our voice, vision, and values to life across every touchpoint.
Run and scale paid media on Meta, Google, LinkedIn, and YouTube. From targeting to copywriting to ROAS tracking—you’ll own it all.
About you
You’re an optimizer, a problem-solver, and a builder. More specifically:
You bring storytelling and creativity to your work and can craft organic content that captures attention and connects with users.
You have a sixth sense for micro-copy, and the know-how to write persuasive, on-brand copy that drives action.
You have experience with launching campaigns across owned and paid platforms and have the track record to show it.
You are comfortable with platforms like Meta Ads Manager, Google Ads, and LinkedIn Campaign Manager, and you understand their constraints and superpowers.
You don’t just launch ads, you improve everything around them: the copy, the images, the funnel, the flow, the analytics.
You’re driven by impact and fluent in data - you use metrics to uncover insights, guide decisions, and optimize performance. But you also understand human behavior, platform psychology, and what makes a message truly land.
You view AI not as a threat or a substitution for that infamous human touch but as a force multiplier of your human capabilities. You use AI to build faster, smarter, and better results.
You have a keen eye for content, and you can quickly understand what type of content is meaningful, appropriate and useful in each situation or each platform.
You love structure and long-term thinking. Spreadsheets, naming conventions, campaign calendars, and systematic planning aren’t just useful to you — they’re how you think, build, and drive success.
You are fluent in written English with exceptional writing skills, grammar and an appreciation for the power of tone, brevity and microscopy.
You are based within the UTC -1 to UTC +3 time zone, which is crucial to ensure optimal collaboration and overlapping working hours.
Bonus points
You stand out if you...
Have experience creating or managing video-centric campaigns.
Know your way around GA4, GTM, and server-side tagging.
What We Can Offer
A full-time position, within a fully remote organization. Daily video-based collaboration with your colleagues from elsewhere on the planet, and you’ll get to meet up on team trips every year.
A work culture with no fluffy titles, political agendas and corporate drama. Your colleagues value your warm character, your strong work ethic, and the results you deliver. Junior or senior, if you embody old-school virtues of always striving to deliver results, learn and become better every day, you'll thrive at the IxDF.
A daily mission to help impact, empower, and enrich the lives of millions of people by creating affordable high-end design education for everyone across the planet. It’ll be yours too.
A company where the distance between idea and execution is minimal. We’re a highly agile organization with zero bureaucracy or corporate politics – and with exceptional order and efficiency.
A company culture where passion meets high performance and excellence. To help us improve the world (and yourself in the process), you’ll need grit, strong work ethic, long-term thinking, and self-discipline.
We thrive because we have a hands-on attitude and a bias towards action as opposed to fluff-filled, unrealistic strategies. You’ll need crisp execution skills yourself and the ability to impress your colleagues with concrete results, just like they’ll impress you.

title: Application and Web Information Technology Accessibility Specialist
job_description:
Koniag Management Solutions, a Koniag Government Services company, is seeking an Application and Web Information Technology Accessibility Specialist to support KMS and our government customer. This is a remote opportunity.

We offer competitive compensation and an extraordinary benefits package including health, dental and vision insurance, 401K with company matching, flexible spending accounts, paid holidays, three weeks paid time off, and more.
Essential Functions, Responsibilities & Duties may include, but are not limited to:
Senior IT Accessibility Specialist that Specializes in Application and Web compliance:
The Senior IT Accessibility Specialist shall provide subject matter expertise regarding Section 508 program & policy support.
The Senior IT Accessibility Specialist will liaise with agency components to provide guidance for Section 508 compliance and Trusted Tester methodologies, draft and maintain Section 508 policy and process documentation, provide consultation services throughout the software development and procurement lifecycle to ensure delivery of Section 508 conformant software and hardware products, and validate reported Section 508 issues.
The Senior IT Accessibility Specialist also provides direction and guidance to IT Accessibility Specialists.
Minimum Experience (Specialize in Section 508 application testing):
Five years’ experience working in a department or agency Section 508 compliance/accessibility program office.
Two years of experience of Section 508 knowledge on creating policy and integrating new guidelines into an existing policy
Three years of experience in evaluating, documenting, reporting, and validating program applications, website, and other developed ICT for Section 508 compliances
Three years’ experience with the federal acquisition process and requirements and with Enterprise IT Lifecycle
Sensitivity Level: IT level I
Capable of evaluating web pages, web applications, and software for Section 508 compliance according to the DHS Trusted Tester 5.1 process.
Capable of creating Accessibility Conformance Reports (ACRs) and Remediation Plan templates based on Section 508 accessibility testing for each website or application tested.
Capable of managing and maintaining storage of all testing-related documentation, including ACRs and Remediation Plans.
Capable of meeting regularly with development team Project Managers or points of contact (POCs) to review Section 508 test results.
Capable of developing 508 compliant documents for the Section 508 Program Management
Capable of developing and delivering Virtual Instructor-Led Training (VILT) events on Section 508 web/application accessibility standards.
DHS Trusted Tester certified.
Familiar with web software development (i.e., PowerApps, HTML, CSS, and/or JavaScript)
Familiar with Section 508 document remediation (recommended)
Capable of remediating a one-page document of medium complexity for Section 508 in compliance with the latest WCAG standards within 15 minutes, without human assistance, using automated and manual testing (recommended)
Proficient with the agency currently approved versions of the following software:
Microsoft Windows 11
Microsoft 365 Office Suite
Adobe Acrobat
Freedom Scientific Fusion
Job Access With Speech (JAWS)
ZoomText
Allyant Commonlook Office/PDF Suite (recommended)
Colour Contrast Analyser (CCA)
SSA Accessible Name and Description Inspector (ANDI)
DHS Accessibility Conformance Reporting Tool (ACRT)
Must comply with all Section 508 Content Testing capability.

title: Senior UX Designer
job_description:
W2 ONLY, NO C2C
100% remote - Must work EST
6-month contract with the potential to extend
Candidates must have:
1. 6+ years of experience as a UX Designer using Figma
2. Hands-on UX Research experience
3. Experience working on portals that are both internal-facing and customer-facing
4. Strong visuals & a detailed portfolio containing 3+ end-to-end case studies
5. Experience working in both a startup and enterprise environment is a huge plus! *
The "Simplified Solutions" team operates in a similar fashion to a startup, so any startup experience is a plus! They will be supporting projects that are already in flight as well as new projects. They need to be comfortable working very closely with the stakeholders (product owners and business), contributing to the strategy & execution, and needs to be a true self-starter in a fast-paced environment.
Specialist, Experience Designer
As CX Experience Designer you’ll work in a multidisciplinary team, alongside researchers, experience designers, visual designers, and developers, to deliver best-in-class, human-centered products, and services for our client's marketing organization. Your role will be to analyze, plan, map, and create the most valuable and contextually accurate experiences that are simple, and intuitive for customers to use.
Not only will you be excited by the challenge of creating great products across multiple channels, devices, and platforms, but you will also be able to see and own the end-to end journey as well as the detailed outcomes.
You will have a deep understanding of experience architecture, how to design in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment, whilst helping transform our client's end-to-end product and service conversion and acquisition model.
Main responsibilities
As Sr. Experience Designer you will:
Engage in the full lifecycle of client projects beyond initial site development including unit tests, documentation, deployment, and maintenance. This includes enrollment platform design and development using a Content Management System (CMS) that requires proficiency HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Design conceptual wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, information architecture diagrams, interaction specifications, and functional prototypes.
Understand the core Human Centered Design framework of an experience and design targeted improvements to that framework that accommodates new and improved process refinements and deliverables.
Create and rapidly iterate interactive prototypes in accordance with task, scenario, and business needs.
Co-creating on designs with developers, marketing, and product stakeholders.
Put forward new cases for designs improvements with marketing and product managers.
Communicate with detailed design and industry backed decisions and be able to represent all experience touchpoints.
Engage and align with all multidisciplinary teams across the customer office business.
Collaborate with research department to execute usability testing studies.
Analyze friction within existing experiences and identify root causes for that failure that can be translated into solutions.
Additional Skills & Qualifications
Skills and experience
Experience working in a dynamic, fast paced startup environment and working closely with high level stakeholders.
Demonstrates strong visual design execution and attention to detail.
Strong understanding of responsive web design principles and the ability to create mobile-friendly layouts.
Familiarity with web accessibility guidelines and standards such as WCAG 2.0 or 2.1.
Experience working with Content Management Systems and Design Systems.
Ability to troubleshoot technical problems logically and systematically.
Versatile in knowledge of retail purchase experiences, Financial Services and the insurance business is a plus.
Must demonstrate strong knowledge of design thinking.
Working collectively and autonomously with cross-functional teams.
Is a self-starter who can take ownership of design projects end-to-end.
A design related degree or relevant experience in designing products and services.
For this role, the following competencies are essential:
Innovation—Consistently push ideas and provide out of the box solutions to design problems.
Collaborating and partnering—Develop and inspire those around you; encourage, acknowledge, and reward individual and team efforts.
Continuously changing and improving—Sought by senior leadership for progressive and innovative counsel.
Making effective and decisive decisions—Provide unscripted strategic counsel—can “think on your feet” without disrupting strategic intention.
Leading and communicating—Viewed as a role model and leader within the organization.
Influence of experience quality— tie a design to a strategic initiative or business outcome within our organization and across multiple business domains.
Humility at the highest level—Welcome the constructive criticism of the work and be able to constructively review the work of other designers.
Empower your co-workers—Contributes to team- building activities and growth paths.
Pay and Benefits
The pay range for this position is $55.00 - $65.00/hr.
Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job
classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be
subject to specific elections, plan, or program terms. If eligible, the benefits
available for this temporary role may include the following:
Medical, dental & vision
Critical Illness, Accident, and Hospital
401(k) Retirement Plan – Pre-tax and Roth post-tax contributions available
Life Insurance (Voluntary Life & AD&D for the employee and dependents)
Short and long-term disability
Health Spending Account (HSA)
Transportation benefits
Employee Assistance Program
Time Off/Leave (PTO, Vacation or Sick Leave)
Workplace Type
This is a fully remote position.
Application Deadline
This position is anticipated to close on Jul 2, 2025.

title: Connecticut Teletherapy - Teacher in Visual Impairment (TVI)

Introduction:
At VocoVision, we are dedicated to transforming the educational experience for students with visual impairments through innovative remote teaching. We are seeking a skilled and passionate Teacher of the Visually Impaired (TVI) who excels in a remote work environment.
Job Responsibilities:
Conduct assessments to determine students' educational needs and develop Individualized Education Programs (IEPs).
Adapt and modify curriculum to meet the unique needs of students with visual impairments, including braille instruction, orientation and mobility training, and assistive technology.

Strong understanding of IEP development and implementation for students with visual impairments.
Comfortable using technology for instruction and communication (Google Workspace, Zoom, etc.).

Experience teaching in a remote or virtual setting.
Familiarity with additional disabilities often associated with visual impairments (e.g., deaf-blindness).

Consistent Hours.

title: Social Monitoring & Rapid Response Specialist (Night Shift) - Remote (UT)
job_description:
Who We're Looking For - Social Monitoring & Rapid Response Specialist (Night Shift)
Clearlink partners with the world’s leading brands to create unique consumer engagements that attract, acquire, and develop brand advocates while driving revenue and retention. We’ve partnered with several industry leaders to help manage and grow their digital customer engagement programs.
The Social Monitoring & Rapid Response Specialist plays a critical role on the social media team by actively monitoring for high-priority brand mentions, escalating issues and opportunities to the appropriate stakeholders, and supporting timely, effective responses. This role helps ensure a seamless customer experience while enabling key teams to take action on real-time insights.
This position reports to the Team Lead for the Monitoring & Rapid Response practice in Clearlink’s Salt Lake City, UT office.
This position will also be working a night shift, with the expectation to work 10pm-6am MT Sunday - Thursday OR 10pm-6am MT Tuesday - Saturday.

The Impact You Will Make:
Social Listening & Insights
Expand 24/7 social listening coverage to identify proactive engagement opportunities for Android across major platforms (X, Instagram, Reddit, LinkedIn, YouTube, BlueSky) using both automated and manual processes to monitor and surface trends relating to our Social Brand Partner
Opportunity Escalation & Engagement
Identify high-impact or high-engagement content and escalate relevant opportunities to the appropriate teams
Track mentions and surface proactive engagement opportunities related to key brand and executive accounts
Collaborate with internal teams to enable timely, strategic responses
Internal Reporting & Communication
Notify relevant stakeholders via email and chat for real-time or high-priority alerts
Support the daily delivery of summarized social insights to inform the Android marketing team and product leadership.
Repository & Documentation
Maintain a repository to capture and organize proactive opportunities, escalations, and brand safety-related alerts
Tag, categorize, and archive surfaced content for trend analysis and ongoing reporting
Ensure documentation supports historical tracking and knowledge sharing across teams
What You Bring
Fluent in reading, writing, and speaking English
Excellent grasp of grammar, punctuation, and spelling nuances of the English language.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, comprehension skills and thorough attention to detail.
2 - 4 years of experience managing social communities for brands or organizations preferred, online user-to-user support, community management social media, or marketing communications.
High-level understanding of digital channels, including similarities and differences between social media networks, messaging apps, web-based chat, community forums, consumer review sites, self- service content, and e-mail. Must also understand the difference between using social media on behalf of a company as opposed to personal use.
Previous experience with social media management tools such as Sprinklr, Khoros, etc. or other related technology platforms is highly desirable.
Ability to quickly adopt and retain high-level knowledge and expertise on client’s products and services.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
True ownership mindset with resilience and resolve to follow-through.
Typing speed of 40 words per minute is desirable.
High school diploma required.
Additional requirements
Ability to work 10pm-6am MT Sunday - Thursday OR 10pm-6am MT Tuesday - Saturday
Perks That Set Us Apart
Healthcare: We offer low-cost, competitive health coverage (domestic partners included!) with employer-paid counseling services.
Invest in the Future: Enjoy 401(k) matching after just two months of employment, with employer matching starting at ~3%.
️ Lifestyle Spending Stipends: Access an employer-paid spending account for physical, financial, and emotional wellbeing expenses.
️ Flexible Time Off: We offer competitive time-off balances that accrue weekly, just like your paycheck. (Yes, we’re paid weekly too!)
Parental Leave: We provide 2 weeks of paid parental leave during the first year and up to 6 weeks after one year of employment.
✈️ Generous Paid Holidays: Celebrate cultural diversity with additional flex holidays in addition to our company paid holidays.
Remote Work Options: Skip the daily commute, and embrace the flexibility of working from home.
World Class Facility: With onsite restaurants, a 7,000 sqft gym, pickleball & basketball courts, spin class/pilates room, bikes, massages, and so much more.
Comprehensive Life Insurance: Ensure peace of mind with coverage that extends beyond the workplace with employer paid life insurance (including coverage for dependents and spouses).
Employee Resource Groups (ERGs): Join us in fostering connections, celebrating diversity, and providing a supportive community for all.
At Clearlink, we go beyond the basics, ensuring your experience with us is not just professionally fulfilling but personally enriching too.
Interviewing at Clearlink
We know interviews can be stressful. Here are some stages you can expect from a typical interview with Clearlink.
Once your application is submitted, we will review it and be in touch
30-min phone call with the Recruiting Team
30-min - 1 hour interview with the Hiring Manager
30-min - 1 hour interview with a Clearlink Panel
Some interview processes can vary, depending on the role. Your recruiter will give you a role-specific interview process during your first phone call.
#LI-Remote
#LI-SW1
Why Work For Us
Since 2001, Clearlink has been dedicated to fostering growth and embracing opportunities. Our mission is to strengthen our workforce to build brands that guide users and customers toward decisions that enhance their lives. We encourage our employees to “Act as an Owner” – to voice their thoughts, share innovative ideas, and authentically bring their whole selves to work. Join us in our forward-thinking and inclusive community, where your expertise, background, and unique perspective are always valued.
Clearlink Partners & Awards:
Partnered with The Period Project for easy access to menstrual hygiene products.
Awarded the 2022 Shatter List for breaking glass ceilings in technology.
Received the 2023 Women’s Leadership Institute Award, pledging to elevate women’s leadership.
Clearlink Values (CLEAR):
Create Community
Learn & Grow
Embrace Opportunity
Act Like An Owner
Respect Every Person
Committed to accessibility, we encourage you to share any accommodation needs during the application or employment process. Your unique strengths matter, and we are dedicated to providing the necessary support for your success at Clearlink.

title: Web Content Specialist (Part-time, Remote)
job_description:

Get ready to jump on board with the industry leader in the provision of wellness services to the military and veteran communities!
GTSC, a values-led, industry leader in telehealth, health communications and wellness staffing and services is searching for a Web Content Specialist. This is a part-time, remote position.
As the Web Content Specialist, you will support the Military Community and Family Policy (MC&FP) Outreach and Digital Enterprise Services (MODES) contract by using content management systems to create and maintain content for client-owned websites and applications, both public facing as well as staff information portals and applications.

Contribute to client website and application reports highlighting required analytics

Coordinate and execute training requirements for new MC&FP staff or contract personnel
Research and consult on latest technologies, making recommendations for application to client digital properties and activities

Work cooperatively with government clients and a professional services team that includes operations managers, graphic designers, writers and other key staff

Skills in:
Collecting and analyzing customer requests, project goals and responses to project/task-related questions.
Maintaining and tracking online content.
Coordinate timelines and requirements across internal and external teams.

Ability to:
Express vital and critical information to the appropriate audience.
Load and update website content.
Review content, recognize errors or room for improvement, and ensure work is error-free.
Perform other duties as requested.

WINNING BEHAVIORS, SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

Effective:
Communication skills
Time management
Problem-solving
Teamwork
Adaptable
Strong work ethic

Design techniques, tools and principles.
Programming languages.

Terms and concepts commonly expressed in the Armed Services and federal government.
Administrative and clerical procedures in accordance with the company's best practices.

This position is only open in the following states: AL, AZ, CA, CO, DC, FL, GA, ID, IL, MD, MI, MA, MN, NM, NC, ND, NY, PA, RI, TX, UT, VA, WA, and WV.

title: DevOps Specialist
job_description:
Nature of Work:
The DARTNet Institute is a not-for-profit, 501(c)3, research institute with a mission of supporting research and quality improvement activities that utilize existing electronic health data, capturing or using patient reported outcome data with a particular emphasis on pragmatic clinical trials and secondary data analyses. DARTNet also supports the collaboration of multiple academic centers, independent research groups and industry partners.
General Description of Work:
The Development Operations (Dev/Ops) Specialist is responsible for planning, designing, implementing, maintaining, and troubleshooting various information systems primarily in AWS. The dev/ops specialist will work closely with the data team, software developers, and business intelligence developers to implement, optimize, and scale solutions. This individual will maintain relationships with stakeholders and clients including training, regular progress reports and expectation management.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSBILITIES:
Business Analysis
Gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
Collaborate with the informatics team, clients and stakeholders during testing and deployment.
Software Development
Review, verify, and validate software code.
Define and implement test, release, update, and support processes.
Infrastructure Management
Manage and configure IT infrastructure.
Monitor system performance and perform ongoing maintenance.
Process Optimization
Analyze and optimize processes to identify bottlenecks and automation opportunities.
Create documentation for processes and configurations.
Troubleshooting
Conduct root cause analysis and troubleshoot issues.
KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:
Experience with AWS tools, SQL, and modern programming languages (e.g. Python).
Experience in creating automated data pipelines and other infrastructure.
Experience with systems administration in Linux and Windows.
Proficiency with database administration for databases such as SQL Server and Postgres.
Effective communication skills to foster collaboration with stakeholders
Excellent troubleshooting skills.
Willingness to learn and support new systems and applications.
REQUIREMENTS:
· Bachelor’s degree, with a technical major or considerable AWS and Dev/Ops experience in lieu of a bachelor’s degree.
· 3+ years of dev/ops experience.
Experience with running production systems in AWS or other cloud environments.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience with healthcare data and clinical terminology.
Knowledge of OMOP and other healthcare data standards.
RESPONSIBILITY/OVERSIGHT – FINANCIAL & SUPERVISORY:
Manage Dev/Ops projects and ensure they are delivered on time and within budget.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior informatics team members.
WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL EFFORT:
Responsibilities sometimes require working evenings and weekends, sometimes with little advanced notice.

title: Infrastructure Engineer (450315)
job_description:
Infrastructure Engineer | 450315
DETAILS
Location: 100% Remote
Position Type: 6M C2H
Hourly / Salary: to $110K + 10% bonus potential

JOB SUMMARY
Vaco Technology is currently seeking an Infrastructure Engineer for a 6M C2H opportunity that is 100% remote. The Infrastructure Engineer will design, deploy, and maintain the IT infrastructure. The Infrastructure Engineer must possess expertise in server administration, virtualization platforms, M365, and Azure Services, with proficiency in hands-on PowerShell scripting. The ideal Infrastructure Engineer will understand coding, IaC principles, and have some exposure to Terraform and DevOps practices. The Infrastructure Engineer will work closely with the IT / Architecture Teams to ensure remain dependable, secure, and optimized for maximum productivity, while adhering to Agile workflow methodologies.
IT Project Leadership – Lead / Participate in Infrastructure Projects / Server / Cloud / Virtualization – Ensuring On-Time / On-Budget Delivery
IT Component Deployment – Oversee Deployment of Windows / Linux / Virtual Environments – Implementing Updates / Patches / Upgrades for Optimal Performance / Security
Architecture Collaboration – Collaborate with Architecture Team to Design / Implement Scalable / Secure Solutions – Ensuring Alignment with Standards / Best Practices
Cloud Technology Management – Manage Azure / M365 Services (InTune / PIM / EPM / Azure Stack) – Ensuring Effective Cloud Configuration / Operation
Backup / Recovery Expertise – Utilize Veeam for Backup / Replication – Developing / Implementing DR Plans for Data Integrity / Business Continuity
Scripting / Automation – Automate Tasks / Configuration via PowerShell / Scripting Languages – Supporting Infrastructure Efficiency / Consistency
Infrastructure as Code (IaC) – Implement / Manage Infrastructure with Terraform – Automating Deployment / Configuration Processes
Agile Methodology Participation – Engage in Sprint Planning / Stand-Ups / Retrospectives – Supporting Agile Project Execution
System Monitoring / Optimization – Set Up Monitoring Tools (e.g., Datadog / Site24x7) – Ensuring Infrastructure Performance / Reliability
Infrastructure Troubleshooting / Support – Resolve IT Infrastructure Issues / Collaborate with Teams / Vendors – Minimizing Downtime / Ensuring Continuity
Documentation / Reporting – Maintain Configuration / Process / Procedure Records – Generating Reports on System Performance / Capacity / Security

JOB REQUIREMENTS
Infrastructure Engineer – Windows / Linux / Server / Cloud / Virtualization / M365 / IaC / Terraform / DevOps
PowerShell Scripting – Hands-on Scripting / Routine Task Automation / Configuration
Cloud Services – Azure / Setup / Configuration / Management
M365 Services – InTune / Endpoint Manager / PIM / EPM (Endpoint Protection Manager) / MS Stack in Azure
Deployment / Patching – Windows / Linux / Virtual Environments | Implement Patches / Upgrades
Backup Solutions – Veeam Backup (strongly preferred) | Setup / Install / Configure / Manage | Develop / Implement Backup / DR Plans
Monitoring / Performance Optimization – DataDog / Site24x7 (strongly preferred) | Setup Monitoring Solutions | Ensure Performance / Availability / Reliability
IaC (Infrastructure-as-Code) – Terraform / DevOps Principles (strongly preferred) | Implement / Manage Infrastructure with IaC Principles / Tools | Automate Deployment / Configuration Processes
Troubleshooting / Support – Identify / Resolve Infrastructure Issues / Timely Responses | Troubleshoot Complex Problems / Implement Solutions
SCRUM / Agile Workflow – Participate in Spring Planning / Daily Standups / Retrospectives, etc.
Documentation / Reporting – Maintain Accurate Documentation on Configurations / Processes / Procedures | Generate Regular Reports on System Performance / Capacity / Security Metrics

PREFERRED (not required)
Enterprise-Level Monitoring Platforms – DataDog / Site24x7

title: Ubuntu Server Admin/Javascript DevOps
job_description:
Company Overview
AniBot is a patented technology that is intended to revolutionize the animation industry through a new type of software that automates the animations process. From data vizualization to long form animated movies, AniBot can create any kind of animation, Visual FX, or digital content.
Summary
We are looking for a systems professional to get our prototype working correctly, which is curently on a cloud host. The job in question is a project contract with set parameters, namely getting the website based interface up and running and producing output. There may be an opportunity in the future to direct development of an app interface instead of the current website based system.
Current technologies include:
Javascript (front end UI) - required
Python (back end system) - required
Ubuntu (current OS) - required
Blender 3D - nice to have
Experience with Hostinger - nice to have
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Experience with Ubuntu since this is the current OS of the system
Experience with getting a server online and making sure the javascript and python is working
Ability to take a system with little documentation and make sense of it through exploring the structure of it
Documenting a new system so that support can maintain it
Acting as an on call support in case of system issues
Requirements/what we need:
The server is stable and running, but the python scripts that use Blender as a backend do not seem to be rendering and creating an .MPEG file. It is also possible it IS rendering properly but it is not updating the UI to show so. This needs to be troubleshoot.
After this is fixed, we need to get the function that uploads the completed video to a user's Google drive or uploads to a private youtube channel working.
We need to extensively test the system end-to-end, we have scripts and a test plan for this but you will be the primary support person for this effort.
You have full freedom to make suggestions on how to implement our needs. For instance, if you want to port the OS over to a windows systems or redesign the architecture, this is fine as long as it passes integration tests and is documented.
100% remote ok, it would be really great if you were in the Columbus, Ohio area so we can collaborate in person occassionally.
Job Type: Contract
Pay: $30.00 - $40.00 per hour
Expected hours: 10 – 20 per week
Work Location: Remote

title: Q3 2025 DevOps Engineer
job_description:
Company Description
We’ve all had a recruiting experience that stands out, either because it was magical or ‘oh so horrible.’ The technology that recruiting teams use to find, connect with, and advance talent often shapes a candidate’s experience. Yello’s software enables employers to recruit effectively and efficiently. If it excites you to be a part of a team that helps some of the world’s largest brands connect with their future employees, then come grow your career with Yello.

Founded in 2008, Yello is a venture-backed talent acquisition software company that empowers Fortune 500 and fast-growing enterprise companies to find the best talent for their organizations — and helps people early in their careers find their dream job.
About The Role
You’ll be a key member of the Yello Infrastructure Team. As a DevOps Engineer, you are responsible for supporting and scaling Yello's SaaS products. You will enable Software Engineering to rapidly build, deploy, and test through CI/CD automation. This role focuses on building, maintaining, and improving applications built on AWS and Kubernetes.
How You'll Make An Impact
RESPONSIBILITIES
Automate AWS cloud infrastructure using Terraform and custom scripts.
Orchestrate and execute operational tasks using Ansible playbooks and custom scripts.
Build, maintain, and run cloud infrastructure on AWS and other IaaS providers.
Build and maintain Jenkins and GitLab CI pipelines.
Set standards and best practices for containerized applications and deployments.
Automate the deployment of containerized applications on Kubernetes using GitLab CI and Helm.
Develop Ansible playbooks to build and configure EC2 instances and AMI images.
Participate in the Infrastructure team on call rotation
What We're Looking For
REQUIREMENTS
3+ years of professional Linux systems administration or DevOps experience
Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) or other cloud providers
Experience managing and maintaining CI/CD tools and pipelines, such as GitLab or Jenkins
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Helm
Strong scripting skills with Ruby or Python
Experience with systems configuration management. Terraform and Ansible preferred
Intimate knowledge of the Linux command line including shell scripting
Strong standardization, policy and process drive
Additional Information
We are open to remote candidates based in the following states: AZ, CA, CO, FL, GA, IL, IN, KS MI, NC, NH, NJ, NV, NY, PA, TN, TX, VA, and WI
Yello is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status
You must be authorized to work in the United States. Yello is not offering visa sponsorship for this role
Must be able to sit or stand for continuous periods of time
This role frequently communicates/interacts with individuals, must have strong written and oral communication skills
Yello reserves the right to assign or reassign the responsibilities and requirements to this job at any time
This role has an estimated base salary range of $100,000 to $125,000.
