title: DevOps Engineer
job_description:
Company Overview: Comprehensive practice management solutions for the elective medical industry are essential for improving efficiency, and the client-centric culture of the PatientNow team is well-poised to continue delivering solutions that allow our customers to spend more time where they want to, with their patients. With our expanding line of products, we demonstrate our commitment to delivering purpose-built technology to medical aesthetics and wellness service providers in our ever evolving market. PatientNow continues to see Med Spa business growth, in addition to expansion in the areas of nutrition, weight loss and hormone replacement. PatientNow’s goal is to be the elective medical industry’s most trusted and intuitive practice management solution— fueled by innovation, integration, and strategic partnerships, delivered by a team with unrivaled grit.

Vision - Empowering practices and businesses to improve health and wellness worldwide by helping their clients look and feel their best.

Mission - PatientNow is elevating businesses focused on beauty, wellness and medical aesthetics with innovative, all-in-one software and consulting service solutions. People who partner with us stand out in the industry with strong market differentiation, while streamlining operations for long term success and sustainable growth.

Values –
Show up – being present and supportive: for each other through collaboration and respect, for our customers with exceptional service, and for the business with dedication to excellence and growth.
Own the outcome – By understanding the objective, exceeding expectations with pride, confirming resolution, communicating early and often, and continuously learning and improving
Be Authentic - By sharing thoughts and opinions, keeping promises, showing your true self, and engaging with respect

Position Summary: The DevOps Engineer plays a critical role in supporting the delivery, stability, and scalability of our cloud-native SaaS platform. This mid-level position focuses on implementing automation across CI/CD pipelines, managing infrastructure using IaC tools, and ensuring environment consistency within a fully AWS-hosted ecosystem. The role works closely with cross-functional teams to maintain observability, troubleshoot deployment issues, and integrate security best practices. Through hands-on execution and collaboration, the DevOps Engineer helps drive efficiency, reliability, and alignment with organizational goals.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the following satisfactorily; other duties may be assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Build and enhance automation for Continuous Integration (CI), Continuous Delivery (CDE), and Continuous Deployment (CD) workflows.
Develop and maintain infrastructure provisioning and configuration using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, or AWS CDK.
Contribute to provisioning efforts to ensure consistent and reliable environments across development, testing, and production.
Manage source control strategies and branching models to ensure clean and consistent versioning across codebases.
Integrate automated unit, performance, and security testing into CI/CD pipelines.
Maintain observability tooling—including dashboards, metrics, logging, and alerting—with solutions such as Datadog and AWS CloudWatch.
Leverage AWS-native tools such as CloudWatch and X-Ray for real-time performance insights and debugging.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues across cloud infrastructure, build pipelines, and deployment environments.
Continuously evaluate pipeline performance and recommend improvements for speed, reliability, and cost-efficiency.
Assist in managing build artifacts using platforms such as Artifactory, NuGet, or GitHub Packages to support version-controlled deployments.
Support system configuration and provisioning through tools like Ansible, Chef, or Puppet.
Foster partnerships with internal teams (Software Engineering, Quality Assurance, Product Management, Cybersecurity, IT Infrastructure) enabling alignment with organizational objectives.
Competencies: To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following.

Adaptability - Demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles. Measures self against standard of excellence. Recognizes and acts on opportunities. Sets and achieves challenging goals. Takes calculated risks to accomplish goals.

Business Ethics – Inspires the trust of others. Keeps commitments. Treats people with respect. Upholds organizational values. Works with integrity and ethically.

Communications - Exhibits good listening and comprehension. Expresses ideas and thoughts in written form. Expresses ideas and thoughts verbally. Keeps others adequately informed. Selects and uses appropriate communication methods.

Continuous Learning - Assesses own strengths and weaknesses. Pursues training and development opportunities. Seeks feedback to improve performance. Shares expertise with others. Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills.

Problem Solving - Develops alternative solutions. Gathers and analyzes information skillfully. Identifies problems in a timely manner. Resolves problems in early stages. Works well in group problem solving situations.

Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities. Contributes to building a positive team spirit. Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views. Gives and welcomes feedback. Puts success of team above own interests.

Education/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field preferred; equivalent professional experience will be considered.
5+ years in DevOps, site reliability, or infrastructure-focused roles supporting cloud-native software development.
Strong working knowledge of CI/CD principles with hands-on use of GitHub Actions, AWS CodePipeline, and CodeBuild for automation, testing, and deployment.
Proven ability to support build and release workflows for .NET/C# and Angular applications, along with familiarity with Python, Node.js, and React.
Skilled in managing AWS services across compute, storage, networking, IAM, and provisioning tasks.
Well-versed in toolchains such as Ansible, Artifactory, AWS CLI, AWS Systems Manager, Docker, GitHub, GitHub Packages, and Jira.
Applied Infrastructure as Code using tools like Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, or AWS CDK.
Comfortable working in Linux environments such as Redhat or Ubuntu.
Proficient in scripting with Python, PowerShell, YAML, or Bash to automate operational tasks.
Capable of leveraging observability platforms like Datadog and AWS CloudWatch for monitoring, logging, and alerting.
Team-oriented and resourceful, with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to thrive in cross-functional, fast-paced environments.

Supervisory Responsibilities:
This position does not have supervisory responsibilities.

Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit at a desk and work on a computer for prolonged periods.

title: System Admin/ DevOps (Remote)
job_description:
Remote
Work Type: Contract

About Roq.ad
We are building a global identity resolution system for the open Internet. We use our
Machine Learning algorithm to analyse dozens of terabytes of data daily and predict device
profiles for hundreds of millions of people.
We started out in 2015 in Berlin and Poznan. Then, we opened our office in Vilnius and
London. In 2020 we started to conquer the United States, from San Francisco. We seek
engineers to join our technical hub in Poznan, Poland.
We are looking for an experienced System Admin & Security Specialist to join our team. With
a high degree of responsibility, you’ll play an active role in helping shape this large digital
advertising market in Europe and the wider future of Roq.ad. The candidate will play an
active role in our future and work with us either remotely or from one of our hubs in the US.

Your responsibilities
Configure, maintain and update hundreds of servers in our clusters
Help to design and implement scalable and highly available systems
Ensure uninterrupted working of the administered systems
Support developers with your operating system knowledge
Automate boring parts of systems’ administration
Care of our infrastructure’s security
Document and collaborate in WIKI, JIRA & GitHub.

What we expect from you
You must have the following:
Problem solving attitude and love for automating things
Understanding of Linux operating system on an advanced level
Practical experience with AWS (IAM and S3)
Practical experience with Kubernetes
Practical knowledge of bash, Python or other scripting language
Practical experience with Chef, Puppet or Ansible
Ability to rapidly learn new technologies
Knowledge of REST architectural style and HTTP protocol
English (read and write documentation)

Optional, but works in your favour:
Knowledge of the following technologies: Apache Kafka, Apache Spark,
Avro, Apache Parquet, Hadoop, Proxmox
Deep understanding of JVM (memory management and garbage collection, Java
memory model, concurrency, etc.)
Fluency in English
What we offer
Work with an extremely motivated and skilled team of top performers
A competitive salary
Hardware and software of your choice (laptop machine with Linux, OSX or
Windows, external monitor, IntelliJ IDEA, etc.)
Conference budget
Company team building retreats in attractive locations

Send your application with CV attached to zaneta@roq.ad

title: DevOps Engineer
job_description:
We are seeking an experienced DevOps Engineer to join our systems administration group. You will play a crucial role in maintaining and enhancing infrastructure for an information security company You will work collaboratively across the company, engaging with security analysts and software developers to design and implement efficient and effective solutions.
This position is remote, but with an option to work in an office setting in Sturgis, SD if desired.
Key Responsibilities
Develop, maintain, and optimize GitLab CI/CD pipelines.
Utilize infrastructure as code (e.g. Pulumi, Terraform) and configuration as code (e.g. Salt Stack, Ansible) for infrastructure automation and management.
Deploy resources to DigitalOcean, AWS, and Azure.
Utilize Packer to build standardized images for use in automation.
Develop and maintain applications using shell scripting, Python, and Golang to support our infrastructure needs.
Instrumenting, logging, and metrics monitoring (e.g. Elastic, Prometheus, etc.) in existing applications and infrastructure.
Implement and manage Docker containers and deployments.
Collaborate with security analysts and developers to understand their needs and deliver tailored solutions.
Ensure the reliability, security, and scalability of infrastructure and applications.
Work with BHIS customers to troubleshoot and support deployments in various networks and environments, as needed.

Experience with cloud infrastructure platforms including DigitalOcean, AWS or Azure.
Strong experience as a DevOps Engineer, with an optional focus on Cyber Security.
Strong experience in “GitOps” in GitLab environments.
Strong experience with infrastructure automation tools such as Terraform, Pulumi, Salt Stack, and Ansible.
Strong experience with instrumenting, logging, and metrics monitoring.
Strong experience programming in either Python or Golang.
Strong experience with Docker.
Strong experience with Windows and Linux operating systems.
Familiarity using git for version control.
Familiarity with Bash scripting.
Optional experience with React, Packer, and Proxmox.
Self-motivated and able to work independently in a remote setting.

job_description:

.

title: AI DevOps Engineer
job_description:
About DuploCloud:
DuploCloud is a software platform that allows engineering teams to achieve their infrastructure automation, security and compliance goals by offering DevOps-as-a-Service. We strive to make DevOps and Infrastructure-as-Code accessible for everyone; where application developers can focus on building applications rather than writing thousands of lines of code to automate well known operational workflows and compliance standards. DuploCloud is a venture backed company, Series-B funded by Mayfield Fund, WestBridge Capital and StepStone Group.
About DuploCloud
DuploCloud is a software platform that allows engineering teams to achieve their infrastructure automation, security and compliance goals by offering DevOps-as-a-Service. We strive to make DevOps and Infrastructure-as-Code accessible for everyone; where application developers can focus on building applications rather than writing thousands of lines of code to automate well known operational workflows and compliance standards. DuploCloud is a venture backed company, Series-B funded by the Mayfield fund.
About the Role
DuploCloud is looking for a DevOps Engineer with a demonstrated background in cloud automation. The role involves understanding customer DevOps use cases and developing Python automation solutions that can be integrated into the DuploCloud AI HelpDesk as AI Agents.
Working within our AI Growth Team, you'll collaborate closely with our Onboarding team, Operations Team, and customers directly to support their implementation and support needs. This role will contribute significantly to the company's growth trajectory by creating AI-powered DevOps solutions for our existing customer base.

BI- LINGUAL ENGLISH/SPANISH

title: Customer Engineer
job_description:
Who are we and what do we do?
BrowserStack is the world's leading software testing platform powering over two million tests every day across 19 global data centers. BrowserStack's products help developers build bug-free software for the 5 billion internet users accessing websites and mobile applications through millions of combinations of digital environments—devices, browsers, operating systems, and versions. We help Tesco, Shell, NVIDIA, Discovery, Wells Fargo, and over 50,000 customers deliver quality software at speed by moving testing to our Cloud. title: Strategic Technical Product Owner - Software Development Expert
job_description:
** This is an opportunity to join our top-notch software development team working closely together on interesting projects for our clients. This position is fully remote (indefinitely).**
Emergent Software is looking for a strategic technical product owner / software development expert who is a smart, passionate, and enjoys problem solving using technology and software. A qualified candidate is a product owner with 7+ years of experience gathering requirements and managing the delivery of custom web application development projects in the Microsoft stack. This 100% remote position is for self-starters with good communication skills, strong technology knowledge, and experience with agile methodologies.
Highlights & Benefits of working at Emergent Software
Work closely with other talented software engineers and analysts. Our vetting process means you can count on your team members to know what they are talking about.
Work from home or work remotely from anywhere you want
Flexible work schedule meaning you can work regular hours or whenever you work best
Work-life balance is essential and highly valued at Emergent Software. If you choose to work more than 40 hours, you’ll be compensated for the extra work!
Work on interesting projects solving complex business problems with custom software.
100 hours per year to focus on your professional development. We invest in your growth!
Profit sharing bonus means as we’re successful, you’re successful
Excellent benefits package including medical insurance, dental, vision, 401(k) matching, FSA, disability, life insurance, and paid parental leave
Primary Duties
As a Strategic Technical Product Owner you act as trusted partner and technical expert for our clients, helping them to plan and implement technical solutions for business challenges.
You will gain a thorough understanding of your project's objectives including target scope, cost, and timeline.
You will also guide client planning and road mapping beyond the project at hand, looking to set the stage for future opportunities and technical maturity for their organization.
Communicate technical and business requirements to software engineers – you must already understand how custom applications work before you start this job!
Ensure projects stay on target by regularly communicating status, risks, and change as they occur.
Work directly with clients to manage project delivery while encouraging and fostering an agile delivery method
Manage requirements and scope using common agile development methodologies and a backlog stored within Microsoft Azure DevOps.
Help evaluate engagement plans and high level solutioning to ensure clear deliverables are identified prior to project kickoff.
Partner with clients to assist them in performing the Product Owner role.
Work with leadership and other team members to mature our Agile and overall software delivery practices.
Other related duties as needed to ensure project success.
Required Qualifications
Previous consulting experience either independent consulting or with a firm
Expert level understanding of software development life cycle models including both Agile and traditional project management principles
A proven track record of successfully implementing custom application projects using Agile methodologies
7+ years of experience as a Product Owner on complex custom software development projects
Experience working with and presenting to senior stakeholders, including C-Suite level executives
Strong technical background enabling you to provide credible leadership to development teams and accurately evaluate complex project risks and issues
A solid understanding of how websites, web applications, APIs, databases, and the cloud function at a high level
Experience with agile work organization tools (Azure DevOps, Jira, Trello, Basecamp, Rally)
Experience operating as the liaison between agile development teams and users in defining requirements, performing business analysis, and driving delivery in the right direction
Strong technical writing, verbal communication, and presentation skills are a must
Occasional travel to client sites may be requested for activities such as annual planning meetings. Although travel is not expected to be frequent, the ability to accommodate occasional travel is required.
Nice to Have Experience
Industry recognized Agile process certification (CSM, SAFe, LeSS, or equivalent) or PMP
Previous experience on a mature agile development team in roles such as developer, PM, Scrum Master, QA, etc.
Experience on projects utilizing Microsoft stack technologies such as .NET, SQL Server, and Azure as well as JavaScript frameworks such as React, Angular, and Vue.js
Some examples of profiles/backgrounds that we feel would do well in this role:
Software engineer turned product owner
Computer Science degree that is currently in a TPO role
Someone who is a product owner with a passion for the technical side of software development
Our Vetting Process
At Emergent Software, we work hard to find the best analysts capable of delivering high quality software for our clients. If you think you’re one of those, please understand that the effort put into this by people like yourself helps us be successful in surrounding you with other top-notch people. Here are the steps of our vetting process for this position:
Application (5 minutes)
Online Assessment (40-50 minutes)
Initial Phone Interview (30-45 minutes)
Technology Knowledge Assessment Interview (20-30 minutes)
Challenge Interview (90 minutes)
Final Interview (60-90 minutes)
Job Offer!
Benefits Package Details
Medical Insurance: up to 80% of your monthly medical premium (HSA options available)
HSA Contribution: up to $144/month
Dental & Vision Insurance: up to 50% of your monthly dental and vision premium costs
401(k) plan: company match up to 4% of salary
Profit sharing bonus: up to 15% of salary paid quarterly
Extra compensation: get paid extra for work over 40 hours/week
Employee referral & customer referral bonuses
Flex Spending Account (FSA) for Dependent Care & Healthcare Costs
Dependent Care FSA Contribution: $90/month
Short Term Disability: $500/week for 12 weeks
Long Term Disability: up to $6,000/month
Group term life and AD&D insurance: $50k
PTO, standard holidays, 2 floating holidays
Paid parental leave: 2 weeks
Staff development program: 100 hours/year plus training costs
About Emergent Software
Emergent Software is a fast-growing software development, cloud consulting, and data engineering company serving clients across the country. We are regularly adding to our team of talented software engineers, cloud architects, data engineers, UX designers, technical product owners and more who can help us deliver high quality services for our clients.
We are a remote-first company
Since our inception, we've embraced a remote-friendly culture, promoting work flexibility beyond the norm. When the pandemic struck in 2020, our transition to fully remote work was seamless—just a matter of cleaning out the fridge. Recognizing an opportunity, we adopted a remote-first approach and began hiring talent from anywhere. We continue to offer our signature Minnesota-nice, Midwest-friendly attitude, ensuring everyone feels valued, whether or not they're familiar with the skyway system.
Your career grows with us
Working with talented engineers on interesting projects creates an engaging environment for software development enthusiasts. By working directly with our experienced team, participating in our staff development program, and solving complex problems across a variety of projects, you’ll find numerous opportunities for long-term career growth.
At Emergent Software, your ideas will be heard, you will grow exponentially as a master of your craft, and you will enjoy working other dedicated team members to deliver software solutions for our clients.
Check out what others say
Visit our Glassdoor page to discover how employees enjoy our remote working structure, flexible hours, profit sharing program, and more!

title: Software Engineer - Frontend
job_description:
Who we are

The problem: Every minute matters in fire response. As climate change amplifies the intensity of wildfires—with longer fire seasons, dryer fuels, and faster winds—new ignitions spread faster and put more communities at risk. Today, most wildfires are detected by bystanders and reported via 911, meaning it can take hours to detect a fire, verify its exact location and size, and dispatch first responders. Fire authorities need a faster way to detect, confirm, and pinpoint fires so that they can quickly respond—preventing small flare-ups from becoming devastating infernos.

About Pano: Pano AI is a 100+ person growth stage start-up, headquartered in San Francisco, that is the leader in early wildfire detection and intelligence, helping fire professionals respond to fires faster and more safely—with the right equipment, timely information, and enhanced coordination—so that they can stop a new ignition before it grows. Pano AI combines advanced hardware, software, and artificial intelligence into an easy-to-use, web-based platform. Leveraging a network of ultra-high-definition, 360-degree cameras atop high vantage points, as well as satellite and other data feeds, Pano AI produces a real-time picture of threats in a geographic region and delivers immediate, actionable intelligence.

MIT Technology Review listed Pano as one of the top 15 climate tech companies to watch in 2024 and Fast Company named Pano AI one of the Top 10 most innovative companies in AI of 2023. We’ve also been featured in the Wall Street Journal, Bloomberg, CNBC News, and a national TV commercial produced by strategic partner T-Mobile. Pano AI’s dozens of government and enterprise customers span 10 states in the U.S., five states in Australia, and BC, Canada, helping protect more than 30 million acres of land. Pano AI has raised $89M in venture capital funding from Giant Ventures, Liberty Mutual Ventures, Tokio Marine Future Fund, Congruent Ventures, Initialized Capital, Salesforce Ventures, and T-Mobile Ventures. Learn more at https://www.pano.ai/.

The Role

The Frontend Engineer will strategize, design, and execute the user interface and experience for a single-page application dedicated to early wildfire detection. Responsibilities include collaborating closely with the product team to enhance map functionality, enhancing our custom canvas video player, and extending React application functionality. The engineer will deliver thoroughly tested, accessible solutions while adhering to best practices and ensuring cross-device compatibility.
What you’ll do
Feature Development: Lead the development of new features, ensuring they align with project goals and enhance overall functionality.
Code Maintenance: Maintain and enhance existing codebase to optimize extensibility and address evolving requirements.
Code Review: Conduct thorough code reviews, providing constructive feedback to maintain code quality and adherence to best practices.
Code Quality Advocate: Championing the creation of readable code with predictable patterns to enhance collaboration and maintainability. Prioritize code quality by emphasizing accessibility principles, incorporating security best practices, and writing testable code.
Best Practices Evolution: Actively contribute to evolving coding standards and best practices within the development team.
Technology Evaluation: Participate in evaluating new technologies and tools, ensuring the adoption of effective solutions that align with project needs.
Tech Debt Prioritization: Collaborate in prioritizing and addressing technical debt to maintain a healthy and sustainable codebase.
Legacy Application Management: Successfully navigate and contribute to our existing application, striking a balance between addressing technical debt and delivering new features.
Expert Debugging Skills: Possess strong debugging capabilities to identify and resolve issues promptly, ensuring the stability and reliability of React applications.
REST API Integration: Proficient in utilizing RESTful APIs to facilitate smooth communication between the frontend and backend of React applications.
What you’ll bring
2+ years of Frontend Engineer Experience: Demonstrate a robust background in developing Frontend applications, showcasing proficiency and expertise in creating efficient and scalable solutions.
Technical Proficiency: Experience with the following technologies HTML, CSS, Typescript, React, React Testing Library, Jest, and a state management solution like Redux (we use Recoil). Bonus points for HTML Canvas, or Map Technologies.
Design System and Component Library Proficiency: Proven expertise in utilizing Design Systems like Material Design and component libraries such as Material-UI, showcasing efficiency and consistency in development processes.
Effective Communication: Ability to communicate efficiently within the team, sharing insights and updates, and collaborating effectively to achieve project goals.
Cross-functional Team Experience: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including QA, Product, and Backend, to plan and execute project initiatives.
Preference for someone in PST or MT time zone
Final salary offered is based upon multiple factors, including individual job-related qualifications, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and location. In addition to salary, this position is also eligible for stock options. We offer comprehensive health insurance, paid time off, and 401k.
Pano is an equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and supporting our team-members regardless of where they come from. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Technical Program Manager
job_description:
At Frontier Energy, we’re more than just engineers and professionals—we’re a team of innovators, problem-solvers, and visionaries dedicated to advancing clean energy solutions. Our mission is to pioneer the intelligent use of energy for a sustainable and resilient future.
We offer a collaborative and dynamic workplace where your ideas are heard, nurtured, and transformed into impactful solutions. With a flat hierarchy and open-door policy, every team member is empowered to experiment, take ownership, and make a real difference.
Beyond fostering an inspiring culture, we provide competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for growth. Join us and be part of a team that’s shaping the future of energy while leaving a positive impact on the world.
Frontier Energy is in search of a Technical Program Manager to lead several programs supporting technical and regulatory activities focused on energy efficiency and decarbonization for our Regional Energy Network and Community Choice Aggregation clients. Program activities include development of targeted communication and outreach strategies, and services for customer and building professional engagement on topics ranging from single family, multifamily, commercial, building codes and standards, project financing, and contractor training for energy efficiency and building decarbonization. In addition, anticipated projects will benefit from an attention to issues of equity and access, with a focus on diverse communities and interests that are traditionally underserved.
The Technical Program Manager job duties and Responsibilities include the following:
· Develop and manage program budgets, milestone timelines, and reporting deliverables.
· Support regulatory analysis, data QA/QC, and engineering evaluations on behalf of Frontier’s clients.
· Perform research and analysis and develop clear and concise written summaries of findings.
· Oversee project team members and their assigned tasks for achieving program success.
· Actively work with clients, stakeholders, partners, and the public to further program goals.
· Manage client relationships and support the development of business proposals and funding applications.
· Provide support to other program teams on an ad-hoc basis.
· Actively work with stakeholders, partners, and the public to continually uncover and leverage communication channels and opportunities to exceed program goals.
Qualifications:
· B.S. in business administration, management, mechanical engineer, engineering, statistics, economics, environmental science, or related major
· 8+ years’ experience working on energy efficiency and or other programs for utility and or local government clients
· “Customer service” ethic to serve our clients and program partners
· Competent in general aspect of building science, energy efficiency principles and practice
· Excellent skills with MS O365 office suite
· Must be able to travel and participate in work events during non-business hours as required
Required Skills:
· Experience running cost effectiveness calculations (CETs) via the California Energy Data and Reporting System (CEDARS)
· Knowledgeable of using the California Electronic Technical Reference Manual (CA eTRM) to pull energy efficiency measures
· Experience with local government agencies, California regulatory agencies, and regional and state level utility stakeholders
· Strong data analysis and qualitative skills, including performing QA/QC of large data sets and working with large data arrays.
· Advanced user of Salesforce as a program support and reporting function
· Experience working with issues of access and equity for energy and water affordability, either through policy activities or engagement with communities that are traditionally underserved.

Pay: $80,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

title: Software QA Tester
job_description:
Overview:
Remote (U.S. Based) | Some Travel Required

LMI is a consultancy dedicated to improving the business of government, drawing from deep expertise in advanced analytics, digital services, logistics, and management advisory services. Established in 1961, LMI is a trusted third party to federal civilian, national security, and defense agencies, operating free of commercial and political bias. For nearly 60 years, LMI has worked with 40 government agencies. We believe government can make a difference, and we seek talented, hardworking, mission-driven people who share that conviction.

Who We Are
We’re not here to maintain the status quo – we’re here to rewrite it and innovate at the pace of need. Our team is laser-focused on creating cutting-edge RFID solutions for the DoD that bring passive and active RFID tech to life, solving tough integration challenges across global sites. We're a get-after-it kind of company where initiative is rewarded, and innovation is our default setting. If you’re ready to dive in, take ownership, and ship real value, keep reading.
Responsibilities:
The Opportunity
We’re hiring a Software QA Tester to support our core development team by running manual tests, validating features, and creating clear, reusable test cases. You’ll work alongside developers, product owners, and UX designers to ensure every release meets functional expectations, handles edge cases, and works in the real world.

This role is about hands-on testing, clear documentation, and a relentless focus on finding issues before users do.

What You'll Do
Review user stories, acceptance criteria, and feature specs to create detailed test cases.
Execute functional, regression, end to end, and exploratory tests across our web and mobile applications.
Document bugs clearly and concisely using tools like Jira.
Participate in Agile ceremonies, backlog grooming, and sprint planning.
Work closely with engineers to validate fixes and ensure issues are fully resolved.
Support user acceptance testing (UAT) and field deployment validation when needed.

Qualifications:
What We’re Looking For
3+ years of experience in software testing.
Strong understanding of test planning, test case writing, and bug reporting.
Familiarity with tools like Jira and Confluence.
Familiarity with basic database queries to validate data integrity.
Comfortable working in fast-paced Agile teams.
Detail-oriented mindset and strong communication skills.
Ability to obtain a security clearance is required.

Bonus Points For:
Experience testing apps built with .NET, Vue.js, or SQL Server backends.
Familiarity with basic database queries to validate data integrity.
Prior experience supporting government, DoD, or enterprise clients.
Exposure to mobile app testing or RFID-related systems.
Security+ certification.

Target salary range: $99,161.74 - $171,168.42

Disclaimer:

The salary range displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is not a guarantee of compensation. Individual salaries are determined by various factors including, but not limited to location, internal equity, business considerations, client contract requirements, and candidate qualifications, such as education, experience, skills, and security clearances.

#LI-SH1

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
Job Title: Data Analyst – Healthcare Analytics
Job Summary
We are seeking a highly analytical and self-motivated Data Analyst to join our healthcare analytics team. This role is ideal for someone who thrives on solving complex problems, optimizing workflows, and making data-driven decisions that drive meaningful change across care delivery models. You’ll collaborate cross-functionally with clinical, actuarial, and IT stakeholders to analyze performance trends and deliver insights that improve both patient outcomes and operational efficiency.
Key Responsibilities
Collect, clean, and analyze large-scale healthcare datasets, including claims, EMR, and utilization records.
Build and automate SQL queries to support recurring and ad hoc reporting for clinical leadership.
Develop interactive dashboards and performance reports for medical management teams.
Conduct root cause analyses for metrics such as readmission rates, care delays, and quality issues.
Identify trends, cost drivers, and resource gaps to support strategic planning and staffing models.
Design and implement workflow improvements based on actionable data insights.
Collaborate with actuarial and clinical teams to forecast demand and inform resource allocation.
Partner with IT to enhance data integration and reporting system capabilities.
Ensure compliance with HIPAA and CMS reporting requirements.
Present findings to executive leadership using compelling visualizations and storytelling techniques.
Support accreditation, value-based care, and regulatory reporting initiatives.
Evaluate care delivery models and contribute to initiatives that improve patient outcomes.
Required Skills and Qualifications
Proficiency in statistical programming languages such as Python, R*, SAS, and SQL*.
Strong experience writing complex SQL queries for data extraction and transformation across large databases (e.g., MS SQL Server, Databricks).
Solid understanding of object-oriented data structures and database architecture.
Experience designing front-end interfaces or data entry forms to collect user input or enhance data integrity.

title: Data Analyst
job_description:
Education Strategy Consulting’s mission is to bring high-quality data analytics and visualizations to the field of education. To meet the demands of our growing business, we are looking for additional data analysts.

The successful candidate does not need any specific data experience or training. Anyone with a background in computing, engineering, math education, or sciences is encouraged to apply!

ESC seeks team members that are inquisitive, enjoy solving problems, and want to work collaboratively with a small group of continuous learners. In addition, we are looking for people who have:
A willingness to ask questions
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Unwavering attention to detail
Self-motivation and ability to work independently
An eagerness to learn about the US educational system
Familiarity with databases/SQL

Data analysts will work on multiple projects at a time, as part of a team effort. The tasks for each project will vary, but generally, this role is responsible for:
Exploring the internal logic of often complex data sets with subtle interconnections in order to articulate their full meaning.
Identifying anomalies within a data set, researching underlying causes, and designing or recommending solutions to the team.
Assuming responsibility for the entire lifecycle of a data project, including planning, data ingestion, data restoration, quality assurance, and preparation for visualization.

This is a full-time, remote position open to US candidates living in the Eastern Time Zone.

Education Strategy Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Data Analyst (Media Buying)
job_description:
Why this role is important:
We run one of the most aggressive and dynamic performance marketing operations in the industry, spending six figures per day testing and scaling creatives across Meta, Google, and other paid channels. This is our first full-time Data Analyst dedicated to supporting media buying at this scale and your insights will be directly responsible for millions in ad spend decisions, funnel optimizations, and rapid “code red” response moments when performance dips.
What we’re looking for:
We’re looking for a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our performance marketing team. This role is critical in driving insights across the entire funnel—from ad impression to click, to landing page behavior, and final conversion. You'll be responsible for uncovering trends and opportunities that help our media buyers and creative teams optimize campaigns for better performance. You’ll also play a critical role in troubleshooting “code red” moments when performance drops, helping to pinpoint root causes across ads, tech, and tracking.
Key Responsibilities:
Continuously analyze high volume campaign data across Facebook, Google, and other paid media platforms - often thousands of creatives and dozens of funnel variations weekly, identifying what’s working, what’s not, and why.
Identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights at the ad level, audience level, and funnel level
Own funnel analysis—monitor each stage of the user journey (impression, click, land, scroll, convert) to uncover drop-offs, optimization opportunities and anything that could lead to a decrease in performance
Own the first line of defense during ‘code red’ moments - flagging anomalies, investigating performance dips in real-time, and helping recover six figure per day ad accounts under pressure.
Conduct deep-dive analyses into post-click behavior using tools like Google Analytics, GA4, or similar platforms
Build scalable systems (dashboards, alerts, templates) to help media buyers, copywriters, and creative strategists make fast, data driven decisions without waiting for weekly reports.
Collaborate with tech/dev teams to troubleshoot data discrepancies, pixel issues, broken links, page speed problems, or attribution errors
Track key KPIs including CTR, CPC, CPM, ROAS, CVR, bounce rate, AOV, LTV, etc.
Partner with media buyers and creative teams to suggest testing ideas and scale successful campaigns
Evaluate landing page performance and suggest optimizations based on user behavior (heatmaps, scroll depth, bounce rates, etc.)
Support attribution modeling and funnel analysis to inform spend allocation and creative strategy
Clearly present insightsand findings to stakeholders in weekly and ad hoc reporting
Qualifications:
4+ years of experience in digital marketing analytics, preferably in performance marketing or ecommerce
Proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Sigma)
Strong experience with Facebook Ads Manager, Google Ads, and Google Analytics (UA and GA4)
Experience in diagnosing tracking issues, attribution breakdowns, and page-related performance drop-offs
Strong analytical mindset and ability to work under pressure during performance dips or outages
Understanding of tracking infrastructure (UTMs, pixels, conversions API, GTM, etc.)
Experience with post-click analysis tools (e.g., Hotjar or similar) is a plus
Excellent communication skills—you can turn complex data into simple insights and actions
Nice to Have:
Experience working directly with media buyers or CRO teams
SQL or basic scripting skills for querying data
Experience in A/B testing methodology and reporting
What Success Looks Like:
Your insights help us scale winning ads faster, kill losers earlier, and recover campaigns before performance losses compound.
You respond quickly and effectively during performance drops, helping resolve issues with minimal downtime
You bridge the gap between the marketing and tech teams, ensuring tracking, attribution, and page performance are always optimized
Your reports and insights drive confident decision-making across the team
You’ll Thrive in This Role If You...
Love solving puzzles under pressure and spotting patterns others miss
Are the type of person who catches data discrepancies before anyone else notices
Has experience of where to look first & identify root causes fast
Can translate dense performance data into “action bullets” for media buyers and creatives
Want your work to influence millions of dollars in daily ad spend
Prefer real-time testing environments over slow-moving reporting roles
Have leaned into leveraging AI in this field
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $130,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) 4% Match
401(k) matching
AD&D insurance
Dental insurance
Disability insurance
Flexible schedule
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Health savings account
Life insurance
Paid time off
Parental leave
Prescription drug insurance
Vision insurance
Compensation Package:
Bonus opportunities
Yearly pay
Application Question(s):
Are you able to work in the US without sponsorship (now or in the future)?
Experience:
high volume paid social campaign data: 4 years (Required)
Facebook ads manager: 4 years (Required)
funnel analysis: 4 years (Required)
supplement industry: 1 year (Preferred)
media buying analysis: 3 years (Required)

title: Business Analyst
job_description:
Job Description
We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join our team in a role that offers the opportunity to build strong cross-functional relationships and gain hands-on experience with talent management systems. This position is focused on supporting Talent Management COE tools and offers meaningful insight into succession planning processes.
Responsibilities
Serve as the primary project manager and liaison between business stakeholders and engineering teams.
Oversee initiatives from requirements gathering through to implementation.
Understand and translate opportunity areas and problem statements into clear, actionable business requirements.
Conduct user acceptance testing and facilitate focus groups to ensure the end-user experience aligns with business needs.
Support the succession tool by maintaining and enhancing the existing production module.
Implement minor changes in collaboration with engineering.
Manage communications with the business to elicit and refine requirements.
Coordinate upgrades or changes and ensure seamless communication and alignment with the engineering team.
Establish and maintain communication services across business units or from the project team to the organization.
Maintain the storage and retrieval of all project communications data and business metrics.
Review contracts, cost proposals, and contract supplements.
Set up project and work breakdown structures.
Establish and document business processes.
Track project budgets and expenditures, monitor transaction controls, and costs against budget.
Essential Skills
5-7 years of experience in business analysis and stakeholder management.
Bachelor's degree in business management, economics, finance, accounting, or a relevant field.
Minimum 2-3 years experience with program/project management skills.
Minimum 3 years experience with Excel including V-lookups.
Minimum 1 year experience with SAP SuccessFactors Succession Module.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Attention to detail and excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and manage one's time.
Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, and production methods.

SAP certification is a plus.
Experience with computer applications such as Microsoft Word and Excel.
Ability to apply accounting and mathematical principles to work.
Ability to analyze business trends and project future revenues and expenses.

title: Data Security Analyst
job_description:
Seeking a passionate and proactive Security Champion serve as a bridge between the security and development teams. This role is ideal for someone with a strong development background who is enthusiastic about embedding security into the software development lifecycle (SDLC) and enabling teams to build secure applications from the ground up.

Security Enablement
Act as a security advocate within development teams, promoting secure coding practices and awareness.
Provide guidance and training to developers on security best practices, tools, and frameworks.
Collaborate with security teams to translate security policies and standards into actionable guidance for engineering teams.
Help integrate security tools and processes into CI/CD pipelines.
Application Security
Conduct threat modeling, code reviews, and security assessments for new and existing applications.
Identify and remediate vulnerabilities in collaboration with development teams.
Support secure design and architecture decisions during the planning and development phases.
Monitor and respond to security incidents related to application vulnerabilities.
Collaboration & Communication
Serve as the primary point of contact between the security team and assigned development teams.
Champion a culture of security through regular communication, workshops, and knowledge sharing.
Participate in security communities of practice and contribute to internal documentation and playbooks.

3+ years of experience in software development, DevOps, or application security.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

title: Artificial Intelligence Technical Lead
job_description:
Position Summary:
The DSA Artificial Intelligence (AI) Technical Lead will play a crucial role in driving innovation and implementing advanced AI solutions tailored to the MilTech Solutions Contract. This position requires expertise in military and Department of Defense (DoD) AI policies, hands-on experience with AI technologies, and a commitment to enhancing operational efficiency and decision-making capabilities. The AI Technical Lead will serve as the principal evangelist and integrator of AI capabilities across an Army organization. This role will drive the adoption of AI by identifying, procuring, and deploying existing and emerging technologies; educating the workforce on AI trends and ethical use; and enabling mission-aligned innovation through low-code/no-code platforms such as Microsoft PowerApps.
Key Responsibilities:
Align with Army and DoD AI policies and ensure adherence as they evolve.
Define, manage, and oversee development of AI prototypes to address mission-critical needs.
Support implementation of Army Co-Pilot and similar AI initiatives.
Educate stakeholders on available DoD and Army-approved AI capabilities, including tools such as Ask Sage, NIPR GPT, CAMO GPT, Liger, and others.
Champion responsible and strategic use of available AI resources
Conduct AI training sessions to enhance user capabilities and understanding tailored to both technical and non-technical audiences
Establish Azure AI services for development leveraging tools like AI Foundry, Azure Machine Learning, Azure OpenAI Service, Azure Cognitive Services, Azure AI Studio, and Azure DevOps.
Enhance A365 applications with AI capabilities through integration with Azure Bot Service, Azure OpenAI Service, and other Azure AI Services.
Define organizational AI strategy including serving and the primary advisor on AI trends, tools, compliance, cybersecurity considerations and governance framework.
Drive low-code/no-code innovation via design and development of AI powered applications leveraging Army 365 Power Platform.

Qualifications:
Required:
2+ years of experience in AI/ML, data analytics, or digital transformation roles
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or related field
Proven expertise in AI development and implementation, particularly within military or DoD frameworks
In-depth knowledge of Azure AI tools and services
Strong understanding of Army Co-Pilot and other DoD-approved AI technologies
Excellent communication and training skills to educate diverse stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to manage complex AI projects and prototypes
Familiarity with DoD/Army IT environments, data governance, and compliance frameworks
Familiarity with AI governance, including ethical use, risk assessment, and tool accreditation
Experience with Microsoft Power Platform and AI integration in enterprise settings
Solid understanding of data modeling and data visualization practices
Preferred:
Prior experience supporting Army or federal programs
Knowledge of DoD and Army Data Platforms and authoritative data sources
Why This Role Matters:
As the DSA AI Lead under the MilTech Solutions Contract, you will have the opportunity to shape cutting-edge AI applications, contribute to mission-critical defense initiatives, and collaborate with top-tier professionals dedicated to enhancing military capabilities through technology. This position is central to transforming how the Army leverages AI to enhance mission readiness, operational efficiency, and workforce capability. You will shape the future of AI adoption in a secure, ethical, and scalable way—bridging innovation with impact. Join us in pioneering the next generation of AI-driven solutions for the defense sector.

#LI-AH1
#DSA209
Many of DSA's positions require the ability to obtain a security clearance. Security clearances may only be granted to U.S. citizens. In addition, applicants who accept a conditional offer of employment may be subject to government security investigation(s) and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. DSA is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. DSA is committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity and maintaining a workplace that is free from unlawful discrimination. title: Senior AI Engineer
job_description:
About the Role:
We are a fast-moving startup seeking a highly skilled Senior Software / AI Engineer to lead the design, development, and deployment of scalable software systems with integrated artificial intelligence components. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to architect intelligent solutions using large language models (LLMs), vector databases, speech-to-text technologies, and real-time AI applications with modern backend and frontend frameworks.
Key Responsibilities:
Design and implement production-grade AI pipelines, including LLM integration and vector-based retrieval (e.g., RAG systems).
Develop scalable APIs using Python-based frameworks such as FastAPI or Flask.
Lead development efforts in building front-end applications using React and TypeScript.
Optimize and manage speech-to-text tools (e.g., Whisper, Deepgram) and integrate them into the core software stack.
Collaborate with product and design teams to ship intuitive, user-friendly interfaces.
Ensure compliance with all relevant data protection laws in handling customer data and model outputs.
Conduct code reviews, mentor junior engineers, and contribute to internal engineering best practices.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).
5+ years of experience in full-stack software development.
Proven experience deploying AI/ML models or building LLM-powered tools.
Proficiency with Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, and modern development tools.
Experience working with APIs, microservices, and cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
Familiarity with vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, Weaviate, FAISS) and embedding models.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with speech-to-text (STT) models or audio transcription services.
Exposure to Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems or semantic search frameworks.
Experience in privacy-first environments, handling sensitive data securely.
Knowledge of data compliance frameworks (GDPR, CCPA, etc.).
What We Offer:
Competitive salary and benefits.
Flexible remote work environment.
Opportunity to influence the architecture of a next-generation AI product.
A culture of inclusion, innovation, and personal growth.
Accommodation and Accessibility:
We are an equal opportunity employer. If you require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process due to a disability, please contact us. We are happy to engage in an interactive process to ensure accessibility for all applicants.
Equal Employment Opportunity:
We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Record Conversations with an AI Assistant (EN_US)
job_description:
We’re offering you a unique opportunity to be part of the next big leap in AI technology. Join our exciting project to improve AI-powered Business Digital Assistants — and get rewarded for your voice!

What’s the Task?
You’ll simulate real phone conversations with an AI assistant, helping to train smarter, more intuitive voice systems used by businesses every day. Your input will directly influence how AI understands and communicates with real people.

title: Data Engineer - AI Trainer
job_description:
We are looking for proficient programmers to join our team to train our AI chatbots to code. You will work with the chatbots that we are building in order to measure their progress, as well as write and evaluate code.
To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language/framework (JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, C, C#, C++, HTML/CSS, React, Go, Java, Kotlin, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.
As part of the application process, you will be asked to complete an assessment. If you pass, you will gain access to projects. Based on the quality of your work, you will continue to receive projects regularly. We find our most successful candidates work between 5-20 hours per week, up to 40 hours.
Benefits:
This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
You can work on your own schedule
Projects are paid hourly, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work
Responsibilities:
Come up with diverse problems and solutions for a coding chatbot
Write high-quality answers and code snippets
Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance
Qualifications:
Fluency in English
Proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript
Detail-oriented
Excellent writing and grammar skills
A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)
Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you.

title: Data Scientist
job_description:
What will you be doing?
Barclays Services LLC seeks Data Scientist in Henderson, NV (multiple positions available):
Develop data modelling strategy the extensive and disperse sets of data.
Collect across multiple contact points in the operations, development, and customer support journeya and conducted in-depth analysis of user behavioral data to identify patterns,
unveiling opportunities, and establishing a cohesive understanding of user interactions with the service.
Modernize and automate Analytics processes and Machine Learning pipelines to facilitate faster time to market for releases, adopting world class standard best practices in Data
Modelling and Machine Learning to improve operational rigor and quality.
Develop and deploy supervised and unsupervised Machine Learning models to support Operational efficiency.
Spearhead the creation and automation of a comprehensive data pipeline and employ modern ETL processes for seamless integration.
Explore the use of Generative AI and Large Language Models in Customer and Colleague tools.
May telecommute.
Salary / Rate Minimum/yr: $152,500 per year
Salary / Rate Maximum/yr: $167,750 per year
The minimum and maximum salary/rate information above include only base salary or base hourly rate. It does not include any other type of compensation or benefits that may be available.
This position is eligible for incentives pursuant to Barclays Employee Referral Program.
Purpose of the role
To use innovative data analytics and machine learning techniques to extract valuable insights from the bank's data reserves, leveraging these insights to inform strategic decision-making, improve operational efficiency, and drive innovation across the organisation.
Accountabilities
Identification, collection, extraction of data from various sources, including internal and external sources.
Performing data cleaning, wrangling, and transformation to ensure its quality and suitability for analysis.
Development and maintenance of efficient data pipelines for automated data acquisition and processing.
Design and conduct of statistical and machine learning models to analyse patterns, trends, and relationships in the data.
Development and implementation of predictive models to forecast future outcomes and identify potential risks and opportunities.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to seek out opportunities to add value from data through Data Science.
Assistant Vice President Expectations
To advise and influence decision making, contribute to policy development and take responsibility for operational effectiveness. Collaborate closely with other functions/ business divisions.
Lead a team performing complex tasks, using well developed professional knowledge and skills to deliver on work that impacts the whole business function. Set objectives and coach employees in pursuit of those objectives, appraisal of performance relative to objectives and determination of reward outcomes
If the position has leadership responsibilities, People Leaders are expected to demonstrate a clear set of leadership behaviours to create an environment for colleagues to thrive and deliver to a consistently excellent standard. The four LEAD behaviours are: L – Listen and be authentic, E – Energise and inspire, A – Align across the enterprise, D – Develop others.
OR for an individual contributor, they will lead collaborative assignments and guide team members through structured assignments, identify the need for the inclusion of other areas of specialisation to complete assignments. They will identify new directions for assignments and/ or projects, identifying a combination of cross functional methodologies or practices to meet required outcomes.
Consult on complex issues; providing advice to People Leaders to support the resolution of escalated issues.
Identify ways to mitigate risk and developing new policies/procedures in support of the control and governance agenda.
Take ownership for managing risk and strengthening controls in relation to the work done.
Perform work that is closely related to that of other areas, which requires understanding of how areas coordinate and contribute to the achievement of the objectives of the organisation sub-function.
Collaborate with other areas of work, for business aligned support areas to keep up to speed with business activity and the business strategy.
Engage in complex analysis of data from multiple sources of information, internal and external sources such as procedures and practises (in other areas, teams, companies, etc).to solve problems creatively and effectively.
Communicate complex information. 'Complex' information could include sensitive information or information that is difficult to communicate because of its content or its audience.
Influence or convince stakeholders to achieve outcomes.
All colleagues will be expected to demonstrate the Barclays Values of Respect, Integrity, Service, Excellence and Stewardship – our moral compass, helping us do what we believe is right. They will also be expected to demonstrate the Barclays Mindset – to Empower, Challenge and Drive – the operating manual for how we behave.

title: AI Engineer
job_description:
We are seeking a highly skilled AI Engineer with hands-on experience in AgnoAI, multi-agent orchestration, and LLM-based automation. You will be responsible for designing, building, and deploying intelligent agents that work collaboratively to solve complex business problems across data, analytics, and operational workflows. This role blends AI, systems engineering, and autonomy — ideal for someone passionate about the next evolution of software: agentic systems.
Responsibilities
Design, build, and deploy custom agents using AgnoAI for automation, observability, and decision-making tasks
Develop and maintain multi-agent systems using the AgnoAI Control Plane and MCP (Multi-Agent Control Plane)
Implement agent-to-agent communication using planner-based orchestration, dynamic chaining, and memory sharing
Integrate agents with tools like Snowflake, DBT, Airflow, LangGraph, Redis, and APIs
Leverage LLMs to enhance agent reasoning, summarization, task delegation, and knowledge grounding
Work closely with product, data, and platform teams to operationalize agent workflows
Optimize performance, memory sharing, and autonomy in distributed agent environments
Write robust, scalable Python code with modular architecture for easy agent reuse
Must-Have Qualifications
3+ years of experience in Python software development
1+ years of hands-on experience with AgnoAI or equivalent agent orchestration frameworks (LangChain, CrewAI, LangGraph)
Solid understanding of LLMs, prompt engineering, tool usage, and memory design
Experience building agents that interact with external systems (APIs, databases, file systems)
Familiarity with AI observability concepts (volume, freshness, drift, anomaly detection)
Knowledge of workflow design, chaining, or control plane patterns
Nice To Have
Experience with vector databases (e.g., pgVector, Weaviate, Pinecone, Qdrant)
Background in MLOps, DevOps, or cloud-native architecture
Experience using AgnoAI with multi-agent coordination, planner roles, or reasoning loops
Familiarity with Redis/Kafka for agent messaging
Exposure to data observability and quality tools
Tools & Stack You Might Use
AgnoAI, LangGraph, OpenAI API
Snowflake, DBT, Airflow
Python (FastAPI, AsyncIO)
Redis / Kafka / Vault
Docker, GitHub Actions, VectorDBs

title: Arity - Data Scientist - Arity
job_description:
At Allstate, great things happen when our people work together to protect families and their belongings from life’s uncertainties. And for more than 90 years our innovative drive has kept us a step ahead of our customers’ evolving needs. From advocating for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws, to being an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, and, more recently, device and identity protection.
Job Description
Founded by The Allstate Corporation in 2016, Arity is a data and analytics company focused on improving transportation. We collect and analyze enormous amounts of data, using predictive analytics to build solutions with a single goal in mind: to make transportation smarter, safer, and more useful for everyone. At the heart of that mission are the people that work here—the dreamers, doers and difference-makers that call this place home. As part of that team, your work will showcase both your intelligence and your creativity as you tackle real-world problems and put your talents towards transforming transportation. That’s because at Arity, we believe work and life shouldn’t be at odds with one another. After all, we know that your unique qualities give you a unique perspective. We don’t just want you to see yourself here. We want you to be yourself here. Arity is fully remote, so you can be here while being at home or else take your laptop around the country and work from a new place every week!

At Arity, analytics is at the heart of what we do. We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our incredible Insurance Analytics team. Our team builds analytical products and solutions in the insurance space such as driving scores, mobility attributes, and claims outcome predictions. Our analytics community is made up of passionate and talented individuals and leaders with diverse backgrounds. We believe in a culture of recognition of good work, continuous learning, succeeding together, and having fun along the way.

The Data Scientist will join a team of data scientists and data engineers to help the team derive value from our most tremendous asset – data. The successful candidate will create models and find new signal from our wealth of telematics, insurance, and other third-party data sources. This person will ideate and follow through with analytical approaches that support our team products. To do so, they will fully utilize their data science skills, their coding expertise, and their unique point-of-view.
The day-to-day work of a Data Scientist include:
Creating and deploying models and/or supporting existing models in market
Exploring new data sources to create novel predictors of driving risk and other insurance metrics
Working closely with data engineers and actuaries to refine product offering
Establishing and following data science best practices including peer review, code review, documentation, coding standards, and ensuring reproducibility and compliance
Expanding their data science skillset through development opportunities and learning innovative tools and techniques
We are looking for a team member that has the following traits:
2 or more years of experience applying data science and analytics techniques to solve business problems. More qualified candidates will be considered for a more senior position.
Insurance industry experience is desired but not required.
A background in data science, analytics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, or related fields.
Experience creating statistical or machine learning models for business
Thorough understanding of how to work efficiently with large, complex data
Excellent coding skills in Python or R. SQL/Spark experience is a plus.
Familiarity with distributed computing is a plus.
Familiarity with working in a server environment.
Experience working on cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, AWS, Azure) is a plus.
Thrives working in a team environment
Enjoys communicating and collaborating with others
Detail-oriented, double checks data/work against expectations, and takes pride in good documentation
An innate curiosity and ability to learn new techniques and technologies
#LI-JB2
Skills
Analytical Thinking, Computer Science, Data Analysis, Data Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics
Compensation
Compensation offered for this role is $78,600.00 - 142,275.00 annually and is based on experience and qualifications.
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation.
Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.

job_description:

Job Title: AI Strategist
Reports To: COO
Company: Freedom Family Investments

Location: Remote
About Us
We're a diversified portfolio of high-growth companies transforming real estate investing, lead generation, and property acquisition across commercial real estate funds for accredited investors, exclusive lead generation for home services, and off-market property wholesaling. What sets us apart is our systematic approach to excellence across multiple industries, values-driven culture of accountability and innovation, and track record of building recession-resilient business models that generate millions in revenue while serving investors, clients, and partners nationwide.
Role Overview
We are seeking an AI Strategist to lead the development and execution of AI-driven strategies. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of AI technologies and their applications, enabling them to integrate innovative solutions into business processes. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure AI tools are aligned with company objectives and contribute to sustainable growth.

Key Responsibilities
Develop and drive the enterprise-wide AI and Generative AI strategy, including prioritization of the AI technology roadmap and support for senior leadership in strategic planning and execution.
Outline opportunities for the greatest member value or improvement to member experience from AI innovation.

Articulate intricate AI concepts and strategies to non‐technical stakeholders, utilizing compelling presentations and documentation that captivate and inform.

Define, manage, and oversee development of AI prototypes to address mission-critical needs.
Support implementation of Army Co-Pilot and similar AI initiatives.
Educate stakeholders on available DoD and Army-approved AI capabilities, including tools such as Ask Sage, NIPR GPT, CAMO GPT, Liger, and others.
Champion responsible and strategic use of available AI resources
Conduct AI training sessions to enhance user capabilities and understanding tailored to both technical and non-technical audiences
Establish Azure AI services for development leveraging tools like AI Foundry, Azure Machine Learning, Azure OpenAI Service, Azure Cognitive Services, Azure AI Studio, and Azure DevOps.
Enhance A365 applications with AI capabilities through integration with Azure Bot Service, Azure OpenAI Service, and other Azure AI Services.
Define organizational AI strategy including serving and the primary advisor on AI trends, tools, compliance, cybersecurity considerations and governance framework.
Drive low-code/no-code innovation via design and development of AI powered applications leveraging Army 365 Power Platform.

Qualifications:
Required:
2+ years of experience in AI/ML, data analytics, or digital transformation roles
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or related field
Proven expertise in AI development and implementation, particularly within military or DoD frameworks
In-depth knowledge of Azure AI tools and services
Strong understanding of Army Co-Pilot and other DoD-approved AI technologies
Excellent communication and training skills to educate diverse stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to manage complex AI projects and prototypes
Familiarity with DoD/Army IT environments, data governance, and compliance frameworks
Familiarity with AI governance, including ethical use, risk assessment, and tool accreditation
Experience with Microsoft Power Platform and AI integration in enterprise settings
Solid understanding of data modeling and data visualization practices
Preferred:
Prior experience supporting Army or federal programs
Knowledge of DoD and Army Data Platforms and authoritative data sources
Why This Role Matters:
As the DSA AI Lead under the MilTech Solutions Contract, you will have the opportunity to shape cutting-edge AI applications, contribute to mission-critical defense initiatives, and collaborate with top-tier professionals dedicated to enhancing military capabilities through technology. This position is central to transforming how the Army leverages AI to enhance mission readiness, operational efficiency, and workforce capability. You will shape the future of AI adoption in a secure, ethical, and scalable way—bridging innovation with impact. Join us in pioneering the next generation of AI-driven solutions for the defense sector.

We are looking for proficient programmers to join our team to train our AI chatbots to code. You will work with the chatbots that we are building in order to measure their progress, as well as write and evaluate code.
To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

title: AI Specialist - Trainee
job_description:
Highlights
Experience
Freshers
Joining Date
Immediate or max 30 days’ Notice Period
Qualification
Graduates in any domain who are passionate about AI
Job Description
Beinex is seeking passionate and driven individuals to join our AI Engineering team as interns. This opportunity is ideal for candidates eager to immerse themselves in the domains of Generative AI and Large Language Models (LLMs). The internship offers a structured learning experience featuring capstone projects, hands-on lab sessions, and continuous exposure to industry-leading practices and emerging technologies.
Responsibilities
Capstone Projects: Lead or co-develop a final project, such as an LLM-powered application, AI agent, or RAG pipeline, that you'll present in a showcase.
Hands-On Labs: Participate in guided lab sessions covering prompt engineering, vector databases, LLM deployments, multi-agent setups, fine-tuning strategies, and more.
Model Development & Optimization: Assist in constructing, refining, and deploying LLM-based solutions, covering prompt design, RAG integrations, and agent workflows using tools like LangChain, Hugging Face, or FastAPI.
Trend Monitoring & Evaluation: Stay updated on evolving AI engineering trends (small models, locally hosted LLMs, and multimodal systems), evaluate emerging tools and APIs, and propose potential integrations.
Collaboration: Work closely with engineers, product managers, and domain leads to align AI solutions with technical and business needs
Requirements
Nice-to-Haves
Experience with AI frameworks (LangChain, AutoGen, LLamaindex) or cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).
Familiarity with version control systems (Git).
Previous AI/ML project or coursework involving LLMs, RAG systems, or multi-agent workflows.
What You’ll Gain
Mentor-supported development across the AI tech stack, from data prep and lab exercises to deployment and capstone presentation.
In-depth exposure to current AI engineering methodologies, including prompt engineering, model optimization, RAG, LLMOps, and trending small or local LLMs.
A hands-on portfolio piece to showcase your capabilities in AI engineering.
Key Skills Requirements
LLM/Gen-AI Familiarity: Basic understanding of large language models, prompt engineering, vector-based retrieval, simple fine-tuning, or RAG pipelines.
Python Skills (Not mandatory): Familiarity with Python (or similar scripting languages) and libraries like Hugging Face, PyTorch, LangChain, LangGraph, AutoGen, or FastAPI is advantageous.
Deep Passion for Learning: Demonstrated curiosity and self-driven interest in generative AI, emerging trends, and hands-on experimentation with new tools.
Analytical & Problem-Solving Mindset: Strong ability to break down problems, analyse model outputs, troubleshoot, and propose iterative improvements.

Perks: Careers at Beinex
Comprehensive Health Plans
Learning and development
Workation and outdoor training
Hybrid working environment
On-site travel Opportunity
Beinex Branded Merchandise
