title: Analytical Engineer I
job_description:
Restaurant365 is a SaaS company disrupting the restaurant industry! Our cloud-based platform provides a unique, centralized solution for accounting and back-office operations for restaurants. Restaurant365’s culture is focused on empowering team members to produce top-notch results while elevating their skills. We’re constantly evolving and improving to make sure we are and always will be “Best in Class” ... and we want that for you too!

Restaurant365 is seeking an Analytical Engineer I to join our Enterprise Data Analytics team as a key contributor in building the foundation for data-driven decision-making across the organization. Positioned at the intersection of data engineering and analytics, this role plays an important part in maintaining governed datasets, scalable semantic layers, and analytical infrastructure that enable accurate reporting, forecasting, and advanced modeling throughout the business.

You will collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders in Product, Sales, Customer Success, and Finance to deliver reliable data solutions.
How you'll add value:
Assist in implementing analytical data models and datasets within the enterprise data platform (Snowflake, dbt, etc.) under senior guidance
Learn to build basic transformations using modern ELT practices to support reporting and dashboard requirements
Support data quality initiatives by performing validation checks and identifying data inconsistencies
Collaborate with team members to understand business requirements and contribute to data solution implementation
Learn business intelligence tools and assist in maintaining existing dashboards and reports
Document data processes and transformations as part of learning and knowledge retention
Participate in team meetings, code reviews, and training sessions to develop technical and domain expertise
Complete assigned tasks and projects while building proficiency in data analytics best practices
Shadow senior team members on stakeholder interactions to learn business context and communication skills
What you'll need to be successful in this role:
1-2 years of experience in analytics, data modeling, or business intelligence, preferably within a SaaS or data-driven organization
Foundational SQL skills with eagerness to learn advanced querying techniques
Basic understanding of data concepts and willingness to learn modern data tools (dbt, Snowflake, etc.)
Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities
Exposure to programming languages like Python or R (academic or personal projects acceptable)
Familiarity with data visualization concepts or tools (Tableau, Power BI, Excel, etc.)
Strong communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
Growth mindset with enthusiasm for continuous learning and professional development
Bonus: Experience supporting ML workflows or working with data scientists to deploy models
R365 Team Member Benefits & Compensation
This position has a salary range of $85,833.33 - $120,166.67 / year. The above range represents the expected salary range for this position. The actual salary may vary based upon several factors, including, but not limited to, relevant skills/experience, time in the role, business line, and geographic location. Restaurant365 focuses on equitable pay for our team and aims for transparency with our pay practices.
Comprehensive medical benefits, 100% paid for employee
401k + matching
Equity Option Grant
Unlimited PTO + Company holidays
Wellness initiatives

DYN365, Inc d/b/a Restaurant365 is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Solutions Engineer
job_description:
The Solutions Engineer (SE) at Torchlight is a senior technical consultant and a key member of the Solution Team Organization (STO). The SE partners with the Account Team Organization (ATO) to solve complex customer business problems that require custom solutions, deep technical validation, and advanced use of our flagship product, Catalyst. This role is responsible for architecting and demonstrating tailored solutions that leverage Catalyst's API services and platform capabilities, reducing technical uncertainty for prospects and enabling the sales team to close complex, high-value deals.
DOD Secret Clearance required (can hold up to TS/SCI)
Role is 100% telecommute
Responsibilities
The Solutions Engineer will be engaged throughout the customer opportunity lifecycle, with a primary focus on pre-sales activities where custom solutioning and deep technical validation are crucial. Key responsibilities include:
● Pre-Sales Solutioning & Technical Enablement:
○ Acquire and maintain deep technical knowledge of Catalyst's architecture, features, and API services to serve as a subject matter expert.
○ Lead technical discovery sessions and requirements gathering workshops with prospective
customers to uncover and understand their challenges, technical environments, and
desired outcomes.
○ Design, develop, and present engaging custom demonstrations and Proofs-of-Concept
(POCs) that highlight the value and feasibility of Catalyst solutions customized to meet
specific customer needs.
○ Architect and document technical solutions, outlining data flows, integrations, and
customizations to provide technical validation and contribute to proposals and Statements
of Work (SOWs).
○ Articulate complex technical concepts and solution designs to both technical and business
stakeholders, using whiteboarding and visual communication to build confidence and
consensus.
● Post-Sales Implementation & Adoption Support:
○ Provide expert technical guidance and support to customers and internal delivery teams
during the initial implementation and onboarding phases of custom solutions.
○ Develop and deploy custom scripts, integrations, or reports as defined in the SOW to
ensure successful delivery of the agreed-upon solution.
○ Create technical documentation and conduct knowledge transfer sessions to empower
customers and internal teams to operate and maintain the implemented solutions
effectively.
● Internal Collaboration & Improvement:
○ Collaborate closely with the Product and Engineering teams, channeling customer
feedback and insights to influence the product roadmap and drive continuous
improvement.
○ Partner with the Sales team to provide technical feasibility checks, solution design, and
strategic guidance throughout the sales cycle.
○ Develop reusable solution assets, code snippets, and best-practice guides to improve the
efficiency and effectiveness of the solutions engineering process.
Qualifications
● Applied Technical Expertise: Proven ability to design and implement custom analytical
solutions using APIs and scripting languages (e.g., Python, JavaScript, C++, Java, C#, Go, Rust, etc.).
● Solution Architecture: Strong experience in solution design, including familiarity with cloud platforms (GCP preferred), integration patterns (REST APIs, webhooks), and database concepts.
● Technical Consulting & Discovery: Skill in leading consultative discussions, uncovering complex business problems, and translating them into technical requirements for custom solutions.
● Excellent Communication and Presentation Skills: Capability to clearly and compellingly
present technical solutions and product demonstrations to diverse audiences, establishing
credibility and trust.
● Problem-Solving & Analytical Thinking: Strong ability to diagnose customer challenges, think analytically, and design effective, creative solutions using the Catalyst platform.
● Collaborative Team Player: Proven ability to work effectively in a team environment,
particularly with Sales, Product, and Engineering teams, to drive successful outcomes.
● Proactive Learner: Self-driven. Stays updated on new product features, API updates, and
relevant industry technologies, tools, techniques, and procedures that drive innovation and
increase impact.
Qualifications Desired
● Industry Domain Knowledge: Experience in the defense, intelligence, law enforcement, or
logistics sectors, along with familiarity with the specific challenges, trends, and use cases for data and analytics in each industry.
● Experience with SaaS Solutions: Previous experience with the advanced technical integration and customization of Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) products.
● Proposal and SOW Contribution: Experience contributing technical details to proposals and Statements of Work, clearly documenting the solution, deliverables, and scope.
About Torchlight
Torchlight Analytics LLC provides Behavior Based InsightsTM to decision-makers in government and corporate organizations to uncover emerging threats and new opportunities. Torchlight is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other protected class. U.S. Citizenship is required for positions requiring government security clearance and for certain other restricted positions.

title: Quality Assurance Engineer - AI Trainer
job_description:
We are looking for proficient programmers to join our team to train our AI chatbots to code. You will work with the chatbots that we are building in order to measure their progress, as well as write and evaluate code.
To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language/framework (JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, C, C#, C++, HTML/CSS, React, Go, Java, Kotlin, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.
As part of the application process, you will be asked to complete an assessment. If you pass, you will gain access to projects. Based on the quality of your work, you will continue to receive projects regularly. We find our most successful candidates work between 5-20 hours per week, up to 40 hours.
Benefits:
This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
You can work on your own schedule
Projects are paid hourly, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work
Responsibilities:
Come up with diverse problems and solutions for a coding chatbot
Write high-quality answers and code snippets
Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance
Qualifications:
Fluency in English
Proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript
Detail-oriented
Excellent writing and grammar skills
A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)
Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you.
#INDUSSD
Job Type: Contract
Pay: From $40.00 per hour
Benefits:
Flexible schedule
Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Software Developer
job_description:
About Us
We are working with a consumer fintech startup that has a bold vision to transform how people manage their financial lives. Their mission is to create innovative, user-centric digital solutions that empower consumers to achieve their financial goals. As they prepare to launch their first product, they are seeking their first Senior Software Developer to lead the technical development of their vision and help build something truly impactful.
Position Overview
As the Senior Software Developer, you will be the cornerstone of our technical team, driving the creation and launch of our iOS application and Google Chrome extension. You will own the development process from concept to market, fix bugs, implement innovative ideas, and ensure a seamless user experience. This role is perfect for a proactive, creative developer who thrives in an early-stage startup environment and is passionate about shaping the future of fintech.
Key Responsibilities
iOS App Development: Lead the full development lifecycle of our iOS application, from concept to design, coding, testing, and launch on the Apple App Store.
Chrome Extension Development: Build, enhance, and maintain our Google Chrome extension, adding new features and ensuring compatibility with browser updates.
Bug Fixing: Identify and resolve bugs in both the iOS app and Chrome extension to ensure reliability and performance.
Innovation Implementation: Collaborate with the founding team to translate new ideas and product enhancements into robust technical solutions.
Product Execution: Drive the technical strategy to bring our fintech product to market, focusing on scalability, performance, and alignment with business objectives.
Code Quality: Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code, following best practices to establish a strong technical foundation.
App Store Management: Manage the submission process for the iOS app, ensuring compliance with Apple’s guidelines and a successful launch.
Collaboration: Work closely with non-technical founders and external stakeholders to align technical solutions with the product vision and user needs.
Required Skills and Qualifications
Experience: 5+ years of professional software development experience, with a proven track record of building and launching iOS apps from concept to App Store release.
iOS Expertise: Strong proficiency in Swift and/or Objective-C, Xcode, and iOS frameworks (e.g., UIKit, Core Data, SwiftUI). Experience with the complete iOS development lifecycle, including debugging and deployment.
Chrome Extension Development: Hands-on experience developing and maintaining Google Chrome extensions using JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and Chrome APIs.
Bug Fixing: Exceptional debugging skills, with experience resolving complex issues in mobile and web-based applications.
Innovation: Ability to implement new features and creative ideas into products, balancing innovation with stability.
Version Control: Proficiency with Git and collaborative workflows (e.g., GitHub).
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical skills to address technical challenges and deliver solutions in a lean startup environment.
Communication: Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to non-technical team members and align on product goals.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in fintech or consumer-facing applications, with an understanding of user-centric design principles.
Familiarity with backend integration (e.g., RESTful APIs, Node.js, or Python) to connect mobile and web applications with server-side systems.
Knowledge of automated testing frameworks for iOS apps and Chrome extensions.
Previous experience as the first or early technical hire in a startup, with a track record of executing products to market.
Familiarity with App Store optimization and Chrome Web Store submission processes.
What We Offer
A pivotal role as our first technical hire, with significant influence over our product and technical direction.
Opportunity to shape a consumer fintech product from its earliest stages.
Equity compensation, offering a stake in the future success of our startup.
Flexible, remote-friendly work environment with a collaborative and passionate team.
Chance to make a meaningful impact in the fintech space and grow with an ambitious early-stage company.
How to Apply
If you’re a skilled developer with a passion for fintech and a desire to build an innovative product from the ground up, we want you on our team!
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Compensation Package:
Profit sharing
Stock options
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Work Location: Hybrid remote in Palo Alto, CA 94301

title: Commercial & Scientific Analyst New
job_description:
About the company
The mining industry has steadily become worse at finding new ore deposits, requiring >10X more capital to make discoveries compared to 30 years ago. The easy-to-find, near-surface deposits have largely been found, and the industry has chronically under-invested in new exploration technology, relying on the manual techniques of yesteryear – even as demand accelerates for copper, lithium, and other metals to build electric vehicles, renewable energy, and data centers.
KoBold builds AI models for mineral exploration and deploys those models—alongside our novel sensors—to guide decisions on KoBold-owned-and-operated exploration programs. In the six years since founding, KoBold has become by far both the largest independent mineral exploration company and the largest exploration technology developer. Our data scientists and software engineers, who come from leading technology companies, jointly lead exploration programs with our renowned exploration geologists.
KoBold has proven its first discovery with materially less capital than the industry average and found one of the best copper deposits ever discovered: the copper is far more concentrated than the global average of copper mines, and this asset alone is expected to generate meaningful revenue for decades. KoBold has a portfolio of more than 60 other projects, each of which has the potential for another high-quality discovery.
KoBold is privately held; investors include institutional asset managers T. Rowe Price, and Canada Pension Plan Investments; technology venture capitalists Andreessen Horowitz, Breakthrough Energy Ventures, BOND Capital, and Standard Investments; and natural resources companies Equinor, BHP, and Mitsubishi.
We’re hiring a Commercial & Scientific Analyst to accelerate our mission.
About the position
In this role, you will report to a Lead or Manager within the Commercial Analytics team, and work closely within a remote team of 5 - 7 (across North America and Europe) to structure ambiguous problems, build financial and operational models, and provide recommendations to the C-suite for key decisions.
The work will span a variety of topics and include traditional market analyses such as creating supply/demand forecasts and writing commodity outlook reports, and non-traditional analyses as-needed to advance KoBold’s mission – e.g., operational and financial modeling for KoBold’s exploration programs, build vs. buy decisions for KoBold’s technology, mine economics modeling, and scientific communication materials for external audiences s, to name a few.
This is an ideal role for a recent graduate looking to acquire a wide range of skills very quickly. The learning curve will be steep, and the work will be varied and intellectually demanding.

Responsibilities
The Commercial & Scientific Analyst will:
Aggregate existing research and/or conduct original research to build forecasts and models related to commodity markets, KoBold operations, mine development, and more
Work with the Commercial Analytics and Financial Planning & Analysis team to answer strategic questions from leadership
Prepare materials for the Board of Directors and investors or partners
Use a first-principles approach in collaboration with various KoBold functions to help make decisions or improve operational efficiency (e.g., cost models for technology, HR, exploration programs, carbon emissions reporting, trade-off/sensitivity analyses)
Conduct analytics for critical workstreams in mine development and exploration
Build and maintain financial models assessing project economics
Support others on the Commercial Analytics team on various analytical assignments
Qualifications
A great candidate will have:
Education in a STEM discipline or economics is preferred (physics, chemistry, astronomy/astrophysics, or mathematics).
At least 1 year of experience in technology, natural resources, finance, or professional services
Experience with Python or other scientific computing language and/or financial modeling
Excitement about working on a wide array of problems
Excellent communication and organizational skills
Regardless of formal training, a strong orientation toward thinking from first principles with respect to science, technology, economics, and business
Work practices and motivation:
Demonstrated ability to quickly absorb and synthesize complex information, with a keen eye for detail and intellectual rigor
Exceptional curiosity and eagerness to learn, with a proactive approach to exploring new concepts and technologies
Excitement about joining a fast-growing early-stage company, comfort with a dynamic work environment, and eagerness to take on a range of responsibilities
Ability to independently prioritize multiple tasks effectively
KoBold Metals is an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunities for people of any race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or veteran status.
This position is full-time, exempt.
The US base salary range for this full-time exempt position is $105,000 - $125,000
Location: KoBold is a remote first workplace, we are open to candidates currently residing anywhere in the United States, Canada, or United Kingdom. All candidates must be authorized to legally work in either the United States, Canada, or United Kingdom.

title: Junior Software Engineer
job_description:
Overview:
Corporate Tools is hiring a Junior Software Engineer for $75,000/year. You will be a traditional company employee. This is a full time 40 hour/week position with company benefits in Spokane, Washington.
Corporate Tools is always hiring great Software Engineers. We primarily code in Ruby, Javascript and use Rails and Vue. We classify this position as an entry level position within our Software Department.
Our Junior Software Developer job is a path towards becoming an integral part of our software team. This position is geared towards developers with limited experience or a recent college graduate. Through working with our team of developers, this position will put you on the path towards gaining more skills and experience to help you advance within our company.
Junior Software Engineer Jobs:
Our Junior Software Engineers spend their first year integrating and hopefully advance to becoming Software Engineers within our company. We offer a guaranteed 6 month assessment with an opportunity for a wage increase based on your proficiency in some key skills. We’ll work with you and bring you along to become a vital part of our group. This is our entry level software developer position and a great way to get started with our company. We’re looking for great people who want to do great work. We understand you might suck at writing resumes or pitching yourself, or most your code might be private. Try your best to explain to us what you can do so we can hopefully find you! If you’re a good person, like learning and improving, and want to grow your skills, we want to find you.
How to Apply:
Please apply through the link below. It’s a coding job, so showing us some code would be helpful. Preferably a flavor of Ruby or Javascript, but anything for now will do.

Wage:
$75,000 a year
Benefits:
100% employer-paid medical, dental and vision for employees
Annual review with raise option
22 days Paid Time Off accrued annually, and 4 holidays
After 3 years, PTO increases to 29 days. Employees transition to flexible time off after 5 years with the company—not accrued, not capped, take time off when you want
The 4 holidays are: New Year’s Day, Fourth of July, Thanksgiving, and Christmas Day
Paid Maternity and Paternity Leave
Up to 5% company matching 401(k) with no vesting period
Quarterly allowance
Use to make your remote work set up more comfortable, for continuing education classes, a plant for your desk, coffee for your coworker, a massage for yourself... really, whatever
Open concept office with friendly coworkers
Creative environment where you can make a difference
No dumb benefits like free dog walking on the weekends that snobby hipster places have to make you feel cool, but mathematically won't cost the company much money because you won't use it
Trail Mix Bar
- oh yeah
Responsibilities:
Develop Software
Have a Growth Mindset, not a Fixed Mindset
Learn how to become proficient in Ruby, Rails, and Vue
Requirements:

The Space Force MUOS program is currently seeking a Web Software Developer and Data Analytics Engineer in our Scottsdale, AZ, location.
The Web Software Developer we seek will work with a small team to design, build, test, deploy and support enterprise web applications to modernize the management and integration of data and design information developed for our customers. The web applications will allow the product development team to store project data in a relational database, where the data not only provides the customer with complex re-build, upgrade, and sustainment information, but the data is also available for data mining in support of maintaining licensed software installs, license allocation, and system configurations.

In this role you’ll be a Subject Matter Expert (SME) designing. developing, integrating, testing, and maintaining web applications built on the Django Python Framework using a Microsoft SQL Server database for data storage.

title: Senior Software Developer
job_description:
About Us
We are working with a consumer fintech startup that has a bold vision to transform how people manage their financial lives. Their mission is to create innovative, user-centric digital solutions that empower consumers to achieve their financial goals. As they prepare to launch their first product, they are seeking their first Senior Software Developer to lead the technical development of their vision and help build something truly impactful.
Position Overview
As the Senior Software Developer, you will be the cornerstone of our technical team, driving the creation and launch of our iOS application and Google Chrome extension. You will own the development process from concept to market, fix bugs, implement innovative ideas, and ensure a seamless user experience. This role is perfect for a proactive, creative developer who thrives in an early-stage startup environment and is passionate about shaping the future of fintech.
Key Responsibilities
iOS App Development: Lead the full development lifecycle of our iOS application, from concept to design, coding, testing, and launch on the Apple App Store.
Chrome Extension Development: Build, enhance, and maintain our Google Chrome extension, adding new features and ensuring compatibility with browser updates.
Bug Fixing: Identify and resolve bugs in both the iOS app and Chrome extension to ensure reliability and performance.
Innovation Implementation: Collaborate with the founding team to translate new ideas and product enhancements into robust technical solutions.
Product Execution: Drive the technical strategy to bring our fintech product to market, focusing on scalability, performance, and alignment with business objectives.
Code Quality: Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code, following best practices to establish a strong technical foundation.
App Store Management: Manage the submission process for the iOS app, ensuring compliance with Apple’s guidelines and a successful launch.
Collaboration: Work closely with non-technical founders and external stakeholders to align technical solutions with the product vision and user needs.
Required Skills and Qualifications
Experience: 5+ years of professional software development experience, with a proven track record of building and launching iOS apps from concept to App Store release.
iOS Expertise: Strong proficiency in Swift and/or Objective-C, Xcode, and iOS frameworks (e.g., UIKit, Core Data, SwiftUI). Experience with the complete iOS development lifecycle, including debugging and deployment.
Chrome Extension Development: Hands-on experience developing and maintaining Google Chrome extensions using JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and Chrome APIs.
Bug Fixing: Exceptional debugging skills, with experience resolving complex issues in mobile and web-based applications.
Innovation: Ability to implement new features and creative ideas into products, balancing innovation with stability.
Version Control: Proficiency with Git and collaborative workflows (e.g., GitHub).
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical skills to address technical challenges and deliver solutions in a lean startup environment.
Communication: Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to non-technical team members and align on product goals.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in fintech or consumer-facing applications, with an understanding of user-centric design principles.
Familiarity with backend integration (e.g., RESTful APIs, Node.js, or Python) to connect mobile and web applications with server-side systems.
Knowledge of automated testing frameworks for iOS apps and Chrome extensions.
Previous experience as the first or early technical hire in a startup, with a track record of executing products to market.
Familiarity with App Store optimization and Chrome Web Store submission processes.
What We Offer
A pivotal role as our first technical hire, with significant influence over our product and technical direction.
Opportunity to shape a consumer fintech product from its earliest stages.
Equity compensation, offering a stake in the future success of our startup.
Flexible, remote-friendly work environment with a collaborative and passionate team.
Chance to make a meaningful impact in the fintech space and grow with an ambitious early-stage company.
How to Apply
If you’re a skilled developer with a passion for fintech and a desire to build an innovative product from the ground up, we want you on our team!
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Compensation Package:
Profit sharing
Stock options
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Work Location: Remote

title: Python Developer
job_description:
Education
N/A
Location
Remote (Virtual) - US - US (Primary)
Career Level
Experienced (Non-Manager)
Category
Information Technology
Salary Grade

Full-time

Job Description
JOB DESCRIPTION

Position Title: Python Developer
Reports to: IT Project Manager of Enterprise Solutions Line of Business
Subsidiary: Leisnoi Professional Services, LLC
Location: Remote
Job Status: Regular Full -Time

SUMMARY:
The U.S. Census Bureau, Demographic Systems Division (DSD) requires support for Python development services in support of DSD’s migration of survey processing systems from Statistical Analysis System (SAS) to Python.

The Python Developer will assist with the development and documentation of the rewrite of The Survey of Income and Program Participation (SIPP) production processing system into a Python codebase. The scope of the SIPP Production processing consists of 200+ edit programs. Additionally, a revamped SIPP system, named SIPP Seamless, is currently in its planning phase. Therefore, the work outlined is for supporting the ongoing SIPP production system and the SIPP Seamless system.

As DSD migrates its infrastructure into the cloud, a CI/CD tool is required. Therefore, DSD is creating a collaborative space in GitLab for sharing Python code, where the developed code will reside, and pipelines can be established. The GitLab CI/CD will then need configuration and optimization to emulate current automation for the system.

Additionally, DSD is investigating leveraging a database to replace datasets that have thousands of variables. Therefore, converting the current SAS datasets into a normalized database structure is also in scope. The database research will evaluate the feasibility of replacing datasets to determine optimizations and efficiencies. In the event the database replacement is ideal, the Python Developer will be involved in developing the database design for the SIPP Seamless system.

The scope of work for this position is to provide support to the Income Surveys Programming Branch (ISPB) in The Demographic Systems Division (DSD) for the development of a Python-based system for performing demographic survey editing. DSD needs expertise in developing enterprise, Python solutions from a developer that can effectively cross-train existing staff based on their experience in advanced programming, knowledge of data structures, database experience, and version control familiarity. The Python Developer will work with DSD IT Specialists in an integrated team environment when performing services associated with this contract.

The Python Developer will perform knowledge transfers and training to keep current staff abreast of all activities they have performed and to share knowledge of products and techniques. Additionally, all procedural and development work performed requires clear documentation that can be replicated by current and future staff. This includes clearly documenting and verbally communicating through step-by-step procedures, presentations, explanations of Python coding, configuration settings with rationale, shadowing, and other techniques deemed appropriate by current staff and/or management to ensure adequate knowledge transfer. For technical demonstrations, the Python Developer will use a variety of skills and tools such as Python, SQL, PL/pgSQL, and Shell Scripting. For policy and procedural documentation, the contractor will create procedural documentation using software such as MS PowerPoint, MS Visio, MS Word, MS Excel, MS Teams, and MS SharePoint.

Essential Functions, Responsibilities & Duties may include, but are not limited to:

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Assist DSD with the implementation of Python code solutions using efficient methodologies to utilize the language’s strengths.
Assist DSD in analyzing existing SAS-based system to glean functional requirements to develop optimized, Python-based solutions.
Write high quality code that is well-documented and easy to read, use, and maintain.
Use Python to read and reformat large datasets.
Improve Python code performance.
Ideally, have familiarity with SAS code.
Ideally have familiarity with database designs that balance usability with functionality.
Attend branch meetings and share technical knowledge clearly.
Work with customers and subject matter experts to capture and document business needs and processes through meetings and requirements gathering.
Make recommendations concerning the feasibility of revising existing applications or developing new approaches to utilize resources more effectively.
Troubleshoot issues as needed and work with appropriate resources to resolve problems.
Assist DSD with developing proof-in-concepts, pilots, and alternatives analysis.
Provide excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Provide thorough documentation based on Census Bureau and/or DSD standards. Documentation includes but is not limited to formal specifications and/or systems logical diagrams, training, and in-code documentation.
Participate in code and peer reviews, as well as formal walkthroughs as directed.
Conduct formal presentations and provide written documents outlining any issues and concerns to Census Management.
Utilize DSD version control system regularly to ensure all developed code is readily available to Census staff.
Review the existing software systems and make recommendations to improve the design.
Provide weekly and/or daily status reports in requested format to tasks manager or as directed.
The contractor shall work with and train designated Census Bureau IT specialists to ensure that the system is fully understood by those designated individuals responsible for maintaining the system once released to production.
Ideally have knowledge of using GitLab or GitHub to configure pipelines for CI/CD.
Maintain regular communications with team as required.
Other duties as assigned.

ESSENTIAL TECHNOLOGIES AND DELIVERABLES:
The Python Developer will complete tasks using, but not limited to, technologies such as:
Python related packages, tools, and products such as NumPy, Pandas, Anaconda, Jupyter Notebook, and VS code
SAS Software such as Advanced Base SAS, SAS Macro Language, and SAS ODS software
PostgreSQL Databases and related languages, tools, and products such as pgAdmin, and PL/pgSQL
Version control software such as Git, GitLab or GitHub
Linux terminal or other tools to allow for executing from the command line
Microsoft suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, and Teams
The following deliverables are required:
Finalized Python modules and code for performing identified, demographic edits for the SIPP survey
ISPB Python Programming Standards and Guidelines document
Regular status reports
Presentation and training material
Evaluation and recommendation for database implementation
Python code stored a version control software, such as SVN or GitLab

Work Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

Security Clearance: employee must pass the Census Bureau Security Investigation / background investigation.
We seek an individual with data engineering expertise and experience with:
Using Python to read and reformat large data files.
Improving code performance: able to profile and refactor code and find bottlenecks and overheads, preferably on production code.
Writing high quality code: well-documented and easy to read, use, maintain, and extend.
Linux: able to perform basic commands as an end user.
Data validation in a statistical processing environment.
Cloud computing, preferably with Amazon Web Service, is a plus.
Statistical Analysis System (SAS) programming experience is a plus.
MINIMUN QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS:
Security Clearance: employee must pass the Census Bureau Security Investigation / background investigation.
We seek an individual with data engineering expertise and experience with:
Using Python to read and reformat large data files.
Improving code performance: able to profile and refactor code and find bottlenecks and overheads, preferably on production code.
Writing high quality code: well-documented and easy to read, use, maintain, and extend.
Linux: able to perform basic commands as an end user.
Data validation in a statistical processing environment.
Cloud computing, preferably with Amazon Web Service, is a plus.
Statistical Analysis System (SAS) programming experience is a plus.
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS:
It is preferred to have 5 to 7 years + of related experience with backend and front-end development, relational database and developing applications or equivalent combination of experience.
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field is preferred.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
Position consists of sitting for long periods of time, using hands/ fingers, handling, reaching with hands and arms, speaking or translating. Periods of walking, standing, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, and lifting equipment weighing up to 30 pounds. Moderate to extended periods of office work with heavy periods of computer usage. May be assigned occasional to moderate periods of analytical tasks requiring extensive reasoning abilities. It is Leisnoi’s business philosophy and practice to provide reasonable accommodations, according to applicable state and federal laws, to all qualified individuals with physical or mental disabilities.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

Work is 100% remote; however, the company reserves the right to require onsite work.

Candidates can email their resumes to HR@Leisnoi.com and must also apply online at Leisnoi.com.
Leisnoi is an Equal Opportunity Employer

About the role

Booming Games is looking for a skilled and motivated PostgreSQL Developer to join our Data Lakehouse team. You'll work on a high-throughput, rapidly growing platform that powers analytics, operations, and product development across the company. This is a hands-on engineering role that blends structured data modeling with creative problem solving and a strong sense of ownership.

We don’t just maintain a database—we build a scalable, version-controlled, and fully automated platform that supports over 25TB of new data annually. If you enjoy working on clean architecture, well-structured code, and contributing to real product decisions, this is the place for you.

Stay current with industry best practices and emerging technologies.

Strong proficiency in Python (3.x).
Experience with frameworks such as Django, Flask, or FastAPI.
Knowledge of RESTful APIs and microservices architecture.
Familiarity with relational and non-relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB).
Experience with version control systems (Git).
Understanding of containerization (Docker) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

Experience with CI/CD pipelines.
Familiarity with message brokers (RabbitMQ, Kafka).
Knowledge of testing frameworks (PyTest, unittest).
Exposure to data processing, ETL, or ML pipelines is a plus.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

od's platform.Collaboration with Engineering & AI Teams: Support cross-functional teams by developing features and addressing bugs that enhance the user experience for AI engineers and researchers.Testing & Code Quality: Write clean, maintainable code with an emphasis on performance and scalability, following best practices for testing and continuous integration.Learning & Development: Participate in code reviews, mentorship opportunities, and continuous learning to deepen your expertise in full-stack development.

title: PowerBI Developer (Remote Position)
job_description:

title: Junior Software Engineer
job_description:
Overview:
Corporate Tools is hiring a Junior Software Engineer for $75,000/year. You will be a traditional company employee. This is a full time 40 hour/week position with company benefits in Spokane, Washington.
Corporate Tools is always hiring great Software Engineers. We primarily code in Ruby, Javascript and use Rails and Vue. We classify this position as an entry level position within our Software Department.
Our Junior Software Developer job is a path towards becoming an integral part of our software team. This position is geared towards developers with limited experience or a recent college graduate. Through working with our team of developers, this position will put you on the path towards gaining more skills and experience to help you advance within our company.
Junior Software Engineer Jobs:
Our Junior Software Engineers spend their first year integrating and hopefully advance to becoming Software Engineers within our company. We offer a guaranteed 6 month assessment with an opportunity for a wage increase based on your proficiency in some key skills. We’ll work with you and bring you along to become a vital part of our group. This is our entry level software developer position and a great way to get started with our company. We’re looking for great people who want to do great work. We understand you might suck at writing resumes or pitching yourself, or most your code might be private. Try your best to explain to us what you can do so we can hopefully find you! If you’re a good person, like learning and improving, and want to grow your skills, we want to find you.
How to Apply:
Please apply through the link below. It’s a coding job, so showing us some code would be helpful. Preferably a flavor of Ruby or Javascript, but anything for now will do.

Wage:
$75,000 a year
Benefits:
100% employer-paid medical, dental and vision for employees
Annual review with raise option
22 days Paid Time Off accrued annually, and 4 holidays
After 3 years, PTO increases to 29 days. Employees transition to flexible time off after 5 years with the company—not accrued, not capped, take time off when you want
The 4 holidays are: New Year’s Day, Fourth of July, Thanksgiving, and Christmas Day
Paid Maternity and Paternity Leave
Up to 5% company matching 401(k) with no vesting period
Quarterly allowance
Use to make your remote work set up more comfortable, for continuing education classes, a plant for your desk, coffee for your coworker, a massage for yourself... really, whatever
Open concept office with friendly coworkers
Creative environment where you can make a difference
No dumb benefits like free dog walking on the weekends that snobby hipster places have to make you feel cool, but mathematically won't cost the company much money because you won't use it
Trail Mix Bar
- oh yeah
Responsibilities:
Develop Software
Have a Growth Mindset, not a Fixed Mindset
Learn how to become proficient in Ruby, Rails, and Vue
Requirements:
BS in Computer Science or at least 2 years of related experience
At least 1 year of relevant professional experience
Experience with current software development languages such as Ruby, Python, Java, or Rust, etc.
Experience with front-end web development languages such as HTML, CSS and Javascript
Experience with current web application frameworks such as Django, Laravel, or Ruby on Rails (preferred but not required)
You’re easy-going and willing to learn on the job while also getting stuff done
Able to work in an agile environment with a focus on continuous integration
Junior Software Engineer
Spokane, WA

title: Full-Stack Developer – Azure & Desktop Applications
job_description:

At Integrity Solutions® Ltd. (ISltd®): We are analysts. We are problem solvers. We are pipeline experts.
We are a devoted group of uniquely qualified and knowledgeable professionals who deliver specialized integrity management services and software solutions to the U.S. oil and gas pipeline industry. Our customers rely on us to guide them through the complicated, and always changing, integrity management process from the initial jurisdictional reviews to ongoing risk analysis and management.
Summary:
Integrity Solutions is seeking a motivated and skilled full-stack developer to join our team full-time. This remote position offers flexible hours and the opportunity to work on high-impact, mission-driven projects supporting critical infrastructure operations and integrity management in the oil and gas industry.

Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently or as part of a distributed team
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with Blazor and DevExpress Blazor components
Understanding of application security best practices, including user authentication, access control, and secure data handling
Experience integrating GIS/Map systems
Perks & Benefits
100% remote work
Flexible work hours
Ongoing training and development opportunities
Meaningful, mission-driven projects supporting the energy and infrastructure sectors

Benefits:
Flexible schedule
Professional development assistance

Bonus opportunities

Monday to Friday

title: Senior Software Developer
job_description:
About Us
We are working with a consumer fintech startup that has a bold vision to transform how people manage their financial lives. Their mission is to create innovative, user-centric digital solutions that empower consumers to achieve their financial goals. As they prepare to launch their first product, they are seeking their first Senior Software Developer to lead the technical development of their vision and help build something truly impactful.
Position Overview
As the Senior Software Developer, you will be the cornerstone of our technical team, driving the creation and launch of our iOS application and Google Chrome extension. You will own the development process from concept to market, fix bugs, implement innovative ideas, and ensure a seamless user experience. This role is perfect for a proactive, creative developer who thrives in an early-stage startup environment and is passionate about shaping the future of fintech.
Key Responsibilities
iOS App Development: Lead the full development lifecycle of our iOS application, from concept to design, coding, testing, and launch on the Apple App Store.
Chrome Extension Development: Build, enhance, and maintain our Google Chrome extension, adding new features and ensuring compatibility with browser updates.
Bug Fixing: Identify and resolve bugs in both the iOS app and Chrome extension to ensure reliability and performance.
Innovation Implementation: Collaborate with the founding team to translate new ideas and product enhancements into robust technical solutions.
Product Execution: Drive the technical strategy to bring our fintech product to market, focusing on scalability, performance, and alignment with business objectives.
Code Quality: Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code, following best practices to establish a strong technical foundation.
App Store Management: Manage the submission process for the iOS app, ensuring compliance with Apple’s guidelines and a successful launch.
Collaboration: Work closely with non-technical founders and external stakeholders to align technical solutions with the product vision and user needs.
Required Skills and Qualifications
Experience: 5+ years of professional software development experience, with a proven track record of building and launching iOS apps from concept to App Store release.
iOS Expertise: Strong proficiency in Swift and/or Objective-C, Xcode, and iOS frameworks (e.g., UIKit, Core Data, SwiftUI). Experience with the complete iOS development lifecycle, including debugging and deployment.
Chrome Extension Development: Hands-on experience developing and maintaining Google Chrome extensions using JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and Chrome APIs.
Bug Fixing: Exceptional debugging skills, with experience resolving complex issues in mobile and web-based applications.
Innovation: Ability to implement new features and creative ideas into products, balancing innovation with stability.
Version Control: Proficiency with Git and collaborative workflows (e.g., GitHub).
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical skills to address technical challenges and deliver solutions in a lean startup environment.
Communication: Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to non-technical team members and align on product goals.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in fintech or consumer-facing applications, with an understanding of user-centric design principles.
Familiarity with backend integration (e.g., RESTful APIs, Node.js, or Python) to connect mobile and web applications with server-side systems.
Knowledge of automated testing frameworks for iOS apps and Chrome extensions.
Previous experience as the first or early technical hire in a startup, with a track record of executing products to market.
Familiarity with App Store optimization and Chrome Web Store submission processes.
What We Offer
A pivotal role as our first technical hire, with significant influence over our product and technical direction.
Opportunity to shape a consumer fintech product from its earliest stages.
Equity compensation, offering a stake in the future success of our startup.
Flexible, remote-friendly work environment with a collaborative and passionate team.
Chance to make a meaningful impact in the fintech space and grow with an ambitious early-stage company.
How to Apply
If you’re a skilled developer with a passion for fintech and a desire to build an innovative product from the ground up, we want you on our team!
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Compensation Package:
Profit sharing
Stock options
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Work Location: Remote

title: Space Force MUOS Web Developer and Data Analytics Engineer- Django Framework
job_description:
Basic Qualifications :
Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, or a related Science, Engineering or Mathematics field. Also requires 5+ years of job-related experience, or a Master's degree plus 3 years of job-related experience. Agile experience preferred.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is preferred at time of hire. Candidates must be able to obtain a Secret clearance within a reasonable amount of time from date of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.
Responsibilities for this Position:
ROLE AND POSITION OBJECTIVES:
The Space Force MUOS program is currently seeking a Web Software Developer and Data Analytics Engineer in our Scottsdale, AZ, location.
The Web Software Developer we seek will work with a small team to design, build, test, deploy and support enterprise web applications to modernize the management and integration of data and design information developed for our customers. The web applications will allow the product development team to store project data in a relational database, where the data not only provides the customer with complex re-build, upgrade, and sustainment information, but the data is also available for data mining in support of maintaining licensed software installs, license allocation, and system configurations.

In this role you’ll be a Subject Matter Expert (SME) designing. developing, integrating, testing, and maintaining web applications built on the Django Python Framework using a Microsoft SQL Server database for data storage.
Key skills and technologies include:
Web Developer with MS SQL Experience
The Django Python Framework
GitLab and Git for version control
Experience with HTML 5, HTMX, JavaScript, and CSS

Able to develop and provide innovative and creative solutions to a variety of difficult problems of considerable scope and complexity, using established precedent and policies
Display initiative on assignments, exercise independent judgment and professionally execute projects with little direction.
A seasoned, experienced professional having a wide range of professional experience and possessing a very strong understanding of software engineering concepts, principles, and theories and an expert at applying technical standards and methodologies to resolve a wide range of issues in creative ways.
Capable of working on complex problems of diverse scope or situations or data that requires in-depth evaluation of variable factors.
Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results.

What sets you apart:
Creative thinking with the ability to multi-task
Commitment to ongoing professional development
Team player who thrives in collaborative environments and revels in team success
Can provide specific, detailed information for software and technology selection, implementation techniques, and tools for the most efficient solution to meet business needs, including present and future capacity requirements.
Designing and developing with Information Security in mind
System administration for Hosting and Deployment within an enterprise environment with Active Directory authentication.
Capable of performing technical analysis in web application planning, engineering, and design
Proactively provides analysis for implementation techniques and tools for the most efficient solutions to web application problems.
Team player
Python proficiency
Database administration and best practices
HTML 5 and CSS
Problem solving and debugging
Restful API Development

Our Commitment to You:
An exciting career path with opportunities for continuous learning and development.
Research oriented work, alongside award winning teams developing practical solutions for our nation’s security
Flexible schedules with every other Friday off work, if desired (9/80 schedule)
Competitive benefits, including 401k matching, flex time off, paid parental leave, healthcare benefits, health & wellness programs, employee resource and social groups, and more
See more at com/careers/why-work-for-us/benefits

Workplace Options:
This position is fully on-site, OR Hybrid/Flex as permitted by the program.
While on-site, you will be a part of the Scottsdale, AZ location

Salary Note: This estimate represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors (geographic location, etc.). Actual pay may vary. This job posting will remain open until the position is filled. Combined Salary Range: USD $115,674.00 - USD $128,325.00 /Yr. Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 12,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high-performance team!

Equal Opportunity Employer / Individuals with Disabilities / Protected Veterans

title: Junior Software Engineer
job_description:
Remote
Full Time
Entry Level

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Junior Software Engineer to join our engineering team. In this role, you will be responsible for contributing to the design, development, deployment, and maintenance of scalable full-stack applications across our products and platforms. You will work closely with fellow engineers, designers, product managers, and stakeholders to implement reliable, performant, and user-centric software solutions.

What You'll Be Responsible For:
Design, develop, and maintain full-stack web applications using ReactJS, Node.js, and modern JavaScript frameworks/libraries
Build and integrate RESTful APIs, backend services, and data layers using Python, Node.js, and SQL/NoSQL databases
Participate in the development and refinement of scalable microservices architectures
Collaborate with frontend and backend engineers to implement robust and reusable UI components
Develop automated unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to ensure high-quality software delivery
Deploy and monitor applications on cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure
Contribute to CI/CD pipelines for automated build, test, and deployment workflows
Participate in code reviews and follow software development best practices
Monitor application performance and address issues such as latency, scalability, and reliability
Document architecture, processes, and operational runbooks for new and existing systems
Stay up to date with emerging trends in full-stack development, DevOps, and cloud-native technologies

What You'll Bring to the Position:
1+ years of experience in a software engineering or full-stack development role (internship or academic experience accepted)
Proficiency in Python and JavaScript/TypeScript
Experience with frontend frameworks such as ReactJS or Next.js
Familiarity with backend technologies like Node.js, Express.js, and SQL/NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
Understanding of cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP, and ability to deploy applications using services like EC2, S3, Lambda, or Azure App Services
Experience with version control tools such as Git and collaborative workflows (GitHub, GitLab)
Strong understanding of web protocols (HTTP, WebSocket), API design, and authentication (JWT, OAuth)

Preferred Skills and Experience:
Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes)
Experience with infrastructure-as-code tools (Terraform, CloudFormation)
Exposure to CI/CD tools such as GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or Azure DevOps
Familiarity with GraphQL, Redux, or WebSockets for real-time applications
Experience working in Agile development environments
Awareness of accessibility and responsive design best practices
Understanding of security best practices for frontend and backend systems

title: Python Developer
job_description:

N/A

Remote (Virtual) - US - US (Primary)

Information Technology

Job Description
JOB DESCRIPTION

Position Title: Python Developer
Reports to: IT Project Manager of Enterprise Solutions Line of Business
Subsidiary: Leisnoi Professional Services, LLC
Location: Remote
Job Status: Regular Full -Time

SUMMARY:
The U.S. Census Bureau, Demographic Systems Division (DSD) requires support for Python development services in support of DSD’s migration of survey processing systems from Statistical Analysis System (SAS) to Python.

The Python Developer will assist with the development and documentation of the rewrite of The Survey of Income and Program Participation (SIPP) production processing system into a Python codebase. The scope of the SIPP Production processing consists of 200+ edit programs. Additionally, a revamped SIPP system, named SIPP Seamless, is currently in its planning phase. Therefore, the work outlined is for supporting the ongoing SIPP production system and the SIPP Seamless system.

As DSD migrates its infrastructure into the cloud, a CI/CD tool is required. Therefore, DSD is creating a collaborative space in GitLab for sharing Python code, where the developed code will reside, and pipelines can be established. The GitLab CI/CD will then need configuration and optimization to emulate current automation for the system.

Additionally, DSD is investigating leveraging a database to replace datasets that have thousands of variables. Therefore, converting the current SAS datasets into a normalized database structure is also in scope. The database research will evaluate the feasibility of replacing datasets to determine optimizations and efficiencies. In the event the database replacement is ideal, the Python Developer will be involved in developing the database design for the SIPP Seamless system.

The scope of work for this position is to provide support to the Income Surveys Programming Branch (ISPB) in The Demographic Systems Division (DSD) for the development of a Python-based system for performing demographic survey editing. DSD needs expertise in developing enterprise, Python solutions from a developer that can effectively cross-train existing staff based on their experience in advanced programming, knowledge of data structures, database experience, and version control familiarity. The Python Developer will work with DSD IT Specialists in an integrated team environment when performing services associated with this contract.

The Python Developer will perform knowledge transfers and training to keep current staff abreast of all activities they have performed and to share knowledge of products and techniques. Additionally, all procedural and development work performed requires clear documentation that can be replicated by current and future staff. This includes clearly documenting and verbally communicating through step-by-step procedures, presentations, explanations of Python coding, configuration settings with rationale, shadowing, and other techniques deemed appropriate by current staff and/or management to ensure adequate knowledge transfer. For technical demonstrations, the Python Developer will use a variety of skills and tools such as Python, SQL, PL/pgSQL, and Shell Scripting. For policy and procedural documentation, the contractor will create procedural documentation using software such as MS PowerPoint, MS Visio, MS Word, MS Excel, MS Teams, and MS SharePoint.

Essential Functions, Responsibilities & Duties may include, but are not limited to:

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Assist DSD with the implementation of Python code solutions using efficient methodologies to utilize the language’s strengths.
Assist DSD in analyzing existing SAS-based system to glean functional requirements to develop optimized, Python-based solutions.
Write high quality code that is well-documented and easy to read, use, and maintain.
Use Python to read and reformat large datasets.
Improve Python code performance.
Ideally, have familiarity with SAS code.
Ideally have familiarity with database designs that balance usability with functionality.
Attend branch meetings and share technical knowledge clearly.
Work with customers and subject matter experts to capture and document business needs and processes through meetings and requirements gathering.
Make recommendations concerning the feasibility of revising existing applications or developing new approaches to utilize resources more effectively.
Troubleshoot issues as needed and work with appropriate resources to resolve problems.
Assist DSD with developing proof-in-concepts, pilots, and alternatives analysis.
Provide excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Provide thorough documentation based on Census Bureau and/or DSD standards. Documentation includes but is not limited to formal specifications and/or systems logical diagrams, training, and in-code documentation.
Participate in code and peer reviews, as well as formal walkthroughs as directed.
Conduct formal presentations and provide written documents outlining any issues and concerns to Census Management.
Utilize DSD version control system regularly to ensure all developed code is readily available to Census staff.
Review the existing software systems and make recommendations to improve the design.
Provide weekly and/or daily status reports in requested format to tasks manager or as directed.
The contractor shall work with and train designated Census Bureau IT specialists to ensure that the system is fully understood by those designated individuals responsible for maintaining the system once released to production.
Ideally have knowledge of using GitLab or GitHub to configure pipelines for CI/CD.
Maintain regular communications with team as required.
Other duties as assigned.

ESSENTIAL TECHNOLOGIES AND DELIVERABLES:
The Python Developer will complete tasks using, but not limited to, technologies such as:
Python related packages, tools, and products such as NumPy, Pandas, Anaconda, Jupyter Notebook, and VS code
SAS Software such as Advanced Base SAS, SAS Macro Language, and SAS ODS software
PostgreSQL Databases and related languages, tools, and products such as pgAdmin, and PL/pgSQL
Version control software such as Git, GitLab or GitHub
Linux terminal or other tools to allow for executing from the command line
Microsoft suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, and Teams
The following deliverables are required:
Finalized Python modules and code for performing identified, demographic edits for the SIPP survey
ISPB Python Programming Standards and Guidelines document
Regular status reports
Presentation and training material
Evaluation and recommendation for database implementation
Python code stored a version control software, such as SVN or GitLab

Work Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

Security Clearance: employee must pass the Census Bureau Security Investigation / background investigation.
We seek an individual with data engineering expertise and experience with:
Using Python to read and reformat large data files.
Improving code performance: able to profile and refactor code and find bottlenecks and overheads, preferably on production code.
Writing high quality code: well-documented and easy to read, use, maintain, and extend.
Linux: able to perform basic commands as an end user.
Data validation in a statistical processing environment.
Cloud computing, preferably with Amazon Web Service, is a plus.
Statistical Analysis System (SAS) programming experience is a plus.
MINIMUN QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS:
Security Clearance: employee must pass the Census Bureau Security Investigation / background investigation.
We seek an individual with data engineering expertise and experience with:
Using Python to read and reformat large data files.
Improving code performance: able to profile and refactor code and find bottlenecks and overheads, preferably on production code.
Writing high quality code: well-documented and easy to read, use, maintain, and extend.
Linux: able to perform basic commands as an end user.
Data validation in a statistical processing environment.
Cloud computing, preferably with Amazon Web Service, is a plus.
Statistical Analysis System (SAS) programming experience is a plus.
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS:
It is preferred to have 5 to 7 years + of related experience with backend and front-end development, relational database and developing applications or equivalent combination of experience.
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field is preferred.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
Position consists of sitting for long periods of time, using hands/ fingers, handling, reaching with hands and arms, speaking or translating. Periods of walking, standing, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, and lifting equipment weighing up to 30 pounds. Moderate to extended periods of office work with heavy periods of computer usage. May be assigned occasional to moderate periods of analytical tasks requiring extensive reasoning abilities. It is Leisnoi’s business philosophy and practice to provide reasonable accommodations, according to applicable state and federal laws, to all qualified individuals with physical or mental disabilities.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

Work is 100% remote; however, the company reserves the right to require onsite work.

Candidates can email their resumes to HR@Leisnoi.com and must also apply online at Leisnoi.com.
Leisnoi is an Equal Opportunity Employer
Leisnoi considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, religion, age, physical or mental disability, family responsibility, marital status, sexual orientation, political affiliation, veteran's status or any other legal protected status. title: Full-Stack Developer
job_description:
Position Summary
ABRAZO Technologies is seeking a highly skilled and dependable Full-Stack Developer for a 12-month contract to support and enhance a containerized web application built using React, Django, and PostgreSQL. This role involves maintaining and improving a live, production-level system serving government and education sector clients.
The ideal candidate demonstrates strong initiative, excellent communication skills, and a problem-solving mindset. You will play a key role in fixing bugs, expanding functionality, and providing ongoing technical support while collaborating closely with stakeholders and IT staff.
System Architecture Overview
The application is deployed on a Linux virtual machine and uses a Docker Compose stack. Core components include:
Nginx on the host VM for HTTPS and reverse proxy
Frontend Container: React application served by internal Nginx
Backend Container: Django/Gunicorn stack served by internal Nginx
Database Container: PostgreSQL
Docker and Docker Compose are used to manage all services, volumes, and networking.
Key Responsibilities
Troubleshoot and resolve bugs in both frontend and backend components
Implement new features and enhancements in collaboration with the project team
Maintain Docker configurations and support CI/CD practices as needed
Ensure security, stability, and scalability of the system
Provide consistent, ongoing support with timely communication and updates
Maintain accurate documentation of development changes and infrastructure updates
Required Qualifications
Proficiency in React (JavaScript, HTML, CSS)
Strong experience with Django, Python, REST APIs
Working knowledge of PostgreSQL (queries, migrations, indexing)
Hands-on experience with Docker & Docker Compose
Familiarity with Nginx (reverse proxy and internal container usage)
Proficient with Git, GitHub, and collaborative development workflows
Excellent written and verbal communication
Demonstrated reliability, self-motivation, and ability to manage priorities independently
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with Linux server administration (Ubuntu preferred)
Comfort working with production environments and legacy codebases
Familiarity with DevOps practices such as SSL management, uptime monitoring, and log handling
Background in educational or government web application projects
Work Environment & Expectations
Professional and collaborative team culture
Clear expectations and open communication channels
Flexible work hours with a focus on accountability and timely deliverables
Regular check-ins and milestone tracking to ensure progress and alignment
Application Instructions
Interested candidates should submit the following:
Resume
GitHub profile and/or relevant code samples
Brief summary of your experience with Docker-based full-stack deployments
Availability and preferred working schedule
Job Type: Contract
Compensation Package:
1099 contract
Work Location: Remote

title: Front End Developer - AI Trainer
job_description:
We are looking for proficient programmers to join our team to train our AI chatbots to code. You will work with the chatbots that we are building in order to measure their progress, as well as write and evaluate code.
To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language/framework (JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, C, C#, C++, HTML/CSS, React, Go, Java, Kotlin, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.
As part of the application process, you will be asked to complete an assessment. If you pass, you will gain access to projects. Based on the quality of your work, you will continue to receive projects regularly. We find our most successful candidates work between 5-20 hours per week, up to 40 hours.

This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
You can work on your own schedule
Projects are paid hourly, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work
Responsibilities:
Come up with diverse problems and solutions for a coding chatbot
Write high-quality answers and code snippets
Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance
Qualifications:
Fluency in English
Proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript
Detail-oriented
Excellent writing and grammar skills
A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)

title: Senior AI Engineer
job_description:
About the Role:
We are a fast-moving startup seeking a highly skilled Senior Software / AI Engineer to lead the design, development, and deployment of scalable software systems with integrated artificial intelligence components. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to architect intelligent solutions using large language models (LLMs), vector databases, speech-to-text technologies, and real-time AI applications with modern backend and frontend frameworks.
Key Responsibilities:
Design and implement production-grade AI pipelines, including LLM integration and vector-based retrieval (e.g., RAG systems).
Develop scalable APIs using Python-based frameworks such as FastAPI or Flask.
Lead development efforts in building front-end applications using React and TypeScript.
Optimize and manage speech-to-text tools (e.g., Whisper, Deepgram) and integrate them into the core software stack.
Collaborate with product and design teams to ship intuitive, user-friendly interfaces.
Ensure compliance with all relevant data protection laws in handling customer data and model outputs.
Conduct code reviews, mentor junior engineers, and contribute to internal engineering best practices.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).
5+ years of experience in full-stack software development.
Proven experience deploying AI/ML models or building LLM-powered tools.
Proficiency with Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, and modern development tools.
Experience working with APIs, microservices, and cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
Familiarity with vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, Weaviate, FAISS) and embedding models.

Experience in privacy-first environments, handling sensitive data securely.

title: AI Engineer
job_description:
We are seeking a highly skilled AI Engineer with hands-on experience in AgnoAI, multi-agent orchestration, and LLM-based automation. You will be responsible for designing, building, and deploying intelligent agents that work collaboratively to solve complex business problems across data, analytics, and operational workflows. Design, build, and deploy custom agents using AgnoAI for automation, observability, and decision-making tasks
Develop and maintain multi-agent systems using the AgnoAI Control Plane and MCP (Multi-Agent Control Plane)
Implement agent-to-agent communication using planner-based orchestration, dynamic chaining, and memory sharing
Integrate agents with tools like Snowflake, DBT, Airflow, LangGraph, Redis, and APIs
Leverage LLMs to enhance agent reasoning, summarization, task delegation, and knowledge grounding
Work closely with product, data, and platform teams to operationalize agent workflows
Optimize performance, memory sharing, and autonomy in distributed agent environments
Write robust, scalable Python code with modular architecture for easy agent reuse

3+ years of experience in Python software development

Solid understanding of LLMs, prompt engineering, tool usage, and memory design
Experience building agents that interact with external systems (APIs, databases, file systems)
Familiarity with AI observability concepts (volume, freshness, drift, anomaly detection)
Knowledge of workflow design, chaining, or control plane patterns
Nice To Have
Experience with vector databases (e.g., pgVector, Weaviate, Pinecone, Qdrant)
Background in MLOps, DevOps, or cloud-native architecture
Experience using AgnoAI with multi-agent coordination, planner roles, or reasoning loops
Familiarity with Redis/Kafka for agent messaging
Exposure to data observability and quality tools
Tools & Stack You Might Use
AgnoAI, LangGraph, OpenAI API
Snowflake, DBT, Airflow
Python (FastAPI, AsyncIO)

Docker, GitHub Actions, VectorDBs
