title: Principal Architect, Technology
job_description:
About Kinaxis:
About Kinaxis
Elevate your career journey by embracing a new challenge with Kinaxis. We are experts in tech, but it’s really our people who give us passion to always seek ways to do things better. As such, we’re serious about your career growth and professional development, because People matter at Kinaxis.

In 1984, we started out as a team of three engineers based in Ottawa, Canada. Today, we have grown to become a global organization with over 2000 employees around the world, and support 40,000+ users in over 100 countries. As a global leader in end-to-end supply chain management, we enable supply chain excellence for all industries. We are expanding our team in Mexico and around the world as we continue to innovate and revolutionize how we support our customers.

Our Professional Services and Product Management teams, initially formed in 2013, are based in Guadalajara, Mexico. Just over a decade later, our vision of growth in this region has allowed us to expand our teams by hiring and developing new graduates and other professionals.
About the team:
Location
This is a remote position. You can work from home and be located anywhere in Canada or the USA

About the role
As a senior and key member of the Solution Assurance Team, the Principal Architect, Technology will lead the review of technology solutions designs and drive the specific stages of data integration throughout the deployment of Kinaxis solutions. Through their understanding Kinaxis customers’ most pressing business and supply chain challenges, the incumbent will offer expert guidance ensuring seamless system integration and immediate value realization in complex supply chain environments. The role will work on Partner led Maestro deployment engagements and guide partners and customers on best practices throughout the lifecycle of the deployment.
About the role:
What you will do
Evaluate the overall data integration roadmap for deployments and provide expert guidance on creative technology solution, aligning with customer business needs and best practices.
Provide technical expertise in highly complex system integrations, including validation, testing of the solution and optimization of data flows.
Support customers and partners in identifying and implementing solutions tailored to
individual data flows, leveraging deep proficiency in Kinaxis Integration Platform Suite, Maestro data model, and REST based API Integration capabilities.
Identify risks to system integrations and provide inputs on developing mitigation plans for deployments.
Provide technical expertise and recommendations during critical deployment escalations to resolve complex data integration or conversion challenges.
Drive adoption of integration best practice on deployments to ensure robust and scalable solutions.
Manage multiple engagements simultaneously, fostering strong collaboration with partners and customers
What we are looking for
Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain, Operations Research, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Statistics, Information Technology or a related field.
7 – 10 years’ experience in business software consulting or software deployment, preferably in supply chain.
5+ years as an Integration expert for enterprise level supply chain transformation projects, deploying Kinaxis Maestro solutions and applications.
Proven leadership, interpersonal and coaching/mentoring capabilities within a dedicated work team.
Proficiency with the software deployment life cycle; including business requirements definition, review of functional specifications, development of test plans, testing, user training, and deployment.
Excellent communication, presentation, facilitation, time management, and customer relationship skills.
Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills.

Role Specific Skills and experience
Experience deploying Kinaxis Maestro solution and applications.
Expert level understanding of the Maestro data model and Integration methods.
Substantial experience and understanding with ETL tools such as Talend, Informatic, SAP CPI/Data Services, OWB, MuleSoft, etc.
Database level understanding extracting data from enterprise class ERP systems including SAP/APO, Oracle, and JDE.
Experience with connection functionality to SAP (through BAPI / RFC), databases, files, web, SOAP.
Experience working with relational databases and JavaScript.
Experience working with Web Services / REST APIs.
Ability to travel up to 50% and work effectively remotely from client sites

Why join Kinaxis?:
Work With Impact: Our platform directly helps companies power the world’s supply chains. We see the results of what we do out in the world every day—when we see store shelves stocked, when medications are available for our loved ones, and so much more.

Work with Fortune 500 Brands: Companies across industries trust us to help them take control of their integrated business planning and digital supply chain. Some of our customers include Ford, Unilever, Yamaha, P&G, Lockheed-Martin, and more.

Social Responsibility at Kinaxis: Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Committee weighs in on hiring practices, talent assessment training materials, and mandatory training on unconscious bias and inclusion fundamentals. Sustainability is key to what we do and we’re committed to net-zero operations strategy for the long term. We are involved in our communities and support causes where we can make the most impact.
People matter at Kinaxis and these are some of the perks and benefits we created for our team:

Flexible vacation and Kinaxis Days (company-wide day off on the last Friday of every month)
Flexible work options
Physical and mental well-being programs
Regularly scheduled virtual fitness classes
Mentorship programs and training and career development
Recognition programs and referral rewards
Hackathons

For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com.

Kinaxis welcomes candidates to apply to our inclusive community. We provide accommodations upon request to ensure fairness and accessibility throughout our recruitment process for all candidates, including those with specific needs or disabilities. If you require an accommodation, please reach out to us at recruitmentprograms@kinaxis.com. Please note that this contact information is strictly for accessibility requests and cannot be used to inquire about application statuses.
Kinaxis is committed to ensuring a fair and transparent recruitment process. We use artificial intelligence (AI) tools in the initial step of the recruitment process to compare submitted resumes against the job description, to identify candidates whose education, experience and skills most closely match the requirements of the role. After the initial screening, all subsequent decisions regarding your application, including final selection, are made by our human recruitment team. AI does not make any final hiring decisions.

title: Solutions Engineer
job_description:
The Solutions Engineer (SE) at Torchlight is a senior technical consultant and a key member of the Solution Team Organization (STO). The SE partners with the Account Team Organization (ATO) to solve complex customer business problems that require custom solutions, deep technical validation, and advanced use of our flagship product, Catalyst. This role is responsible for architecting and demonstrating tailored solutions that leverage Catalyst's API services and platform capabilities, reducing technical uncertainty for prospects and enabling the sales team to close complex, high-value deals.
DOD Secret Clearance required (can hold up to TS/SCI)
Role is 100% telecommute
Responsibilities
The Solutions Engineer will be engaged throughout the customer opportunity lifecycle, with a primary focus on pre-sales activities where custom solutioning and deep technical validation are crucial. Key responsibilities include:
● Pre-Sales Solutioning & Technical Enablement:
○ Acquire and maintain deep technical knowledge of Catalyst's architecture, features, and API services to serve as a subject matter expert.
○ Lead technical discovery sessions and requirements gathering workshops with prospective
customers to uncover and understand their challenges, technical environments, and
desired outcomes.
○ Design, develop, and present engaging custom demonstrations and Proofs-of-Concept
(POCs) that highlight the value and feasibility of Catalyst solutions customized to meet
specific customer needs.
○ Architect and document technical solutions, outlining data flows, integrations, and
customizations to provide technical validation and contribute to proposals and Statements
of Work (SOWs).
○ Articulate complex technical concepts and solution designs to both technical and business
stakeholders, using whiteboarding and visual communication to build confidence and
consensus.
● Post-Sales Implementation & Adoption Support:
○ Provide expert technical guidance and support to customers and internal delivery teams
during the initial implementation and onboarding phases of custom solutions.
○ Develop and deploy custom scripts, integrations, or reports as defined in the SOW to
ensure successful delivery of the agreed-upon solution.
○ Create technical documentation and conduct knowledge transfer sessions to empower
customers and internal teams to operate and maintain the implemented solutions
effectively.
● Internal Collaboration & Improvement:
○ Collaborate closely with the Product and Engineering teams, channeling customer
feedback and insights to influence the product roadmap and drive continuous
improvement.
○ Partner with the Sales team to provide technical feasibility checks, solution design, and
strategic guidance throughout the sales cycle.
○ Develop reusable solution assets, code snippets, and best-practice guides to improve the
efficiency and effectiveness of the solutions engineering process.
Qualifications
● Applied Technical Expertise: Proven ability to design and implement custom analytical
solutions using APIs and scripting languages (e.g., Python, JavaScript, C++, Java, C#, Go, Rust, etc.).
● Solution Architecture: Strong experience in solution design, including familiarity with cloud platforms (GCP preferred), integration patterns (REST APIs, webhooks), and database concepts.
● Technical Consulting & Discovery: Skill in leading consultative discussions, uncovering complex business problems, and translating them into technical requirements for custom solutions.
● Excellent Communication and Presentation Skills: Capability to clearly and compellingly
present technical solutions and product demonstrations to diverse audiences, establishing
credibility and trust.
● Problem-Solving & Analytical Thinking: Strong ability to diagnose customer challenges, think analytically, and design effective, creative solutions using the Catalyst platform.
● Collaborative Team Player: Proven ability to work effectively in a team environment,
particularly with Sales, Product, and Engineering teams, to drive successful outcomes.
● Proactive Learner: Self-driven. Stays updated on new product features, API updates, and
relevant industry technologies, tools, techniques, and procedures that drive innovation and
increase impact.
Qualifications Desired
● Industry Domain Knowledge: Experience in the defense, intelligence, law enforcement, or
logistics sectors, along with familiarity with the specific challenges, trends, and use cases for data and analytics in each industry.
● Experience with SaaS Solutions: Previous experience with the advanced technical integration and customization of Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) products.
● Proposal and SOW Contribution: Experience contributing technical details to proposals and Statements of Work, clearly documenting the solution, deliverables, and scope.
About Torchlight
Torchlight Analytics LLC provides Behavior Based InsightsTM to decision-makers in government and corporate organizations to uncover emerging threats and new opportunities. Torchlight is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other protected class. U.S. Citizenship is required for positions requiring government security clearance and for certain other restricted positions.

title: Senior Data Architect
job_description:
** This is an opportunity to join our dynamic team of data engineering professionals working to design and implement database projects for our clients. This position is fully remote (indefinitely). **
Emergent Software is seeking a Senior Data Architect who is analytical, passionate, and detail oriented and enjoys designing & building cloud-based data solutions to solve business problems. A qualified candidate has significant experience developing data warehouses and analytical database solutions in Microsoft Azure. This 100% remote position is for self-starters with excellent communication skills, work ethic, and the ability to manage work across numerous clients and priorities.
Highlights & Benefits of working at Emergent Software
Work closely with other talented database professionals & software engineers. Our vetting process means you can count on your team members to know what they are talking about.
Work from home or work remotely from anywhere
Flexible work schedule meaning you can work regular hours or whenever you work best
Work-life balance is essential and highly valued at Emergent Software. If you choose to work more than 40 hours, you’ll be compensated for the extra work!
Work on interesting projects solving complex business problems with custom software.
100 hours per year to focus on your professional development. We invest in your growth!
Profit sharing bonus means as we’re successful, you’re successful
Excellent benefits package including medical insurance, dental, vision, 401(k) matching, FSA, disability, life insurance, and paid parental leave
Azure Data Architect Required Experience
10+ years of database development & architecture experience
5+ years of experience with Azure database projects
Ability to discuss potential data solutions with clients in the pre-sales process
Data warehouse design using medallion architecture and/or snowflake methodologies
Building data solutions in Microsoft Fabric
ETL development using Azure Data Factory
Building analytics solutions using Power BI
Nice to Have Experience
Snowflake
Databricks
Other BI platforms
Relational database design
Stored procedures & queries for OLTP systems
Performance tuning databases and long running queries
Our Vetting Process
At Emergent Software, we work hard to find the best team members capable of contributing high quality work. If you think you’re one of those, please understand that the effort put into this by people like yourself helps us be successful in surrounding you with other top performers. Here are the steps of our vetting process for this position:
Application (5 minutes)
Online Assessment (30-40 minutes)
Initial Phone Interview (30-45 minutes)
Data Architect Challenge (45-60 minutes)
Technical Interview (60-90 minutes)
Final Interview (45-60 minutes)
Job Offer!
Benefits Package Details
Medical Insurance: up to 80% of your monthly medical premium (HSA options available)
HSA Contribution: up to $144/month
Dental & Vision Insurance: up to 50% of your monthly dental and vision premium costs
401(k) plan: company match up to 4% of salary
Profit sharing bonus: up to 15% of salary paid quarterly
Extra compensation: get paid extra for work over 40 hours/week
Employee referral & customer referral bonuses
Flex Spending Account (FSA) for Dependent Care & Healthcare Costs
Dependent Care FSA Contribution: $90/month
Short Term Disability: $500/week for 12 weeks
Long Term Disability: up to $6,000/month
Group term life and AD&D insurance: $50k
PTO, standard holidays, 2 floating holidays
Paid parental leave: 2 weeks
Staff development program: 100 hours/year plus training costs
About Emergent Software
Emergent Software is a fast-growing software development, cloud consulting, and data engineering company serving clients across the country. We are regularly adding to our team of talented software engineers, cloud architects, data engineers, UX designers, technical product owners and more who can help us deliver high quality services for our clients.
We are a remote-first company
Since our inception, we've embraced a remote-friendly culture, promoting work flexibility beyond the norm. When the pandemic struck in 2020, our transition to fully remote work was seamless—just a matter of cleaning out the fridge. Recognizing an opportunity, we adopted a remote-first approach and began hiring talent from anywhere. We continue to offer our signature Minnesota-nice, Midwest-friendly attitude, ensuring everyone feels valued, whether or not they're familiar with the skyway system.
Your career grows with us
Working with talented engineers on interesting projects creates an engaging environment for software development enthusiasts. By working directly with our experienced team, participating in our staff development program, and solving complex problems across a variety of projects, you’ll find numerous opportunities for long-term career growth.
At Emergent Software, your ideas will be heard, you will grow exponentially as a master of your craft, and you will enjoy working other dedicated team members to deliver software solutions for our clients.
Check out what others say
Visit our Glassdoor page to discover how employees enjoy our remote working structure, flexible hours, profit sharing program, and more!

title: Terraform Engineer
job_description:
Overview
Terraform Developer/Cloud Engineer
Location: Remote
Must Haves:
- Strong coding skills in Terraform
- Any one cloud expertise (AWS, Azure, GCP, OCI; preference is AWS)
- Jenkins and Python/shell scripting basics
- strong with Terraform, Sentinel/OPA, Python/Shell and GitHub Actions.
JOB SUMMARY:
This role serves as subject matter expert for cloud infrastructure as code and automation. Work involves building and maintaining cloud systems, projects and Terraform and Jenkins pipelines while also providing technical support. Resources to do the job require understanding of cloud platforms (OCI, Azure and AWS).
JOB ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Project Management (30%):
- Provides engineering consulting and recommendations for all new Cloud systems to ensure the interoperability and adherence to Claritev technology standards and policies of all systems.
- Defines and monitors multiple project priorities and provides technical and administrative supervision; ensures appropriate management is apprised of operational status of projects.
- Documents all projects deployed and ensures cross-training to team members is completed.
- Builds, develops, and manages technical solutions on Cloud.
Technical Code, design and build (70%):
- Experience provisioning, configuring and maintaining cloud computing services such as OCI, Azure and AWS.
- Serves as expert for terraform code, modules, pipelines and understands resources required to develop end to end infrastructure as code projects.
- Engineering, automating, and orchestrating system provisioning and maintenance processes using modern cloud tools and technologies.
- Understanding the needs for new initiatives to build scalable, distributed and high-performance computing cloud-based platform solutions.
- Collaborating with solutions architects, application developers and security teams to follow best practices.
- Installing configuring, maintaining, and supporting applications and systems in public cloud environments.
- Educating teams on the implementation of new cloud-based initiatives, terraform coding and providing associated training as required.
- Provides a current, well-managed operating environment for production processing and application development.
- Troubleshooting and resolving issues reported by monitoring systems and submitted through the ticketing system of fully documented issues, actions taken, and steps for resolution.
- Provides support on all systems to meet departmental Service Level Agreements.
- Provides support for business continuity, cloud or on-site support for annual disaster recovery test.
- Proficient knowledge with Python and shell scripting.
- Deep level expertise with Jenkins and Groovy.
General:
- Collaborate, coordinate, and communicate across disciplines and departments.
- Ensure compliance with HIPAA regulations and requirements.
- Demonstrate Company's Core Competencies and values held within.
- Please note due to the exposure of PHI sensitive data -- this role is considered to be a High Risk Role
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $55.00 - $60.00 per hour
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Application Question(s):
What is your visa type?
Are you comfortable with W2?
Mention your LinkedIn URL
Experience:
Terraform: 8 years (Required)
Cloud: 8 years (Required)
Coding skills in Terraform: 7 years (Required)
AWS, Azure, GCP, OCI; preference is AWS: 7 years (Required)
Python/shell scripting : 6 years (Required)
Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Android Engineer, Families - Cash App
job_location: Remote in San Francisco Bay Area, CA
job_state: remote in san francisco bay area, ca
job_description:
It all started with an idea at Block in 2013. Initially built to take the pain out of peer-to-peer payments, Cash App has gone from a simple product with a single purpose to a dynamic ecosystem, developing unique financial products, including Afterpay/Clearpay, to provide a better way to send, spend, invest, borrow and save to our 50+ million monthly active customers. We want to redefine the world's relationship with money to make it more relatable, instantly available, and universally accessible.

Today, Cash App has thousands of employees working globally across office and remote locations, with a culture geared toward innovation, collaboration and impact. We've been a distributed team since day one, and many of our roles can be done remotely from the countries where Cash App operates. No matter the location, we tailor our experience to ensure our employees are creative, productive, and happy.
The Role
The Cash App Families team empowers families to manage their personal financial life in ways that are universally accessible, magically relevant, and impossibly simple. Our current focus is to build unique experiences tailored to teenagers and their respective parents/guardians. The products that you build will create significant impact at scale and will fundamentally change how families manage their money.
As part of the Android engineering team for Cash, you'll develop new customer-facing features and enhance our existing ones to scale. We're developing industry-leading design systems and adding exciting new functionality to our ecosystem. In addition, you'll drive architectural decisions and infrastructure improvements to make our systems more robust and scalable
You Will
Closely collaborate across functions on prototypes and experiments to try out ideas
Build end-to-end features of the app: networking, persistence, business logic, and polished, responsive, beautiful UI
Craft durable, well-tested code with an unwavering commitment to product quality
Invent thoughtful Android tech and open source it
Re-architect legacy code and prep it to scale for the future of the product and the team
Partner with iOS and backend developers on delivering remarkable solutions
Have a meaningful impact on the future of the Cash product
You Have
Strong experience in animation and prototyping
Experience creating readable, well-crafted, and maintainable code
Experience voicing customer feedback into product solutions (engineering makes
substantive contributions to product definition)
A commitment to continuous improvement (yourself, your teammates, your software)
Technologies We Use and Teach
Kotlin, including multi-platform with Zipline & Treehouse
Unit tests, snapshot tests
Compose, Coroutines, Molecule, SQLDelight, Retrofit, OkHttp, Wire, Moshi, Okio, Picasso, KotlinPoet Protocol buffers
We're working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is an equal opportunity employer evaluating all employees and job applicants without regard to identity or any legally protected class. We will consider qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records for employment in accordance with state and local laws and "fair chance" ordinances.
We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible.
While there is no specific deadline to apply for this role, U.S. roles are typically open for an average of 55 days before being filled by a successful candidate. Please refer to the date listed at the top of this job page for when this role was first posted

Block takes a market-based approach to pay, and pay may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of four zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.

Zone A:
$217,800—$326,800 USD
Zone B:
$207,000—$310,400 USD
Zone C:
$196,100—$294,100 USD
Zone D:
$185,200—$277,800 USD
Every benefit we offer is designed with one goal: empowering you to do the best work of your career while building the life you want. Remote work, medical insurance, flexible time off, retirement savings plans, and modern family planning are just some of our offering.
Block, Inc. (NYSE: XYZ) builds technology to increase access to the global economy. Each of our brands unlocks different aspects of the economy for more people. Square makes commerce and financial services accessible to sellers. Cash App is the easy way to spend, send, and store money. Afterpay is transforming the way customers manage their spending over time. TIDAL is a music platform that empowers artists to thrive as entrepreneurs. Bitkey is a simple self-custody wallet built for bitcoin. Proto is a suite of bitcoin mining products and services. Together, we’re helping build a financial system that is open to everyone.

title: Sr. Scrum Master(remote)
job_description:
At Claritev, we pride ourselves on being a dynamic team of innovative professionals. Our purpose is simple - we strive to bend the cost curve in healthcare for all. Our dedication to service excellence extends to all our stakeholders – internal and external - driving us to consistently exceed expectations. We are intentionally bold, we foster innovation, we nurture accountability, we champion diversity, and empower each other to illuminate our collective potential.
Be part of our amazing transformational journey as we optimize the opportunity towards becoming a leading technology, data, and innovation voice in healthcare. Onward and Upward!!!
JOB SUMMARY: Sr. Scrum Master is a servant leader of highly collaborative development team practicing Agile and delivering to the business in an iterative manner, using Agile best practices, continuous improvement, and leading without authority. Ideal candidate enjoys fast-paced environment, thrives under ambiguity and embraces change passionately. They help their team adopt and improve on the Scrum methodology. Coaching their team to higher levels of maturity by continually improving their process, and ensuring that they adhere to the Scrum framework.
JOB ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Facilitate Scrum ceremonies for one Scrum team, such as Sprint Planning, Daily Stand-ups, Sprint Reviews, and Retrospectives
2. Enable the team to become high performing, predictable, empowered and self-organized
3. Coach and guide the team in Agile delivery best practices, foster an agile mindset and a culture of continuous improvement
4. Ensure team works at a sustainable pace and protect the team from external distractions
5. Measure team delivery maturity and performance, and review the metrics with the team to identify improvement opportunities
6. Capture, maintain, and report KPIs
7. Assist with, and/or, participate in, PI Planning
8. Assist with release planning and deployment activities, as needed
9. Participates in the Scrum Master Community of Practice sharing ideas, observations and opportunities for improvement

title: Project Manager
job_description:
LaSalle Network is partnering with a forward-thinking organization to bring on a French-speaking Project Manager to drive high-impact contact center transformation projects for a major enterprise client launching operations in France. This remote contract role supports global collaboration and requires availability across GMT and CST hours. With an urgent start and strong client-facing demands, we're looking for a confident communicator who thrives on fast-moving, complex initiatives.

Project Manager Responsibilities:
Lead full lifecycle contact center and cloud communication projects
Manage timelines, budgets, risks, and team deliverables using Smartsheet
Interface directly with executive clients and cross-functional teams
Create and maintain BRDs, UAT plans, and Go-Live documentation
Translate technical language for business audiences
Coordinate with third-party vendors to ensure project alignment
Drive stakeholder satisfaction
Support pre-sales activities including pricing estimates and resource planning

Project Manager Requirements:
3+ years in project or program management with client-facing experience
Fluent in French and experienced with AMEA business environments
Deep understanding of CCaaS/contact center systems (Genesys, NICE, etc.)
Comfortable managing competing priorities in a dynamic setting
Skilled communicator with a strong executive presence
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Wrike; Salesforce familiarity a plus
Experience managing budgets and resourcing in tech-heavy projects

Preferred:
PMI, Agile, or Scrum certification
Knowledge of content management and eCommerce integrations

title: Scrum Master with SaFe
job_description:
Overview
We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Scrum Master to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for facilitating Agile development processes, ensuring that teams adhere to Agile principles and practices. As a Scrum Master, you will play a crucial role in guiding teams through project implementation while fostering a culture of continuous improvement and collaboration.
Duties
Facilitate all Scrum ceremonies (e.g., daily stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives, demos) effectively.
Guide the team in adopting and applying SAFe principles and practices.
Coach and mentor team members to achieve self-organization and continuous improvement.
Identify and remove impediments, protecting the team from external distractions.
Promote clear communication and collaboration within the team and with stakeholders.
Champion Agile best practices across the organization.
Job Type: Contract
Pay: $50.00 - $55.00 per hour
Expected hours: 55.00 per week
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Work Location: Remote

title: IT Business Analyst
job_description:
Role, Responsibilities, and Requirements: IT Business Analyst
The right candidate for the role and responsibility of an IT Business Analyst will have successfully achieved and effortlessly demonstrated command of all aspects of IT business analysis. The candidate will display sustained excellence in technical, functional, behavioral, consultative, and problem-solving skills.
Responsibilities Include
Coordinate and lead user discovery sessions and project team meetings to gather and organize project business requirements and use cases on assigned projects.
Analyze and document IT and business processes and design improvements that reduce expenses and increase customer satisfaction through quality, efficiency, and communication improvements.
Design, coordinate, and execute application functional tests to ensure fulfillment of business requirements and IT quality, architectural, and security standards.
Work closely with the client using the correct methodology/tools/reporting, focusing on requirements and user test methodology.
Work with project leaders and architects to determine the right technical solutions that meet the business requirements.
Establish relationships with key business areas, including logistics and transportation organization, distribution, production, merchandising, planning, and stores.
Work closely with business partners across all levels of the organization to understand their business, system challenges, and opportunities in the context of the requirements and to recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals on time.
Analyze and map business and technical processes (current state/future state).
Drive the desired business value-added results by aligning all technology needs and priorities.
As needed, research the cause of problems and participate in developing solutions that ensure that issues do not occur on an ongoing basis.
Additional Responsibilities Include
Complete required documentation for internal Engagement Reviews.
Present bi-monthly updates on progress through the Engagement Review format.
Requirements
A minimum of 8 years of experience in business analysis.
Experience providing leadership in analysis processes to elicit and document high-quality requirements using various analysis tools and documentation attributes.
Experience analyzing business processes for strategic projects at an advanced level and eliciting, documenting, and managing business requirements to enable the delivery of technical solutions.
Possess excellent business requirement elicitation/analysis/documentation and testing skills.
Possess strong organization, follow-up, and priority-setting skills to handle multiple tasks/projects and to work independently.
A strong technical aptitude with the ability to leverage various technologies to accomplish tasks efficiently.
Possess IT business analysis and application support experience.
Extensive Agile and Scrum knowledge.
Excellent Visio diagramming.
ADO.
Technical Requirements
SQL
Familiarity with ETL
Data conversion experience
Interface analysis experience
Certification Requirements
Hold multiple business analysis-related certifications, i.e., PMI
Hold multiple process certifications, i.e., Scrum.
Obtain certifications immediately or show dedication to acquiring them. The employment offer letter will explicitly outline this requirement and must be agreed upon, initialed, and signed as a condition of employment. Non-compliance may lead to termination.
Professional Development
Training Roadmap.
Learning Agreement.
Compensation
Competitive salary.
Benefits Package
Company-paid medical, dental, vision, and life coverage.
401K with a company match.
The Perks
Gym stipend
The time when you need it - flex days for vacation, sick, and self.
100% virtual office.
Flexible work hours.
Shorter days near the holidays.
Frequent company-sponsored events and team outings.
Employee care program.
Employee recognition program.
Personal care services.
Wellness Program.
Dedicated parking.
7-time winner of the Dallas Morning News Top 100 Workplaces.
Background Screening
Background check required.
A drug screen is required.
Citizenship
U.S. citizenship is required.
Education
A bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, or equivalent.
Advanced degree preferred.
Equal Opportunity Employer
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, disability, age, sex, ethnic or national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or presentation, pregnancy, genetics, veteran status, or any other status protected by state or federal law.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $82,508.00 - $91,100.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Life insurance
Vision insurance
Schedule:
Monday to Friday

Do you have a valid Scrum and PMI certification?
Do you have a minimum of 8 years of experience writing SQL queries?
Do you reside in the state of Texas?
Work Location: Remote

title: Strategic Technical Product Owner - Software Development Expert
job_description: N/A

title: Technical Product Owner / Software Development Expert
job_description:
** This is an opportunity to join our top-notch software development team working closely together on interesting projects for our clients. This position is fully remote (indefinitely).**
Emergent Software is looking for a technical product owner / software development expert who is a smart, passionate, and enjoys problem solving using technology and software. A qualified candidate is a product owner with 5+ years of experience gathering requirements and managing the delivery of custom web application development projects in the Microsoft stack. This 100% remote position is for self-starters with good communication skills, strong technology knowledge, and experience with agile methodologies.
Highlights & Benefits of working at Emergent Software
Work closely with other talented software engineers and analysts. Our vetting process means you can count on your team members to know what they are talking about.
Work from home or work remotely from anywhere you want
Flexible work schedule meaning you can work regular hours or whenever you work best
Work-life balance is essential and highly valued at Emergent Software. If you choose to work more than 40 hours, you’ll be compensated for the extra work!
Work on interesting projects solving complex business problems with custom software.
100 hours per year to focus on your professional development. We invest in your growth!
Profit sharing bonus means as we’re successful, you’re successful
Excellent benefits package including medical insurance, dental, vision, 401(k) matching, FSA, disability, life insurance, and paid parental leave
Primary Duties
Through requirements gathering and analysis, gain a thorough understanding of your project's objectives including target scope, cost, and timeline.
Work with your team and client to create a plan for delivering on project objectives.
Communicate technical and business requirements to software engineers – you must already understand how custom web applications work before you start this job!
Ensure projects stay on target by regularly communicating status, risks, and change as they occur.
Work directly with clients to manage project delivery while encouraging and fostering an agile delivery method
Manage requirements and scope using common agile development methodologies and a backlog stored within Microsoft Azure DevOps.
Help evaluate engagement plans and high level solutioning to ensure clear deliverables are identified prior to project kickoff.
Partner with clients to assist them in performing the Product Owner role.
Work with leadership and other team members to mature our Agile and overall software delivery practices.
Other related duties as needed to ensure project success.
Required Qualifications
Solid understanding of software development life cycle models including expert knowledge of both Agile and traditional project management principles
A proven track record of successfully implementing custom web application projects using Agile methodologies
5+ years of experience as a Product Owner on complex custom software development projects
Strong technical background enabling you to provide credible leadership to development teams and accurately evaluate complex project risks and issues
A solid understanding of how websites, web applications, APIs, databases, and the cloud function at a high level
Experience with agile work organization tools (Azure DevOps, Jira, Trello, Basecamp, Rally)
Experience operating as the liaison between agile development teams and users in defining requirements, performing business analysis, and driving delivery in the right direction
Strong technical writing, verbal communication, and presentation skills are a must
Occasional travel to client sites may be requested for activities such as annual planning meetings. Although travel is not expected to be frequent, the ability to accommodate occasional travel is required.
Nice to Have Experience
Industry recognized Agile process certification (CSM, SAFe, LeSS, or equivalent) or PMP
Previous experience on a mature agile development team in roles such as developer, PM, Scrum Master, QA, etc.
Previous consulting experience either independent consulting or with a firm
Experience on projects utilizing Microsoft stack technologies such as .NET, SQL Server, and Azure as well as JavaScript frameworks such as React, Angular, and Vue.js
Some examples of profiles/backgrounds that we feel would do well in this role:
Software engineer turned product owner
Computer Science degree that is currently in a TPO role
Someone who is a product owner with a passion for the technical side of software development
Our Vetting Process
At Emergent Software, we work hard to find the best analysts capable of delivering high quality software for our clients. If you think you’re one of those, please understand that the effort put into this by people like yourself helps us be successful in surrounding you with other top-notch people. Here are the steps of our vetting process for this position:
Application (5 minutes)
Online Assessment (40-50 minutes)
Initial Phone Interview (30-45 minutes)
Technology Knowledge Assessment Interview (20-30 minutes)
Challenge Interview (90 minutes)
Final Interview (60-90 minutes)
Job Offer!
Benefits Package Details
Medical Insurance: up to 80% of your monthly medical premium (HSA options available)
HSA Contribution: up to $144/month
Dental & Vision Insurance: up to 50% of your monthly dental and vision premium costs
401(k) plan: company match up to 4% of salary
Profit sharing bonus: up to 15% of salary paid quarterly
Extra compensation: get paid extra for work over 40 hours/week
Employee referral & customer referral bonuses
Flex Spending Account (FSA) for Dependent Care & Healthcare Costs
Dependent Care FSA Contribution: $90/month
Short Term Disability: $500/week for 12 weeks
Long Term Disability: up to $6,000/month
Group term life and AD&D insurance: $50k
PTO, standard holidays, 2 floating holidays
Paid parental leave: 2 weeks
Staff development program: 100 hours/year plus training costs
About Emergent Software
Emergent Software is a fast-growing software development, cloud consulting, and data engineering company serving clients across the country. We are regularly adding to our team of talented software engineers, cloud architects, data engineers, UX designers, technical product owners and more who can help us deliver high quality services for our clients.
We are a remote-first company
Since our inception, we've embraced a remote-friendly culture, promoting work flexibility beyond the norm. When the pandemic struck in 2020, our transition to fully remote work was seamless—just a matter of cleaning out the fridge. Recognizing an opportunity, we adopted a remote-first approach and began hiring talent from anywhere. We continue to offer our signature Minnesota-nice, Midwest-friendly attitude, ensuring everyone feels valued, whether or not they're familiar with the skyway system.
Your career grows with us
Working with talented engineers on interesting projects creates an engaging environment for software development enthusiasts. By working directly with our experienced team, participating in our staff development program, and solving complex problems across a variety of projects, you’ll find numerous opportunities for long-term career growth.
At Emergent Software, your ideas will be heard, you will grow exponentially as a master of your craft, and you will enjoy working other dedicated team members to deliver software solutions for our clients.
Check out what others say
Visit our Glassdoor page to discover how employees enjoy our remote working structure, flexible hours, profit sharing program, and more!
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Flexible schedule
Flexible spending account
Health insurance

Life insurance
Paid time off
Parental leave
Professional development assistance

Software engineer turned product owner
Computer Science degree that is currently in a TPO role
Someone who is a product owner with a passion for the technical side of software development
Our Vetting Process
At Emergent Software, we work hard to find the best analysts capable of delivering high quality software for our clients. If you think you’re one of those, please understand that the effort put into this by people like yourself helps us be successful in surrounding you with other top-notch people. Here are the steps of our vetting process for this position:
Application (5 minutes)

About Emergent Software
Emergent Software is a fast-growing software development, cloud consulting, and data engineering company serving clients across the country. We are regularly adding to our team of talented software engineers, cloud architects, data engineers, UX designers, technical product owners and more who can help us deliver high quality services for our clients.
We are a remote-first company
Since our inception, we've embraced a remote-friendly culture, promoting work flexibility beyond the norm. When the pandemic struck in 2020, our transition to fully remote work was seamless—just a matter of cleaning out the fridge. Recognizing an opportunity, we adopted a remote-first approach and began hiring talent from anywhere. We continue to offer our signature Minnesota-nice, Midwest-friendly attitude, ensuring everyone feels valued, whether or not they're familiar with the skyway system.
Your career grows with us
Working with talented engineers on interesting projects creates an engaging environment for software development enthusiasts. By working directly with our experienced team, participating in our staff development program, and solving complex problems across a variety of projects, you’ll find numerous opportunities for long-term career growth.
At Emergent Software, your ideas will be heard, you will grow exponentially as a master of your craft, and you will enjoy working other dedicated team members to deliver software solutions for our clients.

title: Scrum Master
job_description:
Overview:
Are you a purpose-driven Scrum Master seeking to join Dreamers, Drivers, and Doers who serve the Veterans that have protected our Freedom?

The selected Scrum Master will be supporting critical financial applications within the Veterans Affairs, which directly impacts our soldier's and military families wellbeing. Our teams are built with customer service-focused professionals seeking to grow their knowledge in Agile Methodologies.

The Scrum Master will lead scrum teams, provide management, direction, administration, quality assurance, and leadership of staff execution for each of the assigned projects. As our Scrum Master you will provide on-site, day-to-day support and management of scrum teams including quality monitoring and SME-level inputs to improve the overall performance of the assigned projects; support of configuration and release management, and assessment and authorization to VA IT development/ sustainment project(s) as needed.

Responsibilities:
Provide day-to-day management guidance and direction to scrum teams in the execution of tasks defined in the PWS.
Manage resources and project based on timelines established in the project schedule, and monitor progress.
Use proven software development methodologies, including Large Scale Scrum (LeSS), SAFe, VIP and Process Asset Library (PAL) that assure that all contract-driven activities are identified, documented, and tracked so that the contract shall continuously be evaluated and monitored for timely and quality service.
Act as primary interface with client and ensure client’s needs are met within the scope of this project and our contract.
Provide project financial and resource management.
Plan and conduct ‘VIP Build’ planning or Program Increment (PI) Planning, manage PI-Planning session in accordance with SAFe and in alignment with VA VIP process.
Provide detailed metrics and dashboard covering tasks, assigned resources, and story points including burn down charts.
Identify, communicate, mitigate and manage project risks; provide weekly updates to PMSS Risk Manager on issues/risks requiring escalation.
Maintain requirements backlog and conduct requirements elaborations.
Plan and support Sprint and Build releases for all environment, and coordinate with Test and CM Manager to ensure adequate and timely support.
Collect and maintain all release documents and ensure that compliance user stories have been completed and approved by assigned Release Manager.
Qualifications:
10 years of experience supporting software development programs.
5 years of experience leading a program using either LeSS or SAFe (required).
Strong experience as a Scrum Master in an Agile development methodology.
Proven ability to lead scrum teams in the execution of project tasks and providing monitoring including risk/issues management.
Experience managing scrum teams within the VA, specifically working knowledge of VA's VIP management process (nice to have).
Knowledge of methodologies, technologies, frameworks, and toolsets such as Agile methodology, Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), Agility, Jira, VIP, etc.
Deep understanding of scaled agile development methodologies (SAFe).
This role is the primary interface with the customer and requires high-level of professionalism; and oral and written communications skills.

Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Systems, Business or related scientific / technical discipline.
Additional 8 years’ relevant experience may be substituted for Bachelor’s degree.
Leading SAFe certification (required).
Certified Project Management Professional (PMP) (preferred).
Knowledge of Lean Six Sigma (LSS) (preferred).
Certified Scrum Master (CSM).

Clearance:
Ability to obtain Moderate Background Investigation (MBI) clearance.

Location:
Remote, USA
Pay Range:
The pay for this position ranges from $65,205 to $75,375.
The actual salary offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.
Also, certain positions are eligible for additional forms of compensation, such as bonuses.
TISTA associates are eligible to participate in our comprehensive benefits plan! More information can be found here: https://tistatech.com/working-at-tista/

title: Technical Writer (Contract)
job_description:
MUST BE A VIRGINIA RESIDENT AND CURRENT RESIDE IN VIRGINIA TO BE CONSIDERED. DO NOT APPLY IF YOU ARE NOT
Contract position with client---video interview is 1st interview and 2nd might be required in person in Richmond VA
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Write and edit various types of technical documentation such as user and procedural manuals, user
documentation, tutorials, training material, user guides, online user help, and instructional manuals.
Edit and proofread technical materials for accuracy and clarity.
Review and revise documentation for accuracy, consistency, and adherence to style guidelines.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as business analysts, software developers, and other
stakeholders, to gather necessary information and better understand complex information.
Organize and structure technical content for end-user consumption, ensuring clarity, easily
understandable, and accessibility for the target audience.
Incorporate visual aids, such as diagrams, screenshots, and illustrations, to enhance the
understanding of technical information.
Ensure documentation complies with industry standards and guidelines.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
A minimum of four (4) years of experience in technical writing, technical communications, computer
science, information technology, or a related field.
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field from an
accredited institute of higher learning.
Must be detail oriented.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Excellent verbal and writing communication skills.
Strong command of grammar, punctuation, and style guides (like APA, MLA, or Chicago).
Must be able to adapt as you will be working in a dynamic environment with evolving technologies,
changing requirements, and distributed team members.
Must be able to effectively communicate and work with cross-functional teams, such as project
managers and project teams, and subject matter experts.
Must have demonstrated problem-solving skills. Be able to identify and address challenges or
obstacles that arise during the documentation process, analyze complex information, anticipate
potential user issues, and resolve these issues through appropriate methods.
Proven writing experience with FAQs, user guides, or manuals in a technical field.
Strong knowledge of best technical writing practices, including style guides and industry standards,
as well as the technical skills to understand the software development life cycle (SDLC).
Familiarity with content management systems (CMS) and documentation tools such as Adobe
RoboHelp and Microsoft Word as well as technical knowledge of XML markup language and HTML to
define structured content with predefined tags, and conditional tags.
Work experience with version control systems, such as Git, for managing documentation reviews.

6+ years of experience in technical writing.
Certifications such as those offered by the Society for Technical Communication (STC).
Proficiency with authoring content using Adobe RoboHelp 2019 Release or greater.
Experience with Adobe RoboHelp command line builds.
Experience with HTML5/CSS.
Experience in writing online help and knowledge base articles.
Proficiency in using graphics editing software and screen capture tools for creating visuals and
illustrations.
A portfolio of previous work demonstrating writing ability and expertise in technical documentation.

title: Software Technical Writer - 2025
job_description:
Plexis Healthcare Systems, Inc., a progressive software development company in Ashland, OR, is looking to hire an enthusiastic and experienced Technical Writer. This position is remote. Please apply at www.plexishealth.com
Position Purpose
The primary goal of this role is to develop, update, and maintain high-quality documentation for software products developed by PLEXIS. This includes creating user guides, product manuals, and technical reference materials tailored for both external clients and internal team members. Occasionally, the technical writer may also be tasked with documenting third-party software tools utilized by PLEXIS. The documentation produced will be critical in ensuring users and staff can effectively understand, utilize, and troubleshoot the software.
Essential Functions and Basic Duties
Essential functions and basic duties include the creation and maintenance of user documentation for various PLEXIS software products. Such documentation includes:
User guides
Software documentation made available via web portal (new site page documentation, existing page updates)
Release notes
Other documentation relating to a PLEXIS product
Creation and/or maintenance of documentation for software that is used at PLEXIS, though not created by PLEXIS
Performance Measurements
Timely, high-quality fulfillment of essential functions and basic duties
Knowledge, application, and adherence to PLEXIS process methodology and corresponding tools used to support such methodology
Timely and consistent response/turn-around of status reports, time entry and other documentation required by PLEXIS
Professional business communications (verbal, written and professional appearance)
Conflict resolution
Multi-tasking and successful prioritization of daily duties to maximize project(s) success
Demonstration of positive attitude toward company, products, and employees
Promotion of cooperative behavior and team efforts
Regular attendance during normally scheduled hours
Demonstrates and adheres to PLEXIS’ Core Values
Accountability and integrity in everything we do
Collaborative in all interactions
Execute with precision and creativity
Strive for continuous improvement
Passionate about positive experiences and outcomes
Health, family & fun
Qualifications
Interact well with people
Proven ability to write clearly and concisely
Research and evaluate new documentation tools and methods
Ability to use basic to advanced formatting features of Microsoft WORD, including “styles”
Experience using Visio, Acrobat Pro, SnagIt, and SharePoint
Experience with on-line help authoring tools
Comfortable learning new computer applications
Interact well with engineers and other software professionals to understand functionality, data elements, relationships, and processing rules
Ability to attain proficiency in PLEXIS software applications for which documentation is created and maintained
Ability to present simple to complex ideas and concepts to support end user “ease-of-use” of the documentation for the products they are using
Self-motivated, self-disciplined, and results-oriented
Knowledge of healthcare claims processing industry practices (while not required, this is highly desirable)
Physical Activities and Requirements of this Position
Ability to access input and retrieve information from a computer to produce typed copy
Capacity to communicate well and in a manner which can be understood by those with whom the technical writer is speaking, in person and by phone
Capability of dialing or otherwise using a telephone to place and receive telephone calls
Willingness and capability to come and go from the work area repeatedly throughout the day as is necessary
Willingness and capacity to sit or stand for minimum periods of one hour at a time
Capacity to pick up, quickly skim, and/or thoroughly read books and files and other materials
Ability to reach forward, up, down, and to the side in order to move equipment up to 40 lbs.
Willingness and ability to maintain regular attendance for normally scheduled hours and to be flexible to work other shifts as necessary (i.e., potential weekend schedule)
Working Conditions (when working in a PLEXIS office/facility)
Ability to tolerate, use, work with, in, or under:
Florescent lighting
Recycled air
Video Display Terminals
Semi-enclosed areas
Central heating and air conditioning

Occasional moving to new seating areas and buildings.

Reasoning Ability
Possesses and uses good diagnosis and troubleshooting skills.
Able to identify problems, patterns, and think through potential solutions then communicates and/or escalates appropriately.

Basic math skills.

Capacity to communicate adequately, in person or via telephone, in an easily understood manner.

title: Technical Writer
job_description:
QuickNode is a cloud-based infrastructure company that powers the blockchain ecosystem.
Our mission is to be the indispensable utility that empowers companies and innovators globally to build next-generation, Web3 enabled businesses & applications using blockchain technology. QuickNode is backed by some of the world's best investors including Tiger Global, Y Combinator, SoftBank, and the Seven Seven Six Fund. The QuickNode team has over 120 people maintaining high performance global data infrastructure for amazing customers serving billions of requests daily.
We are a global remote company with an HQ in Miami, Florida.
The Role
Join QuickNode as a Solana Technical Writer and shape how developers learn, build, and succeed on one of blockchain's fastest-growing ecosystems. Your content will be featured on our platform, serving thousands of developers worldwide who rely on QuickNode's infrastructure to power their Solana applications. You'll collaborate with engineers, product teams, and ecosystem experts to create technically accurate and comprehensive educational content that makes Solana development more accessible, discoverable, and successful. Whether helping onboard Web2 developers to Solana or providing deep-dive resources for experienced builders, you'll play a crucial role in accelerating developer productivity and success across the entire Solana ecosystem.
What You'll Do
Write comprehensive instructional guides covering Web3 fundamentals and Solana-specific technologies
Build sample applications that demonstrate real-world implementation patterns
Develop and maintain API documentation
Collaborate with engineers, product teams, and ecosystem experts to gather insights and validate technical accuracy
Maintain and update existing guides to reflect Solana's rapid ecosystem evolution and feature releases
Provide constructive feedback on team members' work, ensuring coherence and high standards across all content
Develop and implement internal style guides and writing standards for consistency across technical content
What You'll Bring
2+ years of experience in technical writing, developer documentation, or instructional content creation
Proficiency in TypeScript and Rust with ability to write Solana programs using Anchor or natively.
Strong knowledge of Web3 fundamentals and blockchain technologies, with specific familiarity with Solana concepts including the account model, instructions and transactions, instruction handlers, PDAs, CPIs, and token extensions.
Passion for Solana and its ecosystem, with enthusiasm for staying current with the latest developments
Exceptional writing skills with focus on clarity, accuracy, and simplicity
Proven ability to distill complex technical concepts into accessible content
Strong collaboration and communication skills for cross-functional teamwork
Self-starter mentality with ability to work independently while contributing effectively to team goals
Builder and engineer mindset with focus on implementing efficiencies within content creation processes
Experience managing multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Bachelor's degree in English, Technical Writing, Computer Science, or related field preferred (or equivalent practical experience)
The US base salary range and level for this position are $112,5000 - $125,000 per year and level P4.International ranges, in local currency, will be discussed during the hiring process with applicable candidates. This role is eligible for a quarterly bonus tied to company and individual goal achievement. We consider years of experience, level of proficiency in job function, the technical competencies required and location when determining base salary ranges for positions and levels.
The QuickNode compensation philosophy includes pillars to ensure fair and unbiased compensation for all employees. To design and deliver total reward offerings that are employee-centric. To offer a competitive benefit package in all locations where we operate. To prioritize attracting and retaining the best talent globally. To maintain a high-performing and flexible way of working.
During the hiring process, we are committed to discussing compensation openly and honestly. We encourage candidates to share their salary expectations and requirements early, allowing for an individualized discussion. We know that our total rewards practices impact the lives and wellbeing of our employees. Therefore, we will never stop learning about the market, our business, your needs, and how best to achieve our goals through thoughtful and data-driven practices. If you have any questions or require further information about the compensation for this position, please don't hesitate to reach out to your Recruiter.
We at Quicknode are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_description:
Role: Technical Writer (AI/ML)
Location: San Francisco, CA (Remote)

Overview
Anthropic is seeking an experienced Technical Writer to join our team on a contract basis to help document our suite of technical products and developer tools. This role will be instrumental in creating clear and comprehensive documentation that enables developers and organizations to effectively integrate and utilize Anthropic’s technologies. Our current projects include documenting the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for LLM-to-external system integration, API documentation, product documentation such as for Claude Code, SDK guides, and various other technical features. The ideal candidate combines deep technical writing expertise with the ability to understand and explain complex concepts to diverse technical audiences.
Key Responsibilities:
Create and maintain high-quality technical documentation for various developer-facing products and features
Document APIs, SDKs, protocols, and integration patterns across multiple technical initiatives
Collaborate with engineering, product, marketing, and research teams to gather technical information and understand new features and capabilities
Develop code samples, tutorials, and quickstart guides for different products and use cases
Review and edit documentation for technical accuracy, clarity, and consistency with Anthropic’s documentation style guide
Gather and incorporate feedback from users and internal stakeholders to continuously improve documentation quality
You may be a good fit if you have:
5+ years of professional technical writing experience, with a strong portfolio demonstrating API and developer documentation
A proven ability to document complex technical systems and make them accessible to various audience levels
Experience with documentation-as-code workflows, including Git, Markdown, and static site generators
Hands-on coding experience in at least one programming language (Python, TypeScript, or similar)
A strong understanding of modern software development practices

title: Technical Writer
job_description:
Focus School Software is a fast-growing school management software company. We thrive on creating some of the most innovative features on the market today, helping educators to meet their evolving needs in classrooms, district management, state reporting compliance, and other facets of student-centered education and technology.
We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly organized Technical Writer to join our team. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment and can deliver high-quality documentation under tight deadlines. This role is responsible for creating, maintaining, and improving help guides, training manuals, FAQs, and troubleshooting guides—often with short turnaround times aligned to product releases and staff requests. The ability to rapidly process release updates and translate them into clear, user-friendly content is essential.
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Technical Writing, Communications, English, or a related field.
Previous experience in technical writing or content development in a high-velocity release environment preferred.
Qualifications & Skills:
Exceptional writing, editing, and proofreading skills with an emphasis on speed and precision.
Proven ability to manage multiple projects with fast turnaround times.
Experience with documentation tools, content management systems, or knowledge bases is a plus.
Strong communication skills and the ability to extract information quickly from stakeholders.
Comfortable adapting to new tools and workflows in a deadline-driven environment.
Familiarity with agile development cycles and rapid release management is highly beneficial.
Key Responsibilities:
Track new releases and back-merges to ensure documentation is updated promptly and accurately.
Maintain and revise help documents and training manuals with a focus on speed, accuracy, and clarity.
Respond quickly to change requests submitted by staff, updating documentation as needed.
Keep internal tracking spreadsheets current with real-time updates on documentation changes, release notes, and project status.
Expand documentation to include FAQs, example scenarios, and troubleshooting guides that proactively address user needs.
Collaborate with the writing team to produce documentation for new features under tight release schedules.
Review and improve existing documentation for clarity, grammar, formatting consistency, and fast user navigation.
Interview subject matter experts and technical staff to quickly gather and apply information for documentation.
Translate product specifications and technical content into concise, actionable user documentation on short deadlines.
Embed screenshots for reference to improve clarity and usability.
Prioritize quick absorption of release notes—including features and bug fixes—and produce clear, client-ready documentation on an accelerated schedule.
Focus School Software's compensation package offers the following benefits:
Medical Insurance
Dental/Vision Insurance
Life Insurance
Short and Long Term Disability Insurance
401(k) after 6 months
Paid Holidays
Paid Vacation and Sick Time

Job Description:
We are GDIT. As one of the largest IT and mission services providers to the government, we own our opportunities to better enable healthcare organizations to identify theirs.
You can make GDIT your place. You make it your own by turning obstacles into action. By owning your opportunity at GDIT, you’ll play an important role in providing the technologies and services that millions of healthcare professionals depend on, every day. Our work depends on a Technical Writer and Editor joining our team to support Federal Electronic Health Records Modernization (EHRM) program activities.
At GDIT, we put our people first. As a Technical Writer and Editor supporting the EHRM program, you will be responsible for reviewing and editing project deliverables such as technical documents, proposals, policies, knowledge articles, and standard operating procedures (SOPs) specifically in the areas of 508 compliancy.
This role is fully remote!
HOW A TECHNICAL WRITER AND EDITOR WILL MAKE AN IMPACT:
Working on all phases of documentation; assisting in the preparation of documents and supports the development of contract deliverables, proposals, and reports.
Review and edit deliverable content for Section 508 accessibility compliance.
Stay up to date on Section 508 standards and best practices.
Writing and editing functional descriptions, user manuals, special reports, or any other customer deliverables or document, conducting research and ensuring the use of proper technical terminology.
Drafts, reviews, and edits project deliverables such as technical documents, policies, knowledge articles, and standard operating procedures (SOPs).
Preparing and maintaining operations documentation, user guides, manuals, and technical publications.
Preparing reports, responses, and briefings targeted to a wide range of audiences.
REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s Degree and 5+ years' of relevant experience (or the equivalent combination of education, professional training, or work experience).
Experience with EHR (Electronic Health Records) required.
Proposal writing experience is required
Experience with 508 technical writing required.
Experience editing material for punctuation, grammar, and content.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio.
Knowledge of Federal documentation standards, processes, and 508 compliancy.
Must be able to obtain a Public Trust Level 5 clearance.
Ability to travel up to 25% of the year, if needed.
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Ability to thrive in a highly collaborative, fast-paced, growth-focused environment.
Strong and effective communication and presentation skills.
Strong attention to detail and highly organized.

To encourage work/life balance, GDIT offers employees full flex work weeks where possible and a variety of paid time off plans, including vacation, sick and personal time, holidays, paid parental, military, bereavement and jury duty leave. title: Marketing Cloud Email and Communications Specialist (Virtual; Remote)
job_description:
Visit Learning Network's Careers site to learn more about who we are: https://learningnetwork.org/careers
Company Summary
Learning Network is a growing, innovative, and customer-centric educational technology company. We seek creative and tenacious individuals to help us drive success through service.
Service is very important to us. At Learning Network, you will be among people who care about their customers and colleagues. We prioritize service by ensuring the details are done and done well - every time. We make promises, and we keep those promises. We recognize that our customers and employees don’t have to choose us. As such, service is embedded deep within our culture - and providing white-glove service is an expectation of every employee.
At Learning Network, you’ll be a part of something special. You’ll sleep better knowing you make a difference by bringing the most innovative education to thousands of students. You’ll do this amongst a supportive community of people who care. In return, you’ll care. You’ll show you care by being teachable, doing your job well, and valuing the relationships with your colleagues. You’ll achieve your goals and play nicely in the sandbox with others while doing it. We don’t do drama, and neither should you.
Working at Learning Network isn’t for everyone. But for those who choose to commit to hard work, service, students, and colleagues, it’s an incredibly rewarding experience.
Position Summary
We have an immediate opening for a Marketing Cloud Email & Communications Specialist to lead our email marketing automation strategy while supporting multi-channel messaging efforts. This role blends technical expertise in Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) with communications strategy, ensuring messaging aligns with brand standards and maximizes engagement.
To be successful, you’ll need to be detail-oriented and initiative-taking. We need a broad thinker who can make suggestions, take constructive feedback with a good attitude and without pushback, and then go out and personally execute with diligence. The ideal candidate has hands-on experience with SFMC (including Journey Builder, Automation Studio, AMPscript, and segmentation) and understands copywriting best practices, A/B testing, and audience targeting.
This position is full-time and remote.
Job Duties
Serve all stakeholders with integrity, humility, and joy while consistently modeling the importance of both task competency and relationships;
Participate in Company events, activities, and meetings with a smile and an infectious, great attitude;
Develop and execute email marketing campaigns using Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC), including Journey Builder, Automation Studio, and Email Studio.
Maintain and optimize email automation workflows, including trigger-based campaigns, transactional emails, and customer journeys.
Manage email segmentation, audience targeting, and dynamic content strategies to ensure relevant, personalized communication.
Write, proof, and optimize email copy and automation sequences to align with brand guidelines and StoryBrand messaging.
Implement AMPscript, SQL queries, and API integrations to create dynamic, data-driven email experiences.
Analyze and report on email performance metrics (open rates, click-through rates, conversions, etc.) and apply insights to improve engagement.
Conduct A/B testing on subject lines, content, send times, and other variables to enhance campaign effectiveness.
Collaborate with the enrollment, student advising, marketing, and customer success teams to improve lead nurturing and engagement.
Assist in managing multi-channel messaging, including SMS, push notifications, call scripts, and in-platform messaging, ensuring consistency in customer communication.
Work closely with data analytics teams to ensure audience segmentation is accurate and up to date.
Keep the email content calendar updated, ensuring timely execution of planned campaigns.
Provide internal training and documentation on best practices for email marketing and Marketing Cloud automation.
Ensure email deliverability best practices and compliance with CAN-SPAM, GDPR, and CCPA regulations.
Other duties as assigned.
Essential Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Strong knowledge and hands-on experience in Salesforce Marketing Cloud, particularly Journey Builder, Automation Studio, Email Studio, and AMPscript.
Proficiency in email marketing best practices, campaign optimization, and performance analytics.
Strong understanding of audience segmentation, dynamic content, and personalization techniques.
Excellent copywriting and proofreading skills, with the ability to craft engaging, conversion-focused messaging.
Ability to analyze email performance metrics, draw actionable insights, and make data-driven improvements.
Familiarity with HTML, CSS, SQL, and APIs to support email scripting and integration needs.
Knowledge of email compliance laws (CAN-SPAM, GDPR, CCPA) and best practices for deliverability and inbox placement.
Experience with A/B testing and multivariate testing methodologies.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-energy environment and juggle multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to meet deadlines and manage campaign timelines.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field.
Three (3) or more years of experience in Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) with expertise in email automation and segmentation.
Salesforce Marketing Cloud Email Specialist Certification is required.
Two (2) or more years of experience managing multi-channel digital marketing campaigns.
Experience with AMPscript, SQL, and dynamic email personalization.
Proficiency with Google Suite and Asana (preferred but not required).
Ability to pass a required background check.
Benefits
Medical, dental, and vision employee coverage for as little as $1 each per month;
Personal paid time off in addition to major holidays;
Short-term disability insurance, long-term disability insurance, life insurance, and AD&D insurance are all 100% paid by the employer; and
401(k) with employer contributing a dollar-for-dollar match of employee contributions up to 5% of employee earnings.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $90,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
AD&D insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Referral program
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Weekends as needed
Application Question(s):
What state do you live and plan to work from?
Education:
Bachelor's (Required)
Experience:
Salesforce Marketing Cloud: 3 years (Required)
Managing Multi-Channel Digital Marketing Campaigns: 2 years (Required)
SQL: 1 year (Required)

Salesforce Marketing Cloud Email Specialist Certification (Required)
