title: Software Engineer - Frontend
job_description:
Who we are

The problem: Every minute matters in fire response. As climate change amplifies the intensity of wildfires—with longer fire seasons, dryer fuels, and faster winds—new ignitions spread faster and put more communities at risk. Today, most wildfires are detected by bystanders and reported via 911, meaning it can take hours to detect a fire, verify its exact location and size, and dispatch first responders. Fire authorities need a faster way to detect, confirm, and pinpoint fires so that they can quickly respond—preventing small flare-ups from becoming devastating infernos.

About Pano: Pano AI is a 100+ person growth stage start-up, headquartered in San Francisco, that is the leader in early wildfire detection and intelligence, helping fire professionals respond to fires faster and more safely—with the right equipment, timely information, and enhanced coordination—so that they can stop a new ignition before it grows. Pano AI combines advanced hardware, software, and artificial intelligence into an easy-to-use, web-based platform. Leveraging a network of ultra-high-definition, 360-degree cameras atop high vantage points, as well as satellite and other data feeds, Pano AI produces a real-time picture of threats in a geographic region and delivers immediate, actionable intelligence.

MIT Technology Review listed Pano as one of the top 15 climate tech companies to watch in 2024 and Fast Company named Pano AI one of the Top 10 most innovative companies in AI of 2023. We’ve also been featured in the Wall Street Journal, Bloomberg, CNBC News, and a national TV commercial produced by strategic partner T-Mobile. Pano AI’s dozens of government and enterprise customers span 10 states in the U.S., five states in Australia, and BC, Canada, helping protect more than 30 million acres of land. Pano AI has raised $89M in venture capital funding from Giant Ventures, Liberty Mutual Ventures, Tokio Marine Future Fund, Congruent Ventures, Initialized Capital, Salesforce Ventures, and T-Mobile Ventures. Learn more at https://www.pano.ai/.

The Role

The Frontend Engineer will strategize, design, and execute the user interface and experience for a single-page application dedicated to early wildfire detection. Responsibilities include collaborating closely with the product team to enhance map functionality, enhancing our custom canvas video player, and extending React application functionality. The engineer will deliver thoroughly tested, accessible solutions while adhering to best practices and ensuring cross-device compatibility.
What you’ll do
Feature Development: Lead the development of new features, ensuring they align with project goals and enhance overall functionality.
Code Maintenance: Maintain and enhance existing codebase to optimize extensibility and address evolving requirements.
Code Review: Conduct thorough code reviews, providing constructive feedback to maintain code quality and adherence to best practices.
Code Quality Advocate: Championing the creation of readable code with predictable patterns to enhance collaboration and maintainability. Prioritize code quality by emphasizing accessibility principles, incorporating security best practices, and writing testable code.
Best Practices Evolution: Actively contribute to evolving coding standards and best practices within the development team.
Technology Evaluation: Participate in evaluating new technologies and tools, ensuring the adoption of effective solutions that align with project needs.
Tech Debt Prioritization: Collaborate in prioritizing and addressing technical debt to maintain a healthy and sustainable codebase.
Legacy Application Management: Successfully navigate and contribute to our existing application, striking a balance between addressing technical debt and delivering new features.
Expert Debugging Skills: Possess strong debugging capabilities to identify and resolve issues promptly, ensuring the stability and reliability of React applications.
REST API Integration: Proficient in utilizing RESTful APIs to facilitate smooth communication between the frontend and backend of React applications.
What you’ll bring
2+ years of Frontend Engineer Experience: Demonstrate a robust background in developing Frontend applications, showcasing proficiency and expertise in creating efficient and scalable solutions.
Technical Proficiency: Experience with the following technologies HTML, CSS, Typescript, React, React Testing Library, Jest, and a state management solution like Redux (we use Recoil). Bonus points for HTML Canvas, or Map Technologies.
Design System and Component Library Proficiency: Proven expertise in utilizing Design Systems like Material Design and component libraries such as Material-UI, showcasing efficiency and consistency in development processes.
Effective Communication: Ability to communicate efficiently within the team, sharing insights and updates, and collaborating effectively to achieve project goals.
Cross-functional Team Experience: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including QA, Product, and Backend, to plan and execute project initiatives.
Preference for someone in PST or MT time zone
Final salary offered is based upon multiple factors, including individual job-related qualifications, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and location. In addition to salary, this position is also eligible for stock options. We offer comprehensive health insurance, paid time off, and 401k.
Pano is an equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and supporting our team-members regardless of where they come from. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Front End Javascript Developer
job_description:
Welcome to the (booming) privacy industry!
Over 250,000 websites are launched every single day that are required by law to have a Privacy Policy(1). Termageddon offers a $119/year auto-updating Privacy Policy generator. To say the least, there is a lot of opportunity in this space, and Termageddon is at the forefront of this new industry, already serving tens of thousands of customers.
Termageddon is an industry recognized, auto-updating website policies generator. Our SaaS tool generates comprehensive Privacy Policies, Terms of Service agreements and more to help businesses comply with privacy laws and avoid fines and lawsuits. We have a silly name but we’re serious about helping clients get protected.
What’s unique about our software is that we monitor laws, notify our customers of changes, and can even push newly required policy disclosures automatically to our customers’ website policy pages. In other words, we give our customers a strategy to keep up to date with privacy law changes.
We currently have about 10,000 reseller and affiliate partners spanning five countries and have successfully kept tens of thousands of policies up to date with changing legislation. We are an eight person team (https://termageddon.com/about-us/) that is looking to grow, and you’ll be working with us all directly (including the founders). This is a great opportunity to participate in one of the fastest growing industries around, with a company that is leading the charge.
We’re headquartered in the western suburbs of Chicago but this job opportunity is fully remote.
Now is your chance to fulfill your lifelong dream of working at a Privacy Policy generator company!
(1) “As of June 18, 2021, there are over 1.86 billion websites online, with Siteefy noting that more than 547,200 new websites are created globally every day.” - https://www.techradar.com/news/websites-at-30-how-much-has-the-internet-changed
66.3% of websites are CMS based, which by default collect at least website visitors’ IP address - https://w3techs.com/technologies/history_overview/content_management/all
Job description:
As our Front End Javascript Developer, you will be working on and deploying a new product offering from Termageddon (for both desktop and mobile (responsive design)). The product you help develop will be deployed onto tens of thousands of customer websites. You will work with a team of developers under the direction of our CTO.
Expectations:
Work hours: Monday-Friday (8am CST - 5pm CST)
One hour lunch break (any time)
Requirements:
Extensive prior experience with JavaScript development and a solid understanding of the DOM and how to manipulate it. The ability to work in Vanilla JavaScript and complete complex tasks is required. Experience with Git code repository required.
5+ years of hands-on daily Javascript experience
3 professional references
No privacy law experience required.
Must be authorized to work in the United States.
Must enjoy the solid memes posted in our Slack chanel
Pay
$90,000/year
Benefits:
Work from home
15 days paid time off, +1 extra day per year up to 22 days total
Home office:
New computer
$100/month internet stipend
Interview process:
The interview process will consist of one 30 minute introductory interview and one 60 minute technical interview. The technical interview will require a demonstration of your development skills so please join the interview on a laptop or desktop computer as you will need to share your screen and type.
Application requirements
As part of your application, you must include a cover letter which includes JavaScript code written by you, which would provide a popup message to a website visitor with YOUR name and email.
Termageddon is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, or any other protected classifications.

title: SDE I - Mobile iOS
job_description:
DESCRIPTION
This role is designed exclusively for university bachelor's degree recent graduates in the last 24 months in Computer Science or related field.
As Software Development Engineer(s), selected candidate(s) will have the chance to have an impact on thousands of Amazon customers (from buyers and sellers, to Amazon employees) while working with industry-leading technologies. Amazon's LATAM Software Development Engineering organization is growing and we're looking for Software Engineer(s) with technical coding/programming academic background who thrive on learning from complex problems and are able to face challenges while working with multiple technical teams at Amazon.
The selected candidate(s) is expected to contribute to all parts of the software development and deployment lifecycle, including but not limited to: design, development, documentation, testing and operations. They will be an integral part of a team that encourages experimentation and innovation on behalf of our customers. This role will directly participate in building and correcting software in partnership with other developers within the organization.
Within this role, selected candidate(s) will not only code, but also drive the direction of the software architecture, and team best practices.
Alongside their technical team, selected candidate(s) will be responsible for delivering production-ready code that will be used by thousands of Amazon customers, and own end-to-end customer experience of the services and features that are built. As an Software Development Engineer at Amazon, you will play a pivotal role in the following:
Work with the team to help drive business decisions.
Design, implement, test, deploy and maintain innovative software solutions to drive services optimizations, cost, and security.
Use software engineering best practices to ensure a high standard of quality for all of the team deliverables.
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
Our compensation reflects the cost of labor in Brazil geographic markets. The base pay for this full-time, permanent position ranges from BRL R$9,500 to BRL R$ 10,500 per month (in addition to Amazon Restricted Stock Units and Sign-on Payments in Year 1 and Year 2).
Key job responsibilities
Collaborate with experienced cross-disciplinary Amazonians to conceive, design, and bring innovative products and services to market.
Collaborate to design and build innovative technologies in a large distributed computing environment, and help lead fundamental changes in the industry.
Collaborate to create solutions to run predictions on distributed systems with exposure to innovative technologies at incredible scale and speed.
Collaborate to build distributed storage, index, and query systems that are scalable, fault-tolerant, low cost, and easy to manage/use.
Ability to design and code the right solutions starting with broadly defined problems.
Work in an agile environment to deliver high-quality software.
A day in the life
If selected, you will receive financial relocation support, if currently living 80 kilometers (kms) or more from our São Paulo location.
Office Address:

title: Google Paid Search Specialist Remote (Work-from-Home)
job_description:
Job Title: Google Paid Search Specialist

Company: Relentless Digital

Location: Remote (Work-from-Home)

Compensation: $50,000 - 65,000 annual salary, DOE

About Us: Relentless Digital is a leader in digital marketing solutions tailored specifically for HVAC, plumbing, and electrical contractors. Founded on the principles of integrity and relentless pursuit of excellence, we specialize in Google Business Profile management, SEO, paid ads, and automation. Our dedication to delivering impactful results has earned us recognition as a trusted partner in the home services industry.

Awards & Recognition:
2025 Inc Best Workplaces
2024 Inc 5000, 217th fastest-growing privately held company in the US
Finalist for Inc Best Places to Work
Industry-leading retention rate of nearly 98% of clients

Core Values:
Be relentless.
Lead with integrity.
Make it happen.
Make an impact.
Bold yet humble.

Job Overview: We are seeking a highly skilled and self-motivated Google Paid Search Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of managing and optimizing Google Ads and Bing Ads campaigns, specifically for businesses in the home services industry. This role requires a deep understanding of conversion rate optimization, enhancing ad quality, and improving landing page experiences. As a self-starter, you will take ownership of paid search campaigns with little to no supervision, while also contributing to long-term team-building goals.

Responsibilities:
Plan, execute, and optimize Google Ads and Bing Ads campaigns for home service businesses to achieve client goals (e.g., lead generation, ROI).
Conduct keyword research, competitive analysis, and audience targeting to create high-performing ad strategies.
Develop, test, and refine ad copy and creatives to maximize click-through and conversion rates.
Monitor and analyze campaign performance, providing actionable insights to improve results.
Optimize landing pages to enhance user experience, conversion rates, and Quality Score.
Stay updated on paid search trends, tools, and industry best practices to ensure competitive strategies.
Provide regular reports and presentations to clients and internal stakeholders, detailing campaign performance and recommendations.
Collaborate with internal teams to align paid search efforts with overall marketing strategies.
Work towards building and leading a paid search team as part of future growth.

Qualifications:
Minimum of 2 years of experience managing Google Ads and Bing Ads campaigns, preferably in the home services industry.
Proven expertise in conversion rate optimization and improving landing page experiences.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make informed decisions.
Self-starter with excellent time management and organizational skills.
Demonstrated ability to run campaigns with little to no supervision.
Familiarity with tools like Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and various ad management platforms.
Exceptional communication and presentation skills.
Leadership potential and an interest in building and managing a team.

Preferred Qualifications:
Google Ads and Bing Ads certifications.
Experience with A/B testing and multivariate testing.
Understanding of CRM platforms and their integration with paid search campaigns.

What We Offer:
Competitive salary based on experience.
Paid holidays, PTO (10 days in year 1, 15 days in year 2), and health & dental insurance.
Simple IRA with a 3% match.
Opportunities for professional growth and leadership development.
A supportive and collaborative work environment.

How to Apply: If you are passionate about paid search marketing and ready to take the next step in your career, we want to hear from you! Please apply using the link below.
Requirements
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Hours: 40 to 45 hours work
Required Education: High school or equivalent
Required Experience: Experienced(3) years

title: SEO Specialist
job_description:
Do you love nerding out on SEO and working with clients?
If your friends & family are sick of hearing about your latest search rankings, then we’re your kind of people and you will love this job.
$70-80k in year 1, depending on experience
You will get an absolute masterclass on SEO and working with clients. I wish I had a job like this when I started because it would have jump-started my career significantly.
100% remote
We're big into work/life balance. Half day Fridays and no after-hours or weekend work. After your first 60 days you get unlimited paid time off and we require a minimum of two 3-day weekends every quarter + 2 full-weeks off per year.
Your typical clients will have $3-10k/month retainers and be in the tech sector.
Retirement plan with company contributions.
We have strong processes in place to help you succeed.
If you're looking to learn a ton and grow your career, then this is the place for you.
Here is an unedited quote from someone currently in this role:
"Personally I like what I do here and I feel a sense of job satisfaction doing SEO for clients and seeing the results come in. The pay is competitive for the role, working remote works great with my lifestyle, and I enjoy working with like-minded individuals who also enjoy SEO. The push for continuing education also keeps me on point!"
COMPANY
Amplifyed is an SEO agency that serves cybersecurity and SaaS companies. We have 10 employees, all of whom are remote.
We are seeking a US-based person for full time, remote employment. It is a requirement to have 2+ years SEO experience in a client-facing role.
POSITION
The SEO Specialist is responsible for keeping our clients happy. You meet with clients (remotely), manage their SEO strategy, and ensure the content team and other vendors produce high quality work.
You should be good with people, have a strong work ethic while working remotely, and have SEO experience.
A typical day may involve meeting with a client on Zoom, doing SEO strategy, corresponding with other clients via email, checking on SEO results in a dashboard, and updating content.
REQUIREMENTS
Based in the US
2+ years in a client-facing position at a marketing or SEO agency
Passionate about SEO
The first 60 days you will be a contractor. If we are both excited about the direction you’re going, then you will be hired as a full-time employee with benefits and unlimited paid time off.

title: SEO Specialist
job_description:
Overview:
Corporate Tools is hiring an SEO Specialist for $65,000/year. You will be a traditional company employee. This is a full time 40 hour M-F position with company benefits. This is a remote position. Our main office is in Spokane WA, and we have satellite offices in Austin TX and Salt Lake City UT.
As an SEO Specialist, you’ll be responsible for ensuring our websites are doing everything they can to rank as high as they can in the SERPs. For starters, that will mean updating low-hanging fruit like meta descriptions and ensuring websites meet our in-house SEO standards. Our hope, however, is after fully coming to appreciate and understand our standards, you’ll be able to expand our methods using research, data and testing, becoming a true SEO ninja. Also, you’ll have a team of writers, front-end devs and designers to bring your schemes to life.
Our ideal candidate will have at least a couple years of experience successfully ranking and competing at a high-level on national terms. They will also have a solid understanding of technical SEO (from schema to sitemaps), the ability to use data to formulate a plan, and a willingness to make their plans happen.
Wage:
$65,000/year
Benefits:
100% employer-paid medical, dental and vision for employees
Annual review with raise option
22 days Paid Time Off accrued annually, and 4 holidays
After 3 years, PTO increases to 29 days. Employees transition to flexible time off after 5 years with the company—not accrued, not capped, take time off when you want
The 4 holidays are: New Year’s Day, Fourth of July, Thanksgiving, and Christmas Day
Paid Maternity and Paternity Leave
Up to 5% company matching 401(k) with no vesting period
Quarterly allowance
Use to make your remote work set up more comfortable, for continuing education classes, a plant for your desk, coffee for your coworker, a massage for yourself... really, whatever
Open concept office with friendly coworkers
Creative environment where you can make a difference
No dumb benefits like free dog walking on the weekends that snobby hipster places have to make you feel cool, but mathematically won't cost the company much money because you won't use it
Trail Mix Bar
- oh yeah
Responsibilities:
Ensure our websites and pages rank for a wide variety of keywords.
Work with our writers, designers and front-end devs to create high ranking content and websites.
Optimize all things SEO—information architecture, structured data, crawling and indexing, page speed, etc.
Audit SEO performance, identifying issues and potential sources.
Conduct SEO experiments and draw conclusions from results.
Produce reports on topics such as traffic, rankings and experiments.
Balance SEO goals with branding & other company objectives.
Stay on top of industry changes, algorithm changes, and best practices.
Requirements:
Two years of SEO experience in a full time, professional capacity
Proficiency with a wide variety of SEO tools, such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, GTM, Ahrefs, SEMrush, etc.
Experience with technical SEO (schemas, URL structures, rendering issues, crawl performance, etc.)
Posses strong communication and time management skills
Demonstrable experience ranking for highly competitive national terms
Familiarity with WordPress, HTML/CSS/JavaScript
SEO Specialist
Remote | Spokane | Austin | SLC

title: Senior SEO Content Specialist
job_description:
About the Role
VetClaims.AI helps veterans win the benefits they earned—quickly, accurately, and without bureaucratic bullshit. We’re a high-growth startup run by veterans and built for veterans. We’re not a corporate marketing team; we move fast, speak directly, and expect results.
We’re looking for a senior SEO (Content) Specialist who knows how to operate without handholding. Someone who can research, write, and execute a content strategy that dominates search rankings in the veteran benefits space. If you’ve got the track record, the mindset, and the skill to lead our SEO without needing a playbook—you’ll fit right in.
This is a mission-first company, and our content has real impact on people who served.
What You’ll Do
Own our SEO and content strategy from top to bottom—acquisition, rankings, and revenue attribution.
Research, write, and edit landing pages, blog posts, product copy, and campaign captions with both SEO and conversion in mind.
Run competitive keyword research and stay ahead of shifting VA policy, Google updates, and veteran search behavior.
Build and manage a living content calendar—driven by data, not guesswork.
Conduct ongoing audits to improve existing content and optimize internal linking, structure, and readability.
Track, measure, and report on SEO KPIs: rankings, traffic, CTR, conversions, and content-driven revenue.
Serve as a subject matter expert on veteran-related terminology, conditions, and claims processes.
Create content that’s not just SEO-optimized but actually useful to veterans navigating a broken system.
Collaborate with leadership and marketing, but operate with full autonomy.
What We’re Looking For
5+ years in SEO content roles, preferably in competitive niches or mission-driven companies.
A portfolio or case studies that prove you can grow organic traffic and drive conversion—don’t just tell us, show us.
Serious writing chops—concise, clean, compelling copy across long-form and conversion copy formats.
Strong understanding of the VA system, veteran culture, and the nuances of writing for this audience (personal or professional experience both welcome).
Fully capable of owning SEO tools and workflows: GSC, Ahrefs/SEMrush, Screaming Frog, Surfer, etc.
Deep knowledge of Google’s ranking signals, E-E-A-T, and modern content strategy.
You think in terms of outcomes—not tasks—and you’re the kind of person who pushes hard because it matters.
Why You’ll Like Working Here
We’re veterans helping veterans. That’s the mission. It’s real, and it matters.
You’ll have full ownership over SEO. No micro-managers, no red tape.
Our culture is direct. We value results, clarity, and honesty.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $78,328.00 - $115,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Dental insurance
Employee discount
Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Paid time off
Professional development assistance
Referral program
Vision insurance
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Choose your own hours
Weekends as needed
Application Question(s):
Are you a veteran or do you have experience with veterans and the VA?
Why are you the SEO specialist to take us to the next level?
Work Location: Remote

title: SEO Content Specialist
job_description:
Paytronix is a cloud-based digital guest engagement platform for the hospitality industry. Our innovative, unified platform provides loyalty programs, online ordering, gift cards, branded mobile applications, and strategic insights to more than 1,800 leading restaurant and convenience store brands. Our valued clients leverage the power of Paytronix across 50,000 sites globally to create seamless, personalized, and brand-authentic experiences that foster lasting relationships with their customers. For more than 20 years, Paytronix has been a trusted partner helping brands maximize the lifetime value of their guests and grow more profitable businesses. For more information, visit www.paytronix.com.
Role Overview:
As the SEO Content Specialist at Paytronix, you'll play a vital role in ensuring that all our content published in HubSpot is well-written, brand-aligned, and optimized for SEO performance based on strategic direction provided by Paytronix's Content Marketing Manager. You'll be responsible for proofreading, editing, and refining content to meet high standards of clarity, grammar, and style, while making sure SEO potential is maximized from the date of publication.
This role involves working closely with the Paytronix Content Marketing Manager (CMM) who provides strategic direction on content marketing initiatives and Upwork freelance content writers to ensure our written content is engaging, error-free, and optimized for our B2B audiences in the restaurant and convenience store (c-store) industries.
What You'll Do:
Work closely with the CMM and Upwork freelance writers to assign articles based on the editorial calendar, edit pieces for accuracy, and publish to Paytronix's blog on a regular cadence.
Create and assign article outlines based on editorial and strategic direction provided by the CMM, providing feedback to writers on sentence structure, key points, and overall flow of articles.
Write new sections of content for existing articles or write brand new articles based on initiatives provided by the CMM.
Proofread and edit content for accuracy, grammar, spelling, punctuation, and overall quality.
Ensure that all content adheres to Paytronix's in-house style guide and brand voice across digital publishing platforms.
Review and revise content for readability, clarity, tone, and flow, ensuring the content is engaging and on-brand.
Conduct fact-checking and research to verify the accuracy of information included in written content.
Ensure all material within your area of involvement is optimized for SEO where relevant and formatted properly for HubSpot.
Manage multiple projects and prioritize deadlines to ensure content is delivered on time.
Stay current with content marketing best practices, SEO trends, and digital marketing strategies to ensure the continued relevance and effectiveness of SEO content and related website copy, like internal linking, SEO information gain, and content-related user experience.
What You Need to Be the Right Fit:
2-3 years of SEO research, writing, and editorial experience for a digital publication or B2B company.
Exceptional grasp of English grammar, spelling, and punctuation, with a keen eye for detail.
Proficiency in applying popular style guidelines such as the Chicago Manual of Style or AP Stylebook, as well as internal style guidelines like our SEO Blog Content Style Guide and How to Write Substantive Content Confluence guide.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
Experience collaborating with writers, designers, and marketing teams.
Familiarity with content management systems (CMSs) like HubSpot and Microsoft Office.
Preferred Qualifications and Experience:
Experience in the hospitality, tech, restaurant, or convenience store industries.
Familiarity with SEO best practices and experience optimizing copy for search engines.
Familiarity with digital publishing tools and software like HubSpot and Surfer SEO.
Role Reports To:
The SEO Content Specialist reports to the Paytronix Content Marketing Manager.
Salary range: $65k-$70k

Benefits:
At Paytronix, we offer a wide variety of benefits aimed at allowing our employees to prioritize their well-being, and be their best selves:
Retirement:
Paytronix allows employees to contribute to their 401k through Fidelity. The company plan matches 100% of the first 5% of an employee's contribution based on individual salary.
Medical:
Paytronix offers medical and dental benefits through Blue Cross Blue Shield, and vision insurance through EyeMed.
Paytronix offers plans to contribute to Health Savings Accounts (HSA).
Personal:
Employees that are expecting receive a generous Parental Leave offering.
Paytronix offers company-paid Short-term and Long-term Disability, and Life Insurances.
Accrued PTO (Paid Time Off), off during public holidays, and "floating" holidays.
Voluntary benefits include:
Protection from identity theft.
Legal coverage for matters including, but not limited to: home and real estate, estate planning, and elder care.

title: SEO & Website Performance Manager
job_description:
Company Overview
Melone Hatley, P.C. is a fast-growing family and estate planning law firm with offices across Virginia, Florida, South Carolina, and Texas. Named one of the 500 fastest-growing law firms in the United States and recognized by Super Lawyers, we've built our reputation on delivering compassionate, high-quality legal services and creating a workplace where talent thrives.
Our mission is simple: to be the premier law firm for individuals looking to protect what matters most — their families, their finances, and their future. We achieve this by fostering a culture rooted in transparency, integrity, and open communication. Every team member plays a vital role in delivering personalized, results-driven support to our clients, and we're proud to be known as one of the top employers in the region.
Join us and become part of a team that is redefining family and estate law with purpose, passion, and people at the center of everything we do.
Position Overview
The SEO & Website Performance Manager role is highly technical, requiring a deep understanding of both SEO and web performance optimization to ensure the website not only ranks well but also delivers a superior user experience.
Key Responsibilities:
Site Maintenance & Performance Monitoring:
Regularly monitoring website uptime, speed, and overall performance.
Conducting routine checks to ensure the website is functioning smoothly and efficiently.
Identifying and resolving any technical issues that may impact user experience or site performance.
Technical SEO Optimization:
Performing in-depth technical SEO audits to identify and fix issues related to indexing, crawlability, site architecture, and more.
Implementing structured data, schema markup, and other advanced SEO techniques.
Enhancing site speed, mobile responsiveness, and ensuring the site meets core web vitals.
Keyword Research & Content Gap Analysis:
Conducting keyword research to identify opportunities for improving site ranking and targeting relevant search queries.
Performing content gap analysis to identify missing or underperforming content on the site.
Working with content creators to optimize existing content and develop new content that targets high-value keywords.
Backlink Audits & Off-Page SEO:
Conducting backlink audits to identify and disavow toxic or harmful backlinks.
Developing strategies to acquire high-quality backlinks that improve domain authority and search rankings.
Monitoring and reporting on the impact of link-building efforts.
Website Updates & Technical Implementation:
Making changes to the website’s structure, design, or content management system (CMS) to improve performance and SEO.
Collaborating with developers to implement technical SEO recommendations and ensure that the website adheres to best practices.
Regularly updating the site with new content, features, or functionalities as needed.
Analytics & Reporting:
Using tools like Google Analytics, Search Console, and other SEO tools to track website performance.
Reporting on key metrics such as site speed, search rankings, traffic, and conversion rates.
Using data-driven insights to inform ongoing optimization efforts.
Qualifications and Skills:
Strong technical knowledge of web development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and SEO.
Proficiency with SEO tools such as Ahrefs, SEMrush, Moz, or Screaming Frog.
Experience in performing technical SEO audits and implementing fixes.
Familiarity with CMS platforms like WordPress, Joomla, or Drupal.
Ability to analyze data and generate actionable insights to improve website performance.
Benefits:
100% Employer Paid Medical Benefits for Employees and Dependents
Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
401 (k) Matching
Paid Time Off and Holiday Pay
Work Environment:
Full-time position (8-hour shift)
Remote position
Join Our Team!
If you are an organized and motivated individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is eager to contribute to a team dedicated to family law, we would love to meet you. Join us at Melone Hatley, PC where you can grow your career and make a meaningful impact!
Melone Hatley, PC is an equal opportunity employer.

The Digital Marketing Recruiters
Digital Marketing Recruiters has been in the digital marketing and recruitment space for over 25 years. We work with highly skilled marketing, digital marketing, and sales professionals and match them with our clients from diverse industries across the United States. Our selection process incorporates comprehensive resume screening, shortlisting, conducting video-recorded interviews and providing client information, administering written assessments (if required by the client), arranging client interviews, and facilitating job offers and placements.
The Client
The client is a successful, reputable, and profitable multimedia company looking to grow and expand their digital marketing division.
The Role
As the Email Marketing and Content Strategist, you will own the planning, execution, and optimization of email marketing campaigns and content strategy. Your role blends creative storytelling with data-driven decision-making to engage audiences, drive traffic, and increase conversions.
Key Responsibilities
Email Marketing
Plan and execute email campaigns, including newsletters, drip sequences, promotions, and behavioral automation.
Build and manage customer journeys using platforms like Klaviyo, HubSpot, Mailchimp, or ActiveCampaign.
Segment email lists to personalize messaging and improve engagement.
A/B test subject lines, CTAs, layouts, and content to increase open and conversion rates.
Monitor campaign metrics (open, click-through, unsubscribe, conversions) and optimize based on performance.
Content Strategy
Develop and manage a content calendar aligned with overall marketing goals and customer lifecycle stages.
Collaborate with internal teams to craft blog posts, landing page content, lead magnets, and social media copy.
Ensure consistency in brand voice, tone, and style across all touchpoints.
Conduct audience and keyword research to inform content themes and improve SEO performance.
Measure content performance and adjust strategies to improve reach, engagement, and conversion.
Qualifications
3–5 years of experience in email marketing, content strategy, or digital communications.
Proven experience with email marketing platforms (Klaviyo, HubSpot, Mailchimp, or similar).
Solid understanding of content marketing strategy, email performance metrics, and conversion optimization.
Strong writing, editing, and proofreading skills with a portfolio of past content/email work.
Experience using tools like Google Analytics, GA4, Looker Studio, or SEMrush.
Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Strong collaboration skills and attention to detail.
Preferred (nice to have)
Experience in e-commerce, SaaS, healthcare, or B2B environments.
Familiarity with SEO best practices and keyword optimization.
Basic design skills using Canva, Figma, or Adobe tools.
Working knowledge of HTML/CSS for email formatting and troubleshooting.
Benefits
Health, dental, and vision.
3 weeks of PTO.
Stipend for both internet and cell phone
All equipment provided for the home office.
All travel expenses are covered by the company.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $65,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year
Work Location: Remote

title: Marketing Manager
job_description:
Robert Half is partnering with a leading global consumer technology company to hire a Marketing Manager to support product launch and lifecycle marketing initiatives across a suite of connected devices and services. This role is part of a dynamic and collaborative North America marketing team responsible for bringing new products to market and sustaining customer engagement across the device portfolio—including smart home, entertainment, AI-powered assistants, and emerging tech categories.

Location : Remote (PST hours)
Duration : 4-month contract
Pay Rate : $30-33/hour
Hours : 40/week

This contract role will support high-visibility fall marketing campaigns and help drive operational excellence across fast-paced, cross-functional workstreams.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead and execute onsite marketing efforts to support new product launches in North America.
Plan and deliver digital campaigns, including web placements, email marketing, and third-party content.
Develop and manage marketing content for the company’s e-commerce site, partnering with designers on layout and creative execution.
Produce sales tools and collateral for field and event marketing.
Track and analyze performance metrics, identifying areas of opportunity to optimize results.
Collaborate with stakeholders across product, channel, content, and design teams to align plans and deliverables.
Balance multiple priorities, timelines, and approvals in a high-volume environment.

Qualifications:
3+ years of experience in marketing, with a focus on product marketing, project management, or digital campaign execution.
Experience with onsite or e-commerce marketing is highly preferred.
Excellent communication and writing skills with a strong attention to detail.
Proven ability to work cross-functionally and manage input from multiple stakeholders.
Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to meet quick deadlines.
Data-driven mindset with experience presenting campaign results and insights.

Preferred Attributes:
Experience supporting launches in consumer tech or fast-paced product organizations.
Familiarity with marketing operations or content management systems.

Core Traits for Success:
Proactive and accountable from start to finish.
Focused on quality execution and measurable impact.
Thrives in deadline-driven environments and moves with urgency.

Innovation starts with people. ®

title: Content Writer
job_description:
Who we are…
Modern Campus empowers 2,000+ higher education institutions to thrive when transformation is required to respond to lower student enrollments and revenue, rising costs, crushing student debt, and administrative complexity.
The Modern Campus learner-to-earner lifecycle platform power solutions for web content management, conversational text messaging, catalog and curriculum management, career pathways, student engagement and development, and non-traditional student management. The result: innovative institutions engage their modern learners for life, while providing modern administrators with the tool needed to streamline workflows and drive high efficiency.
Learn how Modern Campus is leading the modern learner-to-earner movement at moderncampus.com and follow us on LinkedIn.
What’s the role?
Modern Campus is looking for a skilled and strategic Content Writer to craft compelling stories and content that resonate with higher education leaders. In this role, you’ll create and optimize high-impact assets—from blogs and articles to eBooks, guides, and landing pages—that drive engagement, educate our audience, and support campaign goals across the learner-to-earner lifecycle.
This role is essential in amplifying Modern Campus’s voice, showcasing customer success, and communicating the value of our solutions: CMS, Message, Involve, Connected Curriculum, and Lifelong Learning.
Content Creation
Write engaging, clear, and persuasive content tailored to higher education decision-makers including Marketing, Enrollment, Student Affairs, and Continuing Ed leaders.
Support demand generation, product marketing, and customer marketing initiatives with content assets such as:
Blog posts
Web copy
Product guides and sell sheets
eBooks and whitepapers
Content Optimization & Strategy
Align content with SEO best practices to increase organic traffic and search rankings.
Collaborate with campaign managers to ensure messaging consistency across channels and lifecycle stages.
Repurpose existing content into new formats (e.g., turning a whitepaper into a blog series or webinar deck).
Brand Voice & Messaging
Maintain a consistent tone and voice that aligns with Modern Campus’s brand—professional, higher ed fluent, and customer-obsessed.
Integrate storytelling and data to illustrate product value, student impact, and institutional outcomes.
What you offer…
3+ years of experience in content writing, preferably in B2B SaaS or higher education sectors.
Strong portfolio showcasing long-form and short-form content.
Ability to translate complex topics into engaging and accessible narratives.
SEO and keyword research experience.
Familiarity with CMS platforms, marketing automation tools, and basic analytics.
Understanding of the higher education market, including the roles and needs of academic and administrative staff.
Experience writing for personas such as Enrollment Leaders, Provosts, Student Affairs professionals, or CE/Workforce Directors.
What we offer…
The base salary range* for this full-time position is between $50,000-$60,000
Remote first workplace! – must be located in North America
Rewards and recognition programs
Learning and development opportunities
You will make a difference every day for universities trying to grow and students trying to learn.
Only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
What we believe…
At Modern Campus, we believe that a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace furthers relevance, resilience, and longevity. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply for our positions. Modern Campus is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is committed to bring on hires regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status (for US candidates). If you require accommodations during any part of the interview process due to a disability, please let our recruiter know.

Our salary ranges reflect the minimum and maximum target for new hires for the position within the US and Canada. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

title: Content Manager
job_description:
Overview
NMFA seeks a skilled and independent Content Manager to join our team. The Content Manager is a strategic storyteller responsible for creating, curating, and managing compelling content that elevates NMFA’s mission to support military families. The Content Manager develops and maintains the content calendar, produces engaging multimedia, including Reels, and crafts written content that connects with NMFA’s audiences across digital platforms. The Content Manager generates content ranging from interviews and articles to SEO-optimized blog posts and social media campaigns. The Content Manager ensures our voice remains consistent, powerful, and mission-aligned.
Essential Job Functions
· Develop, manage, and execute a strategic content calendar aligned with our marketing and fundraising goals
· Plan, script, and produce Reels and short-form videos that highlight the impact of NMFA programs and campaigns
· Conduct interviews with military families, program participants, and subject matter experts to create original written content, including articles, blog posts, and success stories
· Write, edit, and publish high-quality, SEO-driven content for digital platforms
· Repurpose content across multiple formats (social media, web, email, video) to extend reach and engagement.
· Collaborate with Advancement and Advocacy teams to translate complex topics into accessible, inspiring content
· Maintain and update content assets in SharePoint and Canva; ensure accuracy, consistency, and version control
· Track content performance metrics to guide ongoing improvements
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
· Proven advanced writing and editing skills with a strong portfolio of published work
· Excellent verbal and written communication skills tailored to varied audiences
· Attention to detail and strong analytical skills
· Ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team
· Proactive problem-solving and time management
· Strong creative thinking and content ideation skills
· Ability to multitask, meet deadlines, and work collaboratively across teams
Job Qualifications and Competencies
High comfort level with multimedia content creation
Knowledge of SEO best practices and digital marketing trends
Proficiency in tools such as Canva, SharePoint, WordPress, and major social platforms
Mission-driven mindset and commitment to NMFA’s values
Understanding of or connection to the military family experience is strongly preferred
Compensation$27-28/hour About NMFA
To Apply: Please send a cover letter, resume, and compensation requirements to r@militaryfamily.org.
About NMFA
The National Military Family Association (NMFA) is the leading nonprofit dedicated to serving all military families. Since 1969, NMFA has worked with families to identify and solve the unique challenges of military life through advocacy and programs. NMFA provides scholarships for military spouses, camps for military kids, and programs for military teens. The Association’s research creates a better understanding of the experience of today’s military families. NMFA serves the families of the currently serving, veteran, retired, wounded, or fallen members of the Army, Marine Corps, Navy, Air Force, Space Force, Coast Guard, and Commissioned Corps of the USPHS and NOAA. To learn more and get involved, visit www.MilitaryFamily.org
Job Type: Part-time
Pay: $27.00 - $28.00 per hour
Expected hours: 20 per week
Schedule:
4 hour shift
Choose your own hours
Application Question(s):
Do you have an understanding of military family life?
Work Location: Remote

title: Content Marketing Manager
job_description:
Do you want to empower organizations to build smarter compensation strategies while ensuring fair pay for all employees?
Syndio is a Series C technology company leveraging advanced technology and responsible AI to accelerate decision-making, streamline compliance, and democratize insights for consistent, equitable compensation practices at scale. Backed by $83M in investments from Bessemer Venture Partners, Voyager Capital, and Emerson Collective, we are expanding our team and products to help companies align their rewards strategies with their business goals.
Our customers are our greatest asset. Syndio partners with many of the world's most recognized and respected enterprises, helping them implement leading-edge compensation solutions with expert guidance. We analyze pay for over 10 million employees across dozens of countries, ensuring fair, defensible rewards that drive better business outcomes.
Join us in our mission to help companies make smarter pay decisions they can trust!
About the Role
The Content Marketing Manager will join the Marketing team to create clear, compelling content across all formats — helping Syndio stand out, engage customers, and bring clarity to the market about what we do and the unique value we provide.
You'll develop deep empathy for our buyers and stakeholders to understand their fears, hopes, and opportunities, and use this knowledge to educate and influence them throughout their journey. You'll partner with analytics, demand gen, sales, and product teams to test messaging and experiment with new content types. Data will be your best friend to empower continuous improvement.
You'll thrive in this role if you're a empathetic individual who excels at collaborating with colleagues across all levels and teams. You'll leverage your exceptional writing skills and passion for creation, especially as you utilize AI to enhance speed and creativity. This role is perfect for an individual who brings strong judgment and has exceptional taste in content that resonates with multiple audiences. We're especially excited about how out-of-the-box thinking can help us cut through the noise.
This position is ideal for someone who can handle ambiguity, has a bias for action, and has experience in startups — or who knows they're wired for the pace and energy of one. If you're a strong writer who loves to create, works well with colleagues across functions and levels, and are excited about using AI as an enabler of speed and creativity, keep reading!
Why this job is exciting
Be the steward of the story. Write and produce blogs, thought leadership assets, web copy, videos, newsletters, and more with messages that educate, inspire, and convert.
Guide the buyer journey. Create content that meets prospects where they are, from first click to closed-won — tailored by channel, persona, and intent.
Partner with experts. Collaborate with internal subject-matter experts to turn trends and market signals into standout content that elevates our expert voice and sets us apart from generic, AI-generated copy.
Lead campaigns. Work across teams to shape and run integrated marketing campaigns that drive engagement and results.
Focus on measurement. Use data to guide content strategy — tracking performance, SEO impact, and pipeline contribution to double down on what works.
Experiment often. Embrace AI tools to accelerate research, ideation, and content creation, while helping to scale those wins across the org.
Grow fast. Expand your strategic and creative range on a team that values clarity, innovation, and bold thinking in a rapidly evolving category.
About You
Skilled writer with strong editorial judgment and the ability to adapt voice and tone across formats and audiences.
Curious and creative, with a passion for experimenting with AI tools — paired with critical thinking to synthesize and simplify outputs into clear, compelling messages.
Data-aware and driven by results, able to use performance insights to refine content strategy and execution.
Organized, collaborative, and comfortable working cross-functionally to connect dots across teams and deliver high-impact content.
Adaptable and proactive, ready to pivot, test, and evolve with changing needs of the team, business, and customers.
A "Swiss army knife" who's excited to work across formats, functions, and ideas.
Bonus Points
B2B content marketing/editorial background
Strong portfolio of full-funnel and thought leadership content
Experience contributing to or leading integrated campaigns
Why you'll love it here:
Check out our Employee Experience page for more information on our Mission & Values, Work-Life Balance, Pay Transparency, Diversity, Culture, and Benefits.
Competitive Compensation. For this role our salary is targeted at $99-$115k USD per year. Final offer amounts are determined by factors such as experience and expertise. We take a geo neutral approach to compensation within the US, meaning that we pay based on job function and level, not location.
Syndio Equity. So you can share in Syndio's success.
Flexible Vacation Policy. We encourage our team to recharge when they need to, plus paid sick & safe time, compassion leave, and voting leave.
Paid parental leave.
Medical, Dental, Vision. Syndio pays 90% of employee premiums, and 50% for dependents.
Life Insurance & Disability. Syndio covers the full premium.
401(k). To help you save for your future
Fully remote model - #LI-Remote
Role progression:
Within 1 month, you'll complete onboarding, get familiar with Syndio's platform and priorities, and connect with key stakeholders across marketing and other functions.
Within 3 months, you'll lead the development of Syndio's monthly newsletter, take ownership of campaign content, start supporting SEO/GEO initiatives, and introduce new ideas for content format. You'll also be actively learning AI tools to enhance content workflows across the team.
Within 6 months, you'll lead key content initiatives, manage the content and campaign calendar, and track performance of content on pipeline and customer engagement. , and actively experiment with AI to improve content creation and workflows.
Interview overview
Below you'll find an outline of the interview plan for our Content Marketing Manager position. Please note that while this is what we expect the process to look like, we may ask you for supplemental information or require an additional step before making a final decision.
Recruiter Screen - 25min
Hiring Manager - 30min
Loop - 1.5 hrs consisting of three 30min video calls with departmental peers and cross-functional team members
Document Submission + Follow-up with Hiring Manager - 45 mins
Final Interview with VP of Marketing - 30 min
At Syndio, we're building a diverse team that values candor, curiosity, and community. If you share these values and are interested in joining us, we'd love to talk with you even if you don't 100% meet the "about you" listed here. We don't expect anyone to have all the answers, as long as you're willing to learn and grow with us.
Syndio is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are building an inclusive and collaborative workplace as we grow, and we welcome team members regardless of gender/identity, sexual orientation, race or cultural background, religion, physical disability and age.

title: SEO Manager
job_description:
Location
Remote U.S.
Employment Type
Full time
Location Type
Remote
Department
Marketing
Compensation
Cash Range $119K – $140K • Offers Equity • This role is also eligible for medical benefits, 401(k) plan, and other company perk programs.

At Vanta, our mission is to secure the internet and protect consumer data. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it.
As an SEO Manager at Vanta, you’ll play a vital role in developing, executing, and scaling our SEO program. Reporting to the Senior SEO Manager on the Web team, you’ll partner with PMM, Content, Comms and Brand studio to execute on projects that boost Vanta’s search visibility across search engines and LLMs. The ultimate goal of the SEO program is to contribute to pipeline generation.
What you’ll do as a SEO Manager at Vanta:
Help lead and implement comprehensive SEO and AEO strategies that increase organic traffic, brand visibility, and drive pipeline.
Research, architect, and orchestrate ICP-centric content experiences—blog posts, content hubs, resources, and more—that engage and convert.
Collaborate with PMM, Content, and security/compliance subject-matter experts to build and execute a SEO editorial roadmap aligned with product and messaging priorities.
Create and manage a backlog of experiments and optimizations (FAQs, content layout tweaks, video integration, CTAs, schema markup, and more).
Partner with Comms and external agencies on digital-PR initiatives that earn authoritative backlinks and brand mentions to amplify our brand search visibility.
Monitor and evaluate SEO performance, report on key metrics, and refine tactics based on insights.
How to be successful in this role:
You have 3-5+ years of SEO experience–preferably in a high-growth enterprise SaaS business–with a record of delivering measurable growth.
Proficiency in SEO tools, such as GA4, Google Search Console, SEMRush, Ahrefs, Sitebulb, etc.
You are leveraging AI in your daily workflows to amplify your impact and output
You think like both a content strategist and engineer, balancing big-picture planning and refinement of defensible content systems.
You are excited about optimizing for LLMs and adapting to the new zero-click paradigm.
You are a strong collaborator and communicator who can build relationships with cross-functional teams and agencies.
Experience with programmatic SEO, YouTube SEO, and localization strategies is a plus
What you can expect as a Vantan:
Industry-competitive compensation
100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage
16 weeks fully-paid parental Leave for all new parents
Health & wellness and remote workplace stipends
Family planning benefits through Carrot Fertility
401(k) matching
Flexible work hours and location
Open PTO policy
11 paid holidays in the US
Offices in SF, NYC, London, Dublin, and Sydney
To provide greater transparency to candidates, we share base pay ranges for all US-based job postings regardless of state. We set standard base pay ranges for all roles based on function, level, and country location, benchmarked against similar-stage growth companies. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors and may vary based on candidate location, skills, depth of work experience, and relevant licenses/credentials.
#LI-remote
At Vanta, we are committed to hiring diverse talent of different backgrounds and as such, it is important to us to provide an inclusive work environment for all. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender identity, age, religion, sexual orientation, veteran or disability status, or any other protected class. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage and welcome people of all backgrounds to apply.
About Vanta
We started in 2018, in the wake of several high-profile data breaches. Online security was only becoming more important, but we knew firsthand how hard it could be for fast-growing companies to invest the time and manpower it takes to build a solid security foundation. Vanta was inspired by a vision to restore trust in internet businesses by enabling companies to improve and prove their security.From our early days automating security monitoring for compliance standards like SOC 2, HIPAA and ISO 27001 to creating the world's leading Trust Management Platform, our vision remains unchanged.
Now more than ever, making security continuous—not just a point-in-time check— is essential. Thousands of companies rely on Vanta to build, maintain and demonstrate their trust— all in a way that's real-time and transparent.
